loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José Luis tiene 33 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el Caserío El Frayle, una zona rural del distrito de Santo Tomás una comunidad con abundante vegetación, de un clima variado su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la cría y comercialización de ganado vacuno, posee cuatro reses de su propiedad y tiene sembrado dos Has de inverna donde cría su ganado vacuno, su esposa le apoya en esta labor ordeñando las vacas para posteriormente elaborar de manera artesanal el queso fresco, quesillo y de esta manera ofrecerlo en el mercado de su distrito.

José ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de una ternera para posteriormente mejorar la producción de su ganado lechero.
texts.en:
José Luis is 33 years old and lives with his wife in the village of El Frayle, a rural area in the District of Santo Tomás that is known for its abundant vegetation and varied climate. The people engage in agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding. This community is located in Cutervo Province, which is part of the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru.

José Luis raises and sells cattle. He owns four heads of cattle and has planted two hectares during the winter where his cattle graze. His wife helps with milking the cows. She also uses the milk to make fresh cheese and soft cheese that she sells at the district market.

José is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1,000 PEN so that he can buy a calf that he can raise to help improve dairy production in the future.

loans.use: to buy a calf for future dairy production.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 33 years old and has one child in school. Cheryl works very hard to provide for them.

Cheryl's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Cheryl has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with a safe shelter.

Cheryl has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Cheryl is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future, would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Maria Morina

texts.en:
Maria Morina works hard to support her family. She is single and sells toys in the Philippines.

Maria Morina requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional toys to sell.

She has been in this business for three years now and earns additional income from selling balut.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional toys to sell.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Maricel works hard to support her family.

She has a charcoal sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Maricel is borrowing 9,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to purchase additional charcoal to resell.

Maricel has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 22-year-old single guy living in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with his family. Mohammad is currently a laborer at a workshop. At the same time, he is a university student majoring in sports training, and he is in his third year. He is planning to find a better job in his field of study after graduation in order to support his family financially because he has noticed a financial crisis, which is not allowing them to be able to pay for his upcoming semester tuition. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy several heads of cattle and to pay off an outstanding debt.

loans.name: Luis Edgar

texts.es:
Luis tiene 25 años de edad de estado civil soltero vive con familiares en el recinto el tesoro del cantón Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla de los Emprendedores  se encuentra ubicada a 20 minutos de la oficina operativa Guaranda, está formada por 10 socios que son de la misma comunidad, y que se dedican a la agricultura.
Luis se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, y al engorde de cerdos. Solicita el crédito para la compra de cerdos. La compra lo realiza en Echeandía. Su meta es tener un buen negocio. Su desafío es contar con un negocio propio. En su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte y la costumbre que le gusta es el carnaval.
texts.en:
Luis is 25 years old, single, and lives with relatives in the neighborhood of El Tesoro in the canton of Guaranda, which is in Bolívar Province. He is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Emprendedores” (The Entrepreneurs), which is located 20 minutes away from the Cooperativa San Jose office that operates in Guaranda. The group includes 10 members who are from the same community. They engage in agriculture.

Luis is a farmer who grows corn, but he also raises pigs for fattening. He is requesting a loan in order to buy pigs. The animals will be purchased in Echeandía. His goal is to have a good business, but his challenge is dealing with business ownership.

Luis likes to play sports in his free time and he enjoys the custom known as Carnival.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Los Unido Group

texts.es: Argelia, tiene 38 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 3 hijos y vive en una aldea de Concepción del sur, Santa Barbara. Hace 3 años que ella se dedica a la cría y engorde de cerdos para vender. Los cerdos  los vende en la misma zona donde vive. El préstamo que solicita es en forma grupal y es el tercer ciclo, el grupo se llama Los Unido, se integra por tres miembros quienes solicitan 10,000 lempiras cada uno haciendo un total de 30,000 lempiras. Argelia al igual que los demás miembros van a invertir en al compra de concentrados y vitaminas para la cría y engorde de cerdos. Su objetivo es obtener mejor ganancias y mejorar su condición de vida con sus hijos. En la foto a la izquierda esta don Jose, Argelia y a la derecha esta Aracely.
texts.en:
Argelia is 38 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in a neighborhood of Concepción del Sur, Santa Barbara.

Argelia has been raising and fattening pigs to sell for three years. The pigs are sold in the same area where she lives. The loan she is requesting as part of a group will be her third one. Her group is called “Los Unido” and consists of three members. They are requesting 10,000 HNL each for a total of 30,000 HNL. Like the other members, Argelia will invest in the purchase of concentrated feed and vitamins for raising and fattening pigs. Her goal is to generate better earnings so that she can improve the living conditions for her children.

In the photo, from left to right, are Don Jose, Argelia, and Aracely.

loans.use: to buy concentrated pig feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en: Herbert, aged 32 years, is married and lives in Hoima, Uganda. In 2000, Herbert started a stationary and secretarial bureau and earns additional income from construction business. Students, offices and schools are his major clients. He started the business to boost his family income. He desires to expand his business into new markets but is limited by late payments from debtors. He is acquiring a loan to buy more stationary for selling.

loans.use: to buy more stationary for selling.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is married with one child. She is 52 years old, and her one child is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Josefina's house was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Josefina has restarted and is committed to regaining what she lost. Josefina is taking out a 10,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Josefina has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Josefina would like to save enough to provide a secure future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 21 years old and is majoring in politics at one of the Jordanian universities. At the same time, he works at a clothes store. He is requesting an educational loan to pay for his next semester's tuition so that he will be able to work in his field of study and start helping his family financially.

loans.use: to pay for his next semester's tuition fees.

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en:
Mwanarusi is a divorced woman with four children who go to school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanarusi has operated a cafe business making consumables like rice, tea, beans and chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbors. She cites seasonality as a major challenge. She joined Yehu to boost her business. With this 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase stock of goods, maize flour, wheat flour and rice for the business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods, maize flour, wheat flour and rice for her business.

loans.name: Narcisa Irene

texts.es: Narcisa es una señora joven de 23 años, ella vive con su esposo y su hijo de 4 años de edad y se encuentra asistiendo a la escuela. Ella es una señora luchadora que les cuida muy bien a sus chanchos para que sea un negocio rentable, su esposo se dedica a trabajo en el campo. Narcisa comenta que Fodemi le ha dado la oportunidad de crecer ya que empezó con créditos de esta organización. El crédito lo va a va utilizar para comprar cerdos. La mayor aspiración de Narcisa es que su negocio siga mejorando para poder sustentar los gastos de educación de su hijo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos
texts.en:
Narcisa, 23, lives with her husband and her 4-year-old son, who is going to school.  She is a hard-working woman who looks after her pigs very well so that they provide her with a profitable business.  Her husband works in the countryside.  

Narcisa tells us that Fodemi has given her the opportunity to expand her business since she started asking for loans from this organization.  She is going to use this loan to buy pigs.  

Her greatest desire is for her business to keep growing so she can pay for her son’s education, as this is her only source of income.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Blanca Nubia

texts.es: Doña Blanca, se dedica a vender comida por encargo, de estos ingresos mantiene los  estudios de su hija y los gastos del hogar, con el apoyo de crédito ha venido haciéndole mejoras a su hogar siendo una mujer soltera busca la manera de progreso. Hoy en día solicita el financiamiento para continuar invirtiendo en su vivienda para construir un baño.
texts.en: Blanca sells food to order and from the profits she makes, she pays for her daughter’s education and takes care of household expenses.  With the help of these loans, she has been making improvements to her home.  She is a single woman and she needs to use these ways to get on in life.  Now, she is asking for a loan to continue investing in home improvements.  She wants to build a bathroom.

loans.use: to buy cement, building blocks, sand, a toilet and accessories.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sabougnouma est composé uniquement de femmes monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 43 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Banconi un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, charbon de bois, produits cosmétiques et des habits. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Rokia (femme debout à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des produits cosmétiques. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 cartons de pommades et 3 cartons parfums                                                                                                       à Bamako en gros. La revente se fait en détail au marché à une clientèle mixte. Madame Rokia espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Sabougnouma group consists only of monogamous women who on average are 43 years of age with five children. They all live in Banconi, one of Bamako's neighborhoods, and became acquainted through neighborhood ties.

Group members are retail merchants of charcoal, cosmetics and clothes. In order to increase their operating capital, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan cycle.

Ms. Rokia (the woman standing at the far right in the photo) has a great reputation selling cosmetics. She intends to use her loan to buy five boxes of ointments and three boxes of perfumes in Bamako at wholesale prices. Retail sales are made at the market to a mixed clientele.

Ms. Rokia hopes to achieve with this loan an average monthly profit of 35,000 CFA francs to be reinvested in the business. Her objective through this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso is to buy a lot for residential usage.

loans.use: buy cosmetics

loans.name: Ivan Bladimiro

texts.es: Ivan tiene 62 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y su hijo. Ivan se dedica a la venta de helados desde hace más de 20 años.  La venta la realiza de forma ambulante y en su casa es así como junto a su esposa se gana la vida y llevan el sustento a su hogar. Ivan desea invertir en su negocio de venta de helados ya que es su principal fuente de ingresos y  desea convertirse en uno de los mejores vendedores de helados en la zona. Ivan solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de variedad de helados (paletas de fruta, chocobananos, sorbete, etc.) para la venta al menudeo como al mayoreo.
texts.en:
Ivan, 62, lives in his own house with his wife and son.  Ivan has been selling ice-cream products for 20 years.  He sells the products on the street or from his home.  The business allows them to earn a living and provide for the family.  

Ivan wants to invest in the business as it is his main source of income, so that he becomes the number one seller in the area.  He is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy a variety of iced products (iced lollies, chocobananos , sorbets, etc.) to sell both retail and wholesale.

loans.use: to buy a variety of ice creams (fruit lollies, chocobananos, sorbets, etc.) both for wholesale and retail.

loans.name: Elsa Cleotilde

texts.es: Elsa tiene 63 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijas quienes ya son mayores de edad y lastimosamente su esposo murió hace algunos años. Elsa se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos. Este es el negocio que le permite obtener ingresos y mantenerse ocupada dado que por su edad no puede realizar trabajos muy pesados. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cerdos para criarlos y leugo ponerlos a la venta y así poder sacar la ganancia que le permita apoyar la economía del hogar.
texts.en:
Elsa, 63, lives in her own house with her two daughters who are now adults.  Sadly, her husband died a few years ago.  Elsa raises and sells pigs.  This generates an income for her and is a good job for her to do, because at her age she cannot do any physically demanding jobs.  

She is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in pigs to raise and then sell.  In this way, she can make a profit and take care of the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy pigs for raising and selling.

loans.name: El Planon S.b Group

texts.es: Don Jose, tiene 63 años de edad, casado, tiene 3 hijos, vive en una aldea de Colinas Santa Barbara con su familia. Todo el tiempo se ha dedicado a la agricultura, cultiva maíz, frijoles y café, esta producción la vende en los mercados locales. Ha solicitado varios préstamos para mantener sus cultivos. Actualmente solicita otro que es en forma grupal. El grupo se llama El Planon S.B. son dos miembros que se dedican a la agricultura y viven en la misma zona. Don Jose solicita 8,000 lempiras para sembrar un vivero de café y poder ampliar el cultivo y darle mantenimiento, el piensa seguir trabajando duro para ayudar con la educación a sus hijos. Y Binnelio solicita 15,000 Lempiras haciendo un total grupal por 23,000 lempiras para darle mantenimiento y siembra de café. En la foto don José esta a la izquierda y Binnelio  a la derecha.
texts.en:
Jose, 63, is married with three children.  He lives in a small town called Colinas Santa Barbara with his family.  He has worked in agriculture all his life growing corn, frijoles beans and coffee.  He sells his products in local markets.  He has asked for several loans in the past to maintain his crops.  

Now, he is asking for a group loan.  The group is called ‘El Planon S.B.’, and the two members work in agriculture and live in the same area.  Jose is asking for a loan of 8,000 lempiras to sow seeds in a coffee nursery in order to increase crops and be able to maintain it.  He wants to continue working hard to help his children continue in education.  His partner, Binnelio, is asking for 15,000 lempiras; which makes a total of 23,000 lempiras for the group to look after and sow coffee.  In the photo, Jose is on the left and Binnelio is on the right.

loans.use: to sow in a coffee tree nursery to increase production, and to maintain it.

loans.name: Fifa Christon 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement FIFA CHRISTON 1 est composé de dix personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin de renforcer leur activité. La représentante du groupement, du nom de Houé Clémentine (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 43 ans est mariée à un certain Alexis. Le couple n’a pas d’enfant. Houé Clémentine a fréquenté l'école jusqu’au niveau primaire mais a appris la couture par la suite. Activité qu’elle exerce à son domicile depuis vingt ans. De façon secondaire, Houé Clémentine vend divers produits (boîtes de conserves, du sucre et de la farine de manioc appelée gari). Houé Clémentine vit avec son mari. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Houé Clémentine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Houé Clémentine ensemble avec les membres du groupement FIFA CHRISTON 1 sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Fifa Christon 1 Group is made up of ten people who all live in the same neighbourhood.  This will be their third loan with the field partner, Alidé, and it will be used to strengthen their businesses.

Houé Clémentine (seen with her hand raised in the photo) is the group's representative.  She is 43 years old and married to a man called Alexis.  The couple live together but don't have any children, and they both provide for the expenses of their household.  

Houé Clémentine attended primary school but then left to learn sewing.  She has worked at home, as a seamstress for twenty years now.  Alongside this business, she sells various products (storage jars, sugar and cassava flour, known as gari). She buys her supplies at the market in Bénin.  

In order to meet the needs of their customers, Houé Clémentine and the other members of the group have requested a third loan from the field partner, Alidé.  The previous loans were both correctly and fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy sewing equipment, storage jars, sugar and gari (cassava flour).

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Danaya est composé majoritairement de  femmes  polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djalakorodji et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, produits cosmétiques, chaussure plastiques, céréales et boissons. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Sitan (femme debout à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des fruits (papayes, mangues, oranges…). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 corbeilles de papaye, une charretée de  mangue, 3 sacs d’orange  à Bamako. La revente se fait en détail à Djalakorodji et en ambulant à une clientèle mixte. Madame Sitan espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif de pérenniser son activité dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Danaya group consists predominantly of polygamous women who on average are 37 years old with three children. They all live in Djalakorodji and became acquainted through neighborhood ties.

Group members retail cosmetics, plastic shoes, cereals and beverages. In order to increase their operating capital, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan cycle.

Ms. Sitan (the woman standing at the left in the photo) has a great reputation as a vendor of fruit (papayas, mangoes, oranges,...). She intends to use her loan to buy five baskets of papayas, a cartload of mangoes, three bags of oranges in Bamako. Retail sales are made to a mixed clientele in Djalakorodji and as an itinerant vendor.

Ms. Sitan hopes to achieve with this loan an average monthly profit of 50,000 CFA francs, to be reinvested in the business. Her objective is to sustain her business activity through this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: buy fruit

loans.name: Félicienne's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin de renforcer leur activité. La représentante du groupe, nommée Félicienne (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 62 ans n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Félicienne est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Barnabé. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Félicienne vit avec son mari et ses enfants, les charges de la famille sont supportées par Félicienne et son mari. C'est pour cette raison, Félicienne vend du charbon de bois dans sa région depuis quarante ans. Félicienne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Félicienne ensemble avec les membres de son groupe sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three women who live in the same neighbourhood.  This will be the second time that the group have requested a loan with the field partner, Alidé.  They have requested the loan in order to strengthen their businesses.

Félicienne (seen in the photo with her hand raised) is the group's representative.  She is 62 years old and has never attended school.  She is married to a carpenter called Barnabé.  The couple have five children who all attend school.  Félicienne lives with her husband and their children, and together they provide for the expenses of their household.  This is why, Félicienne has been selling charcoal locally for 40 years.  She buys her supplies at a market in Bénin.

In order to improve their businesses, Félicienne and the other members of the group, have requested this second loan from Alidé.  The previous loan was correctly and fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les quatre  membres du groupe Djekafo ont en moyenne 29 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djalakorodji et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Djalakoro. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, pommes de terre et habits. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Nah (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de pommes de terre. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 sacs de pommes de terre  au marché. La revente se fait en détail au marché  à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Nah compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Living for the most part in monogamous households, the four members of the Djekafo group are on average 29 years old with four children. They all live in Djalakorodji and became acquainted through neighborhood ties and their income-generating activities at the market in Djalakoro.

Group members are retail traders of potatoes and clothes. In order to increase their operating capital, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan cycle.

Ms. Nah (the woman sitting on the left in the photo) is a great vendor of potatoes. She intends to use her loan to buy 10 bags of potatoes at the market. Retail sales are made at the market to a clientele consisting mainly of women.

Ms. Nah hopes to attain with this loan an average monthly profit of 35,000 CFA francs, to be reinvested in the business and used to meet household expenses.

loans.use: buy potatoes

loans.name: Sewa Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sewa est composé de 8 femmes mariées majoritairement dans des ménages polygames.  Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djalakorodji et se sont  connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce du bois de chauffage, des légumes, des condiments, des produits cosmétiques, des chaussures plastiques et  de la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Maïmouna (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente du bois de chauffage. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 1 chargement du bois de chauffage en gros dans les villages environnant de Bamako. La revente se fait en détail à Djalakorodji  à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femmes. Madame Maïmouna espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Sewa group consists of eight married women living for the most part in polygamous households. They are on average 35 years old with four children. They all live in Djalakorodji and became acquainted through neighborhood ties.

Group members are retail traders of firewood, vegetables, condiments, cosmetics, plastic shoes and food. In order to increase their operating capital, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan cycle.

Mrs. Maimouna (the woman sitting on the far right in the photo) has a great reputation in selling firewood. She intends to use her loan to buy one load of firewood wholesale from villages surrounding Bamako. Retail sales are made in Djalakorodji to mainly women customers.

Mrs. Maimouna hopes to achieve with this loan an average monthly profit of 40,000 CFA francs to be reinvested in the business. Her objective in this relationship with Soro YiriwasoI is to buy a lot for residential usage.

loans.use: buy firewood

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 29 years old and married with two children.

Jenelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jenelyn has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Jenelyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lyn Marie

texts.en:
Lyn Marie is 39 years old and a married mother with four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Lyn Marie requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Lyn Marie has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Wassa Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les cinq membres du groupe Wassa ont en moyenne 30 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djalakorodji et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Djalakorodji. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, chaussures plastiques (hommes et femmes) de toutes sortes, habits et seaux plastiques. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Aminata (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est une  vendeuse de chaussures plastiques (hommes et femmes) de toutes sortes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 1 sac  de chaussures (hommes et femmes) de toutes les pointures  à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails au marché et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Aminata compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Living for the most part in monogamous households, the five members of the Wassa group are on average 30 years old with three children. They all live in Djalakorodji and became acquainted through neighborhood ties and their income-generating activities at the market in Djalakorodji.

Group members are retail traders of plastic shoes (men and women) of all kinds, clothes and plastic buckets. In order to increase their operating capital, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan cycle.

Aminata (the woman sitting on the right in the photo) is a vendor of plastic shoes (men and women) of all kinds. She intends to use her loan to buy one bag of shoes (men and women) of all sizes in Bamako. Retail sales are done at the market and as an itinerant vendor to a clientele consisting mainly of women.

Aminata hopes to attain with this loan an average monthly profit of 40,000 CFA francs, to be reinvested in the business and used to meet household needs.

loans.use: buy plastic shoes

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 41 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Jocelyn has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Jocelyn has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Jocelyn is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future, would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and has five children, one in school and the rest are adults. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Fatuma has operated a fruit-selling business for the past ten years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. 

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase two sacks of coconuts, bananas, oranges and mangoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of coconuts, bananas, oranges and mangoes for resale.

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en:
Juanito is a farmer who is raising his family in a rural community. He is 50 years old and has three school-aged children. Due to financial hardships, he aims to strengthen his hog-raising business to earn a higher income. He plans to acquire more piglets to raise but he has insufficient capital. For this reason, he is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy additional piglets, hog feed, vitamins and vaccines for his hogs. 

Despite hardship and difficulties in life, he has a strong determination to uplift their status of living.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, hog feed, vitamins and vaccines for his hogs.

loans.name: Mistubishi Group

texts.en:
Mariamu, who is in her early 30s, is single with two sons who are still in school.  She has been selling fabrics, madila and bags for five years now. She works from 6 am to 6 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

This will be Mariamu's 13th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase her fabrics, bags, and madilas and has paid back all of her loans successfully.  She is happy with the loan. She used the profits to pay school fees, buy a plot of land, a dressing table, and a DVD player and cover household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy the fast selling types of clothing, madila, fabrics and bags.  She dreams of becoming a successful business woman.  

Mariamu will share this loan with her loan group "Mistubishi" with two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fast selling types of clothing, bags and other items

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be motivated and hardworking. She operates a retail business where she sells mattresses, mosquito nets and other products. Her primary customers are local residents. She will use the KES 95,000 loan to buy more stock of mattresses, mosquito nets and other products. She hopes that in the future, she will live a happy and decent life. This is her fourth loan with SMEP-DTM. Her previous loan of KES 50,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of mattresses, mosquito nets and other products

loans.name: Teo

texts.en: Teo is married with six children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a retail shop and has been in this business for six years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, cooking oil and bags of bread. She works seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality, ever-increasing price of commodities in Uganda, and defaulters. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to own a fully stocked retail shop. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO to acquire additional capital. She resides in the family house and has access to electricity but not piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, cooking oil and bags of bread.

loans.name: Tirso

texts.en:
This is Tirso, 43, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Maria Fe, the one handling their computer shop, and they have children. He, together with his wife, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Tirso operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. He earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house. They also have a computer shop and a farm for additional income. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. He will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand his product inventory.

Tirso hopes to expand his business and dreams that his family is always in good health. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in his business.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 32-year-old married man with one child living in Hoima, Uganda. He owns a bar dealing in soft drinks, beers and spirits. He is a teacher whose salary at the end of the month supplements the proceeds from the bar. Despite being in business for four years, he is challenged by high license fees and limited capital to re-invest in his business. His dream is to have a well stocked bar that can attract more customers.

Francis is requesting a loan to buy beers, spirits and soft drinks to sell.

loans.use: to buy beers, spirits and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria works hard to support her family. She is single and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

Candelaria requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant.

She has been in this business for 40 years.

In the future, Candelaria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 52 years old, married and a mother with six children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Margarita has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Margarita has been in this business for three years. In the future, Margarita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en:
Mupa is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She is a married mother of three children, two of whom are in school and one is underage. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Mupa operates a cafe business preparing various foods such as tea, meat, and chapatti (wheat flour) and sells to neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase cooking oil, meat, sugar and wheat flour for her business. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, meat, sugar, and wheat flour

loans.name: Quinter

texts.en: Quinter is a Kiva borrower. She has one child who is three years old. She describes herself to be hardworking and opportunistic. She operates a boutique where she sells clothes, cosmetics and other items. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be theft. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes, cosmetics and other products. Her business goal is to be prosperous within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will achieve her business goals. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to open another boutique shop.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes, cosmetics and other products

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en:
Mupa is a hardworking and enterprising woman who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She is married with nine children, eight of whom are in school and one is underage.
 
Mupa sells goat meat to various butcheries and hotels (restaurants). She has been in this business for the past five years. She sites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase more goats for her business. She joined Yehu to boast her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for her business.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Despite the hardship of living, Arlene and her husband aim to improve their status of living and educate their three children. To generate additional income, she is engaged in a hog-raising business within her community. She plans to improve the business and make it profitable in order to provide the necessities of her family. Due to financial insufficiency, she is seeking a loan of PHP 18,000 to buy feed, vitamins and additional pigs to raise. Through this loan, she believes that she will be able to make her business profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional pigs to raise

location.town: Brgy. Bagumbayan, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 60 years old and married with eight children.

Patricia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Patricia has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

Patricia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wheat flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Yvette Assiba's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin de renforcer leur activité. La représentante du groupe, nommée Yvette Assiba (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 46 ans a fréquenté l'école jusqu’au niveau secondaire. Yvette Assiba est mariée à un certain Yaovi. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Yvette Assiba vit avec son mari et ses enfants, les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour ce faire Yvette Assiba vend des ustensiles et des tissus par la technique de distribution depuis trente ans, ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grandes difficultés aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Yvette Assiba ensemble avec les membres de son groupe sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
This group of three women lives in the same neighbourhood.  This will be the third time that they have requested a loan from the field partner, Alidé, and they will use the loan to strengthen their businesses.

Yvette Assiba (seen in the photo with her hand raised) is the group's representative.  She is 46 years old and attended school until secondary level.  She is married to Yaovi, and the couple have four children who all attend school.  The couple and their children live together, and Yvette Assiba and Yaovi provide for the needs of their household.  To do this, Yvette Assiba has been selling utensils and distributing fabric for 30 years.  This enables her to comfortably meet the expenses of her family.

Yvette Assiba and the other members of the group have requested this third loan from Alidé to improve their businesses and help them respond to the demands of their customers.  The previous loans were fully and correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy fabric for resale.

loans.name: Akossiwa's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Akossiwa (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 39 ans a fréquenté l'école jusqu’au niveau secondaire. Akossiwa est mariée à un agent de sécurité du nom de Kérim. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Akossiwa vit avec son mari et ses enfants, les charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. C'est pour cette raison que dame Akossiwa vend divers produits (riz, pâtes alimentaires, l’huile végétale et de la farine de manioc appelée gari) par la méthode de distribution depuis six ans, ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grandes difficultés aux besoins de sa famille et à ses propres besoins. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Akossiwa ensemble avec les membres de son groupe sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
This group of three women lives in the same neighbourhood.

Akossiwa (seen in the photo with her hand raised) is the group's representative.  She is 39 years old and attended school until secondary level.  She is married to a security agent, called Kérim, and the couple have three children who all attend school.  Akossiwa lives with her husband and their children and between them they provide for the needs of their family.  To help her do this, Akossiwa has been distributing various products (rice, pasta, vegetable oil and cassava flour - gari) for six years.  This enables her to comfortably meet the needs of her family and her own personal needs.

Akossiwa and the other members of the group have requested a second loan from the field partner, Alidé, to enable them to satisfy the demands of their customers.  The previous loan was fully and correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy rice, pasta and vegetable oil for resale.

loans.name: Ayena Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AYENA est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Virginie (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 47 ans a fréquenté l'école jusqu’au niveau primaire. Virginie est mariée à un chauffeur nommé Jean. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Virginie vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont assumées par le couple. Pour ce faire dame Virginie vend divers produits (savons, boîtes de conserves et des pâtes alimentaires) à son domicile depuis trente ans. Virginie s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et mieux faire face à la demande de sa clientèle, Virginie ensemble avec les membres du groupe AYENA sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The Ayena Group is made up of three women who all live in the same neighbourhood.

Virginie (with her hand raised in the photo) is the group's representative, she is 47 years old and attended primary school.  She is married to a driver called Jean, and they have four children, some of whom attend school.  Virginie lives with her husband and their children and together they provide for the needs of their family.  To do this, Virginie has been selling various products (soap, storage jars and pasta) from her home for 30 years.  She buys her supplies at the market in Bénin.

Virginie and the other members of the group would like to improve their businesses and better satisfy the needs of their customers, so they have requested a second loan from the field partner, Alidé.  The previous loan was fully and correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy soap, pasta and various other products, for resale.

loans.name: Janneth

texts.en: Janneth is a 31-year-old single woman. She has two children, ages 3 and 6 years. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a favorable place and her primary customers are small-scale customers. She describes her biggest business challenge as low sales returns. She will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be prosperous. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.en:
Zoraida is 61 years old and married with 12 children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Zoraida has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Zoraida has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Zoraida has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Zoraida would like to save enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Nzingo

texts.en:
Nzingo is a hardworking and enterprising woman who lives in the coastal region of Kenya. She sells cattle and goats at the market. She sites unstable market prices as her major challenge. 

She joined Yehu in order to gain access to funds. She is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase more cows and goats for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more cows and goats for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food products and drinks for her restaurant business.

loans.name: María Juana

texts.es:
María de 41 años de edad, nunca fue a la escuela, es casada su esposo se dedica a trabajar en el campo como jornalero, tiene dos hijos y están estudiando, es una familia muy unida y luchadora, gozan de buena reputación en la comunidad,  no tienen un trabajo  ni un negocio fijo, en ocasiones le ayuda a su esposo en los trabajos agrícolas y dice que se levanta a las 4 a.m. y regresa a su casa tipo 3 p.m. se sus labores, pero ella tiene la buena visión de poner un negocio a futuro y buscar financiamiento n la institución CREDICAMPO.
El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para la construcción de la casa, compra de material de madera, teja, pago de mano de obra, por el momento ya cuenta con cierta cantidad de adobe y gastara $800.0, ya que necesita terminar la casa antes que inicie la época lluviosa. Su visión es tener una casa mas digna, gozar de mayor comodidad, casa mas segura.
Para un futuro sus planes es apoyar al estudio de sus hijos, hasta culminar sus estudios en la universidad, para que puedan obtener un trabajo, empleo y que su situación económica sea mejor, ya que ellos nunca estudiaron y hoy necesitan que sus hijos se superen.
texts.en:
María is 41 years old. She never went to school. She is married and her husband works as a farm laborer. She has two children and they are in school. It is a very close family and they have a good reputation in the community. They do not have a regular job or business. Sometimes she helps her husband with the farm work and she says she gets up at 4 a.m. and returns home at about 3 p.m. She does her work, but she has the vision of starting a business in the future and getting financing from the CREDICAMPO institution.

The loan she is asking for is to build her house, buying wood, roof tiles, and paying for labor costs. At this time, she has some adobe and will spend $800.00. She needs to finish the house before the rainy season starts. Her vision is to have a more worthy house, be more comfortable and have a more secure house. 

For the future, her plans are to support her children's education until they finish college so that they can get jobs and have a better financial situation. She and her husband never went to school and now they need their children to get ahead.

loans.use: to build her house, buying wood, roof tiles, and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Baraka Group

texts.fr: Le groupe BARAKA est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Djoumaï Barakatou (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 34 ans a fréquenté l'école jusqu’au niveau primaire. Djoumaï Barakatou est mariée à un certain Yacoubou. Le couple a un enfant, scolarisé et à leur charge. Djoumaï Barakatou vit avec son mari et son enfant. Les diverses charges de la famille sont assumées par le couple. Pour ce faire, Djoumaï Barakatou vend des friperies à son domicile depuis quinze ans. Djoumaï Barakatou s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et mieux faire face à la demande de sa clientèle, Djoumaï Barakatou ensemble avec les membres du groupe BARAKA sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Baraka Group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The group's representative is called Djoumaï Barakatou. She's the one raising her hand in the photograph. She's 34 years old and dropped out of elementary school.

She's married to one Yacoubou. The couple has one school-attending child to support. Djoumaï Barakatou lives with her husband and child. The various family's expenses are covered by the couple.

To manage it, Djoumaï Barakatou has been selling secondhand clothing for the past fifteen years. She gets her supplies in a market in Benin. In order to strengthen her business and better meet customer demand, Djoumaï Barakatou, together with the other members of Baraka Group, is seeking a first loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothing

loans.name: Santos Osael

texts.es:
Santos tiene 47 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado en la escuela, está soltero, anteriormente estuvo casado pero la esposa emigró a los Estados Unidos de América y formó otro hogar en ese país, tiene 5 hijos pero él está haciendo un gran esfuerzo para salir adelante con sus hijos, y solo los 3 últimos se encuentran estudiando. 

Actualmente él trabaja como jornal en fincas de café, también se dedica a sacar miel de abeja en los bosques del cerro y ya tiene 11 años de dedicarse a este negocio.

El crédito que Santos está solicitando a CrediCampo lo necesita para comprar arena, bloque, pala (herramientas de trabajo) para construir un baño lavable en su casa y otra parte del dinero lo usará para gastos del hogar.

Entre sus metas a futuro están cambiar el techo de su vivienda por la época lluviosa que se aproxima, también desea darle salud, educación y alimentación a su familia, y darle a sus hijos todos los elementos necesarios para que sigan estudiando.
texts.en:
Santos is 47 years old. He went to school up to the third grade. He is single and was married before but his wife immigrated to the United States and made a home in that country. He has 5 children, but he is making a big effort to get ahead with his children. Only the last 3 are in school. 

Right now he is working as a laborer in coffee farms. He also harvests honey from bees in the mountain forests and has been doing that for 11 years. 

The loan that Santos is asking CrediCampo for is needed to buy sand, blocks, and work tools to build a full bathroom in his house and another part of the money will be used for household expenses.  

Among his future plans are to put on a new roof in his house because the rainy season is coming. He also wants to provide health, education and food for his family and give his children what they need to continue going to school.

loans.use: to buy sand, blocks, and work tools to build a full bathroom in his house.

loans.name: Edith Assiba's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Edith Assiba (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 45 ans n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Edith Assiba est mariée à un enseignant nommé Sylvestre. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Edith Assiba vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par Edith Assiba et son mari. Pour ce faire, Edith Assiba vend des oignons depuis vingt-ans, ce qui lui permet de répondre aux besoins de sa famille. Edith Assiba s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Edith Assiba ensemble avec les membres de son groupe sollicitent pour la deuxième fois  l’appui financier de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
This group of three women lives in the same neighbourhood.  

Edith Assiba (seen in the photo with her hand raised) is the group's representative.  She is 45 years old and did not attend school.  She is married to a teacher called Sylvestre, and they have three children who all attend school.  Edith Assiba lives with her husband and their children, and between them they provide for the needs of their family.  To do this, Edith Assiba has been selling onions for twenty years.  She buys her produce at a market in Bénin.

Edith Assiba and the other members of her group would like to improve their businesses, so they have requested a second loan from the field partner, Alidé.  Their first loan was fully and correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy sacks of onions for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy appliances.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es: Maxima tiene 58 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijas de 23 y 17 años y su pequeño nieto de 7 años de edad. Maxima tiene un negocio de pupuseria (preparación alimenticia a base de masa de maíz, frijoles, queso, etc.) en su hogar de residencia. El negocio lo tiene de hace más de 30 años por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Ella desea mejorar su negocio dado que es su principal fuente de ingresos y desea mantenerlo activo por mucho más tiempo. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los insumos necesarios como: maíz, frijoles, queso, aceite y gas propano para continuar con su negocio y poder brindar mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en: Maxima is 58 years old and lives in her own house with her two children, aged 23 and 17 years old respectively, and her 7-year-old grandson. Maxima has a business selling "pupusas" (a food made with corn beans, cheese and other items) from her home. She has had the business for over 30 years and so has a lot of experience and many customers who every day prefer Maxima over other buisness. Maxima wants to improve her business as it is her main source of income and she wants to keep it going for a long time. To do this, Maxima is applying for a loan from "FUSAI" to invest in necessary supplies such as corn, beans, cheese, oil and propane gas. She can then keep her business going and offer her customers better service.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, cheese, oil and propane gas.

loans.name: Yanice

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Yanice en su miscelanea, pues con el credikiva pudo comprar nuevos útiles escolares,  recargas y accesorios variados para todas las edades. Yanice está muy agradecida, pues con esta inversión logró mejorar sus inventarios, aumentar la rotación de su mercancías y ganar un poco mas. Yanice expresa a sus financiadores mucho agradecimiento y reconoce lo importante que los créditos han sido para ella, que con su trabajo ha impactado su bienestar.
texts.en: Thank you for supporting Yanice's miscellaneous shop. With her previous Kiva loan she was able to buy new school materials, phone top-ups and various other items for people of all ages. Yanice is very grateful as, with this investment, she improved her stock, increased turnover and earned a little more money. Yanice is very grateful to Kiva lenders and recognises the importance of the loans to her. The loans and her work have had a positive impact on Yanice's well-being.

loans.use: school supplies and a display case.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es: Rebeca esta a punto de terminar su primer crédito y lo ha podido pagar puntualmente con lo que gana de su negocio donde vende fresas y duraznos con crema, gelatinas y flanes. Ahora quiere hacer unas mejoras en su casa, necesita hacer trabajos de albañilería y pintura que dejo pendientes por falta de capital.
texts.en: Rebeca is about to finish with her first loan, which she has paid on time with her earnings from her business selling strawberries and peaches with cream jelly and flans. Rebeca now wants to make improvements to her home. She needs to do some building and painting work. This has not been done yet as she did not have enough money.

loans.use: to make improvements to her home.

loans.name: Rosaly

texts.en:
Rosaly is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines.  She is 50 years old and she is happily married to Bernardo who works as a farmer.  God has blessed them with three loving children and all of them are still studying in school.  Life indeed is hard.  But by the grace of God, they were able to raise their children well and they are helping each other in working for their family.

Rosaly owns a variety store.  This is a small store that can be owned by anyone in the community and the store is just connected to or just inside their houses.  This is where you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap, a PHP 5 worth of cooking oil or an egg and other things.  She gets her products from a wholesaler at a lower price and then she will sell it per piece for a higher price to get a profit.  Her regular customers are her neighbors, passerby and the people in the community.  She earns a minimum of  PHP 600 a day.

To be able to expand her inventory, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan.  She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.  This loan will be a great help for her to add more products to her store.

Rosaly dreams to be successful in her business and hopes to give her family a good life.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es:
Maricela es una clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia.
Maricela tiene 54 años y es viuda, tiene 3 hijos que ya son independientes. Ella se dedica a hacer manualidades y venderlas, sus clientes le hacen pedidos, ella los elabora y se los entrega. También complementa sus ingresos como empleada domestica.
Ella se considera una persona responsable, esta pidiendo el prestamos para poder tener mayor surtido e incrementar sus ventas.
Nos gusta apoyar a gente como Maricela que busca diferentes formas para aumentar sus ingresos y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Marcicela is a borrower from "Kubo Financiero" and this is her story: 

Maricela is 54 years old and a widow. She has three children who are now independent adults. Maricela makes a living making and selling handicrafts. Her customers make orders and Maricela produces and delivers the products. Maricela complements her income working as a domestic servant.

Maricela believes that she is a responsible person. She is applying for this loan in order to have more stock and increase her sales.

"Kubo Financiero" likes to support people like Maricela, who look for different ways to increase their income and get ahead.

loans.use: to buy materials for making and selling handicrafts.

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.es: Un kit de herrramientas, varillas, clavos y tornillos, hacen parte hoy de los nuevos inventarios que logró exhibir en mayor volumen Madeleine y esto fue gracias a su credikiva, por eso manifiesta su agradecimiento con el programa y espra poder seguir contando con esta fuente de financiamiento. En la actualidad está aplicando aun nuevo credito con el cual comprará barras de soldadura eléctrica en un mayor volumen. Madeleine dice con mucha alegria a sus finaciadores "gracias por el apoyo espero seguir contando con esa fuente"
texts.en: Thanks to her Kiva loan, Madeleine attained a kit of tools, rods, nails and screws as part of her new inventory wholesale. For that she is grateful to the program and hopes to be able to continue counting on this source of financing. Today she is applying for a new credit with which she will purchase electric welding rods wholesale. Madeleine says with much happiness to her financiers "thank you for the help, I hope to continue counting on this source".

loans.use: to buy electric welding rods wholesale.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 38 years old and married with two children.

Margie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Margie has borrowed and repaid twenty-two loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running the general store for 14 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.  Margie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is appreciative of her previous loan that improved her living standards.  Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

Catherine still operates her weaving business.  She would like to apply for a loan of KES 40,000 to buy reeds for her business.  She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy reeds for her business

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
Myra previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase hogs and feed needed for her business.  Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional hogs and feed needed for her business.  Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children.  She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Myra hopes to be more profitable in business and dreams to give her children a good life and education.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for feed and additional hogs.

loans.name: Shida

texts.en:
Shida is a hardworking and enterprising woman who is married, with six children, who all attend school.  She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees.

For the past four years, she has practiced farming, growing various crops such as vegetables and tomatoes.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase seeds and pesticide for her business.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase seeds and pesticide for her business

loans.name: Haydee

texts.en:
Haydee, 55, is a widowed mother with eight children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Haydee has a general store business in the Philippines. Haydee requested a 13000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more like sugar, snack foods and other groceries.

Haydee has been in this business for three years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, snack foods and other groceries.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy earns a living by providing transportation services in her community with the help of her husband as driver. For more than six years, the couple has earned a better income to provide for the needs of their children. With her income, she repaid her previous loan used for vehicle repair successfully. To buy tires, she took out a new loan from GDMPC microcredit in order to replace the old used tires. She wants to have a better living in the future with her family.

loans.use: to buy tires.

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida lives in Hatsik village with her husband and 27-year-old daughter. Her daughter is a teacher at a local school and Lida and her husband are running the farm. They are mainly involved in land cultivation. Near the house where they live, Lida and her husband cultivate tomatoes, cabbage, watermelons, peppers and grow apricot trees. They are farmers with many years of experience, so they get a good harvest and sell it locally. 

Lida has now applied for this loan to be able to cover cultivation costs and purchase fertilizer and seeds. This is her first loan. It has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

Lida and her family will be very grateful if lenders support her farming business and they hope for support.

loans.use: to pay for cultivation costs and purchase fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Sayoramoh

texts.en:
Sayoramoh is married and has four children. Her husband is a taxi driver. Sayoramoh began her own business selling food items three years ago. She sells items, such as bread, sausage, sugar, and butter, in a store which is located near her house. Sayoramoh's customers appreciate her goods. 

As her goods have a great demand, Sayoramoh needs to increase her working capital. She is requesting a loan for 5,000 Somoni, which she will use to buy food items for her store. From the profits, she is going to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase food items

loans.name: Segundo Lorenzo

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 54 años de edad, de estado civil casado, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos de 10, 14,16 años de edad, en la ciudadela 13 de Agosto perteneciente al Cantón Echeandía Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Virgen de Guadalupe, la cual se encuentra ubicada a 60 minutos de la oficina, está conformada por 10 socios. 
Segundo se dedica a la Cerrajería y a la crianza de cerdos. Solicita el crédito para la compra de materia prima madera, la misma que va a invertir en su negocio. La compra lo realiza en Ventanas. Su meta es tener un negocio de distribución. Su desafío es prosperar en la vida para el futuro. En su tiempo libre le gusta estar con su familia y la costumbre que le gusta es el carnaval.
texts.en:
Segundo is 54 years old, married and lives with his wife and three children, who are aged 10, 14 and 16 years old each. They live in the small town of 13 de agosto, in the Echeandía province of Bolívar, in Ecuador.

Segundo is a member of the "Virgen de Guadalupe" communal bank, located an hour away from the office. The bank has ten members.

Segundo makes a living as a locksmith and raising pigs. He is applying for this loan in order to buy wood, which he will use in his business. Segundo will buy the wood in Ventanas. Segundo's goal is to own a distribution business. His challenge is to prosper in life. In his free time, Segundo likes to spend time with his family. He also likes the tradition of carnival.

loans.use: to buy basic materials (wood).

loans.name: 13 De Mayo S.b. Group

texts.es:
Jose, tiene 43 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 2 hijos y vive en una aldea de nuevo Celilac, Santa Bárbara. Don José siempre se ha dedicado al cultivo de granos básicos, lleva 15 años de dedicarse al cultivo de café el cual vende en pergamino a los mercados locales. Ha solicitado el sexto ciclo de préstamo en forma grupal, en lo personal solicita 25,000 lempiras para comprar fertilizantes, y realizar actividades de mantenimiento de la finca en limpieza y regulación de sombra para sacar mejor cosecha. Su plan es ampliar sus parcelas de café y darle lo mejor a su familia.
El grupo a que pertenece se llama 13 de Mayo S.B. que esta integrado por cuatro miembros, que viven en la misma zona y se dedican al cultivo de café y granos básicos. El préstamo grupal es por 70,000 Lempiras, para darle mantenimiento a la finca de café. En la foto don Jose esta a la izquierda con camisa azul, Juan, Dionisio y Joel de cuadriculado y sombrero a la derecha.
texts.en:
Jose is 43 years old, married and has two children. He lives in a village in Nuevo Celilac, in Santa Bárbara. Jose has always made a living growing basic grains. For 15 years he has been growing coffee which he sells with the husks on to local markets. Jose is applying for his sixth loan - as part of a group -for 25,000 Lempira in order to buy fertilisers and to keep his coffee farm clean, and provide shade in order to have a better harvest. Jose's future plan is to expand his coffee plantation and give his family the best he possibly can.

Jose is a member of the "13 de Mayo SB" group. This group has four members, all of whom live in the same area and make a living growing coffee and basic grains. The total group loan is for 70,000 Lempira and will be used to look after coffee plantations. In the photo, In the photo, from left to right, are Jose, Juan, Dionisio and Joel.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers and items for cleaning and providing shade on a coffee plantation.

loans.name: Aurcinia

texts.en:
Aurcinia previously accessed a 10,000-PHP loan that she used to buy more stocks of mineral water needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 12,000-PHP loan to buy additional stocks of mineral water needed in her business. The more mineral water displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Aurcinia dreams of being more successful in business and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more gallons of mineral water to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Karina Kassandra

texts.es:
Karina tiene 20 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, vive con su mamá, en la ciudadela 5 de Octubre perteneciente al cantón Echeandía Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Virgen de Guadalupe, la cual se encuentra ubicada a 60 minutos de la oficina, está conformada por 10 socios. 
Karina es empleada privada y se dedica al comercio. Solicita el crédito para compra de cerveza para su negocio. La compra la realiza en Echeandia. Su meta es aumentar su negocio. Su desafío es la competencia. En su tiempo libre le gusta bailar, la costumbre que le gusta es el carnaval y fin de año.
texts.en:
Karina is 20 years old and single. She lives with her mother in the 5 de octubre town in the Echeandía canton of Bolívar province in Ecuador.

Karina is a member of the "Virgen de Guadalup" communal bank, located an hour away from the office. The bank has ten members.

Karina has a job and also has a business. She is applying for this loan in order to buy beer for her business. Karina will buy the beer in Echeandía. Her goal is to expand her business. Her challenge is to beat the competition. In her free time, Karina likes to dance. Two customs that she likes are the carnival and the New Year celebrations.

loans.use: to buy beer for her shop.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 39 years old and is hard working. She lives in Hoima, Uganda. She operates a maize mill, which she started to improve her welfare. She earns additional income from a retail shop. Her challenge are customers' late payments and seasonal weather changes which affect the maize mill especially during the rainy season.

Grace requested a loan, which she will use to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Marvin Jose

texts.es:
Marvin nació en la comunidad de Vilan  donde actualmente esta viviendo a  la edad de 12 años tubo que viajar con su tía a Bluefields , estando allá surge la guerra y de muy joven lo reclutaron para realizar el servicio militar patriótico por un periodo de dos años , al concluirlo el regresa de nuevo con su familia a la comunidad rural, increíblemente el grupo armado contrario al gobierno llamado la Contra  lo recluta por un periodo de cuatro años mas de guerra.
al concluir este otro periodo de guerra ya en los años 90  se dedica a los labores del campo, trabajando en las tierras de su abuelo  granos básicos  así el poco a poco el ahorro y logro comprar sus propias tierras las que actualmente sigue  cultivando obteniendo de aquí su medio de subsistencia , el desea aplicar al crédito para así poder tener energía en su vivienda ya que que no hay en la comunidad  y hasta ahora para poder iluminarse por las noches lo que hacen es usar candelas o candiles
texts.en: Marvin was born in the Vilan community, where he now lives. At the age of 12 he had to move to live with his aunt in Bluefields, as there was war in Vilan. At a very young age, Marvin was conscripted to do military service for two years. When he finished he returned with his family to the rural area of Vilan. Incredibly, Marvin was recruited by "Contra", the armed rebels fighting the government, for another four yeas of war. When this ended in the 1990s, Marvin started working on his grandfather's land, growing basic grains. Little by little Marvin saved up and was able to buy his own lands where he now continues to work and from which he supports himself. Marvin would like to apply for a loan in order to have electricity in his house, as there is none in his community. He currently has to use oil lamps and candles to light up his house at night.

loans.use: to buy a solar power system.
