loans.name: Bibicha

texts.en:
Bibicha was born in 1973. She is a kind and hardworking woman. Bibicha is widowed and has three non-adult children. 

Bibicha began her own business with sewing after the death of her husband. Bibicha has sewn national women’s dresses for more than five years. She has her own regular customers. Her customers are happy with her activity. 

Bibicha tries to provide better living conditions for her children. She is going to buy beds for her children but she has not money. She is asking for a loan of 1,800 TJS to buy beds for her children. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy beds for her children.

loans.name: Bình's Group

texts.en:
Bình is 55 years old. She is married and has two children. Bình is the group leader of the 06.01.08 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents, since her children are grown up

Bình operates a food stall/restaurant selling pig intestines. In 2010, Bình joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Bình has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Bình has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Bình faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase intestines to cook and resell.

With her business profit, Bình hopes to maintain a successful business. She also hopes for her family to be healthy and happy and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase pig intestines to cook and resell.

loans.name: Phượng's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phượng has a retail business selling clothes. She is requesting a loan to to purchase clothes to resell. Phượng is 62 years old, and she is married with three children.

Phượng is the group leader of the 06.01.01 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of seven members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents, as her children are grown up.

In 2010, Phượng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Phượng has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Phượng has been involved in this business for seven years. The main hardship that Phượng faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Phượng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find good jobs, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to resell.

loans.name: Alonzo

texts.en: Alonzo is 58, married, and has four children. They live in a rural community and earn their living through farming. He aims to improve his farming business in order to earn sufficient income and satisfy his family's needs. He planned to expand his vegetable plantation, but he does not have enough capital. For this reason, he is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy seeds, fertilizer, and insecticides needed in vegetable production. Being a kind and industrious father, he believes that he will increase his production and income through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and insecticides needed in vegetable production

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May is 38 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

May has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. May requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more clothing to sell.

May has been in this business for eight years. In the future, May would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 45 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Gemma's business was devastated by Super Typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Gemma is taking out a bridge loan to restart her buying and selling of herbal medicine business.

She has requested a 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to restart her herbal medicine business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell such as herbal medicines. 

Gemma is committed to rebuild, and in the future, would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of herbal medicine to sell

loans.name: Miriam Irene

texts.es:
Miriam tiene 32 años de edad de estado civil soltera, vive con sus 3 hijos de 15,12,7 en el barrio 13 de Agosto, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandía, Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Virgen de Guadalupe, la cual se encuentra ubicada a 60 minutos de la oficina operativa Guaranda, está conformada por 10 socios. 
Miriam se dedica a la venta de pollos. Solicita el crédito para la compra de pollos y así incrementar su negocio. La compra la realiza en Echeandía. Su meta es construir una casa. Su desafío es la competencia. En su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte, la costumbre que más le gusta es el carnaval.
texts.en:
Miriam is 32 years old and single. She lives with her three children - aged 15, 12 and 7 years old respectively - in the 13 agosto barrio of the Echeandía canton in the Bolívar province of Ecuador.

Miriam is a member of the "Virgen de Guadalupe" communal bank, located an hour away from the "Guaranda" office. This communal bank has ten members.

Miriam makes a living selling chickens. She is applying for this loan in order to buy chickens and increase her income. She will buy the chickens in Echeandía. Miriam's goal is to build a house. One challenge she is facing is competition. In her spare time, Miriam likes to play sports. Her favourite local custom is carnival.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 59 years old and widowed with four children. Milagros works very hard to provide for them.

Milagros runs a general store in the Philippines. Milagros has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, snack foods and other groceries. 

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

In the future, Milagros would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is fifty-four years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Rowena's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her fish vending and food vending business and is committed to regain what she lost. Rowena is taking out a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Rowena has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home.  In the future, Rowena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Miami Group

texts.en:
Lightness is a mother of three daughters who are enrolled in school. She was born in the late 1970s. Lightness makes her living by running a mamalishe business. She runs a fried-fish business also. She has been in this business for three years now. Lightness works from 6am to 10pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This is her first loan request from Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania. Lightness will use this loan to buy a business freezer. Lightness dreams that one day she will be able to be a successful businesswoman. She will share this loan with her loan group, "MIAMI," which totals five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a business freezer.

loans.name: Thoa's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thoa has a retail business selling clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothes to resell.

Thoa is 61 years old, and she is married with 3 children. Thoa is the group leader of the 06.01.06 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa Province, and she has no dependents. Her children are grown up.

In 2010, Thoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thoa has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thoa has been involved in this business for 7 years. The main hardship that Thoa faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thoa hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to resell.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a married woman. She has two children with ages of 5 years and 10 years. She describes herself to be determined and capable. She operates a retail business where she operates a posho mill where she grinds maize to produce maize flour to sell. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located in an area with potential, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low sales. 

She will use the 50,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more stock of maize. Her business goal is to be very prosperous within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will excel. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize

loans.name: Hoàn's Group

texts.en:
Hoàn is 30 years old, married, and has one dependent child. She is the group leader of the 06.01.03 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Hoàn joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hoàn has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 

Hoàn has a retail business selling clothes. Hoàn has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Hoàn faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothes to resell. 

With her business profit, Hoàn hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to resell.

loans.name: Tâm's Group

texts.en:
Tâm has a retail business selling clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothes to resell. 

Tâm is forty-three years old and married with two children. She is the group leader of the 06.01.04 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of five members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent. Her other child has grown up.

In 2010, Tâm joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Tâm faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tâm hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to resell.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a forty-six-year-old married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be social. He operates a restaurant where he cooks food to sell. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are regulars. He describes his biggest business challenge to be that customers frequently want discounts. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients to use in preparing food to sell. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve business and his standard of living. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stocks of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Thủy's Group

texts.en:
Thuỷ has a retail business selling clothes. Thuỷ has been involved in this business for five years. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothes to resell. 

Thuỷ is thirty-nine years old and married with two children. She is the group leader of the 06.01.07 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

In 2010, Thuỷ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thuỷ has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Thuỷ faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thuỷ hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to resell.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 30-year-old woman living with her three children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

For many years, her husband has been driving an auto rickshaw that does not belonging to him. With the help of savings, he wants to purchase a used auto rickshaw. His friend is selling an auto rickshaw and its engine's condition is good. But he does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy that rickshaw. He wants to start driving but needs a lump sum amount.

Therefore, Shazia has requested a loan for her husband so he can buy the used rickshaw and generate income for his family. She hopes that now her husband will be able to generate a constant income. She is very happy after receiving this loan and she thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a used rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Martin Ricardo

texts.es:
Martin es un cliente de KubO Financiero y esta es su historia.
Martin tiene 48 años, esta casado y tiene 2 hijos, una jovencita de 22 años y un joven de 21 años. Todos viven en casa de sus suegros, Martin se dedica al comercio desde hace poco más de 10 años, inicio como empleado donde vendían corsetería de mayoreo, después decidió poner su propio negocio en el cual trabaja junto con su esposa. A demás de su tienda, también venden 3 días a la semana en un tianguis (mercado). 
En su negocio vende todo tipo de corsetería como: calcetines, calcetas, mayas, guantes y bufandas. Martin dice que el  préstamo lo ayudaría mucho, porque al tener más productos, sus ventas se incrementarían.
Su mayor logro, es tener estabilidad económica y haberle pagado la universidad a sus hijos.
texts.en: Martin is a client of Kubo Financiero and this is his story. Martin is 48 years old, married, and has two kids, his daughter is 22 and his son is 21. Everyone lives in his inlaws' house. Martin has worked in business for a little more than 10 years. He began as an employee where they sold shapewear at wholesale. After that, he decided to start his own business with his wife in what he was doing. In addition to his store, they sale 3 days a week in the market. In his business he sells every type of knitwear: socks, stockings, meshes, gloves, and scarves. Martin says that the loan would help him a lot because having more products would increase his sales. His greatest achievement is having economic stability and having paid for university for his children.

loans.use: to stock his business with knitwear and accessories.

loans.name: Sinovite Group

texts.fr: SINOVITE est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Noëlie (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 35 ans n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Noëlie est veuve avec trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Noëlie vit seule avec ses enfants. Les différentes charges de la famille sont assumées par dame Noëlie. Pour ce faire, Noëlie vend de la banane dans sa région depuis quinze ans, ce qui lui permet de faire face aux besoins de sa famille et à ses propres besoins. Noëlie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité Noëlie, ensemble avec les membres groupe du SINOVITE sollicitent pour la première fois l’appui financier de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The three women of the Sinovite Group all live in the same neighbourhood.

Noëlie (seen in the photo with her hand raised) is the group representative.  She is 35 years old and has never attended school.  Noëlie is a widow and has three children who all currently attend school.  She lives with her children and is responsible for all their expenses.  To achieve this, she has been selling bananas for fifteen years.  She buys her produce at a market in Bénin.

Noëlie and the other members of the group have requested a loan for the first time with the field partner, Alidé, as they would like to improve their businesses.

loans.use: to buy bananas for resale.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is fifty-two years old and has seven children, four of whom are in school. Elena works very hard to provide for them.

Elena's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Elena now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. Elena has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor. Elena is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Akouavi Pélagie's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Akouavi Pélagie (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 42 ans a fréquenté l'école jusqu’au niveau secondaire. Akouavi Pélagie est mariée à un certain Fataï. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Akouavi Pélagie vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par Akouavi Pélagie et son mari. C’est pour cette raison que dame Akouavi Pélagie vend des tissus et des produits de mercerie par la méthode de distribution depuis sept ans. Akouavi Pélagie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Akouavi Pélagie ensemble avec les membres de son groupe sollicitent pour la deuxième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The three women in this group all live in the same neighbourhood.

Akouavi Pélagie (seen in the photo with her hand raised) is the group representative.  She is 42 years old and attended school until secondary level.  She is married to Fataï and they have three children who all attend school.  Akouavi Pélagie lives with her husband and their children and together the couple provide for all the needs of their family.  To do this, Akouavi Pélagie has been distributing fabric and haberdashery supplies for seven years.  She buys her supplies at a market in Benin.

Akouavi Pélagie and the other members of the group would like to improve their businesses so they have requested a second loan from the field partner, Alidé.  The previous loan was fully and correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy fabric and haberdashery supplies.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 39-year-old lady living with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She wants to build some savings so that she can provide better living facilities to her children in the future, but it seems impossible in the absence of a profitable source of income.

Her husband has been driving a moto rickshaw for several years; his income is insufficient to feed his entire family. He has to maintain the rickshaw body, but he does not have a sufficient amount to fix the problem. 

Therefore, she has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so her husband will be able to buy a moto rickshaw body. She hopes that she will be able to build savings until the time to marry her husband.

loans.use: to buy a moto rickshaw body for her husband.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is 46 years old has has seven children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her son is a turner by profession. He works over a lathe machine and manufactures and renews the spare parts of vehicles such as motorbikes, cars, and auto rickshaws. He renews the interior parts of the engines of vehicles, turbines, and radiators. He has been doing this business for many years and his business is very successful. Due to continuously working over the lathe machine, some of important parts are tearing off and urgently need to be replaced. 

Nusrat's son is a poor person and does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy cutting tools and spare parts to fix the lathe machine. Nusrat requested a loan for her son, which he will use to purchase cutting tools and spare parts to fix his lathe machine. She hopes that this loan will prove productive for the business as well as for her family.

loans.use: to purchase cutting tools and spare parts to fix the lathe machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food products like rice, sugar, milk, and sausage.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DANAYA est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 40 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Barouéli, commune de Barouéli préfecture de Barouéli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de condiment, de ’habillement, de charbon et de lait. Les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leurs vingt unième prêts solidaires. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente TATA la deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de condiments. Elle compte acheter 4 sac de sel, 3 sac d’oignon, 2 carton de poisson fumé, 2 carton de cube Maggi, 2 gros panier de chou, et 1 panier de poivron chez les grossistes à Bamako. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce à Barouéli à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 82 000FCFA, qui sera en partie utilisé pour assurer les dépenses familiales, et le reste injecté dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The Danaya Group is made up of married women who are, on average, 40 years old and have four children.  They all live in traditional families in the town, commune and prefecture of Barouéli, in the district of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  They know one another through family, friendship and neighbourhood connections.  

The women run restaurant businesses or sell food, clothes, charcoal and milk.  The members of the group all want to be able to respond to the enormous demand of their customers so they work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, this will be their 21st loan.  They will use their loans to buy the products already mentioned.

Tata (standing second from the left in the photo) is illiterate, she currently works selling food ingredients.  She will use her loan to buy four sacks of salt, three sacks of onions, two boxes of smoked fish, two boxes of Maggi stock cubes, two large baskets of cabbages and one basket of peppers from wholesalers in Bamako.  She sells her products to various individual customers in Barouéli for cash.

Tata expects to make a monthly profit of 82,000 francs CFA, which she will use to provide for the expenses of her family and also to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for resale.

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.en:
Sabohat lives with her two children in the south part of Tajikistan. She is divorced. 

Five years ago, Sabohat began her own business, selling women’s clothes in a local market because she needed the money. After her husband left her and her children, she started the business. At first, it was so difficult for her to manage with business. Thanks to her patience and hard work, she developed her business. Now she runs her business well. 

Sabohat is going to buy goods for the new season. She is asking for a loan of TJS 5,000 (somoni) to buy women’s clothes. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy women’s clothes for the new season.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 56 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. Remedios works very hard to provide for them.

Remedios runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Remedios has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles and other items. 

In the future Remedios would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
This is Nuru. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She thanks Kiva lenders for their financial support. 

She would like to apply for a loan of Ksh.50,000 to purchase fabric and thread for her business. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and thread for her business.

loans.name: Hương's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hương has a retail business selling general items and dry foods. She is requesting a loan to purchase general items such as dry foods to resell. 

Hương is 58 years old and she is married with three children. Hương is the group leader of the 06.01.05 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents

In 2010, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hương has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hương has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Hương faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Hương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job, and to build a new house with her business profit.

loans.use: to purchase general items such as dry foods to resell

loans.name: Petro

texts.en:
Petro, a married father of two children, runs a small construction business and wants to buy scaffolding for his business. He also does agriculture/livestock with a focus on planting and harvesting wheat and fodder and selling raw milk from his only dairy cow.

Petro and his family live in a field area not far from the main city of Korca, in southern Albania. The most common harvested agricultural products are wheat, potatoes, tomatoes, animal fodder, corn and beans, whereas in livestock the common animal is the cow. Usually, villages located in the field area prefer cows or even sheep. As for the traditional food, we can name the meatballs that are long versus the rounded ones; these are called “kernacka”. After they have been grilled, they are further cooked with a little bit of broth, wheat flour, tomato paste and onions, and dampened with homemade red wine or even vinegar. 

Petro has been photographed at his job site.

loans.use: to buy scaffolding for his construction business.

loans.name: Drande

texts.en:
Drande comes from a far northern region where most of the winters are covered in snow; the roads to go there are very dangerous, with sharp bends, and there have been so many car accidents reported, unfortunately, especially during the cold months. The village is situated about 1,000 meters above sea level and is considered among those who pursue skiing as a hobby or amateurs as a good place for skiing. A prominent Albanian poet worked in the village’s school as a teacher in 1936. Pine is the tree that grows most here in the wild.

Drande is a mother of three children and she does agricultural/livestock as a means for making a living, whereas her husband works as an elementary school teacher.

Drande is requesting this loan to help her son who practices plumbing to buy necessary tools for his profession.

loans.use: to help her son who practices plumbing to buy necessary tools for his profession.

loans.name: Dalip

texts.en: Dalip again requests your financial help. The loan he is requesting this time is the same as the previous loan, to be used to stock up on inventory items for his store.

loans.use: to stock up on inventory items for his bar/café and grocery.

loans.name: Veis

texts.en:
Veis and Meli have been photographed in front of their family house with their 14 year old son; however, the loan is for Veis who is requesting it to start up a little livestock business by investing in one dairy cow at first to see if it will go further.

Arboriculture is a small business that Veis has had for some time now. Cherries and plums are the orchards that have gotten most of his focus, unlike other villagers who have been in the chestnut type of orcharding that make the village known for large quantities of chestnut production. Veis and Meli have two children and they live on a little pension of Veis' mother of $40/month and Veis also works as a night man at a nearby place. Their village is situated not far from the lake Ohrid and has a very cold climate. The goat is the preferred animal amongst villagers, since their village is surrounded by steep mountains around.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Hekri

texts.en: Hekri is thankful for the financial assistance he received from his previous loan. He is now requesting a second loan for the same purpose, to buy more cotton/woven fabric raw materials to resell. He hopes that he has proved himself to be trustworthy and deserving of another loan.

loans.use: to buy fabric to resell

loans.name: Fatmir

texts.en:
Fatmir, a bee master, is a 52-year-old married father of three. He sells honey to wholesale buyers, as well as to locals in small quantities. In addition to the bee activity, he repairs cars with his self taught skills. Fatmir wants to buy food for his beehives. 

Fatmir has placed his bee hives about 6km away from the town where he lives, due to the fact that the mountain where they’re placed gives the bees all the necessary nutrients and goods to grow and breed. The flowers in the mountains around have a very strong scent and the honey smells like that as well. 

Where Fatmir’s village is now, it used to be a marsh. Due to volunteering work by all volunteers from each end of Albania during the communist era, the water was drained and turned into a loam; there is still a starch factory that is functional. Animals such as sheep and cows are the livestock kept most by villagers. Massive projects were undertaken from the previous regime on basis of volunteerism, such as building railways, olive groves, turning marshes into loams, steep hills turned into orange plantations and so many more.

loans.use: to buy food for his beehives.

loans.name: Sherif

texts.en:
Sherif is 53 and a married father who is requesting a loan to cover the medical expenses of his wife. He has been photographed at his his small business, a car wash, that he has been running for some time now in a suburb of the town.

Sherif lives in a little town along the national road Tirana-Korça; this town is known for the clean and healthy running water that comes straight to the households from abundant wells located in the surrounding mountains, unlike other cities or towns where water deposits are used for this purpose. The town is also known for the traditional meal of chicken porridge with nuts and pan with beans.

loans.use: to cover his wife's medical expenses.

loans.name: Theodhoros

texts.en:
Theodhoros, whose name is in Greek and means “Gift from God” in English, is requesting this loan to complete his seasonal business of buying potato seeds for planting. Theodhoros has been photographed in between his family's house and the hut where they store agricultural produce, animal fodder and other items. These huts sometimes serve as animal stables or henhouses.  

The village where Theodhoros lives with his wife and their two children, ages 10 and 5, is not far from the main city of Korca, situated in the southern part of the country. Almost all villagers there plant and sell potatoes and onions in large quantities. Apple fruits called “starkinga” that have their own brand name and production sticker are the most common fruit trees in the village. Residents of this village proudly call themselves after this “starkinga” apple.

loans.use: to complete his seasonal business of buying potato seeds for planting.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma's prior loan allowed her to replace her mature dairy cows, who were no longer producing milk, with younger ones. She would not have achieved this without the support of Kiva lenders.

Alma is requesting financial assistance again, this time to make repairs to her family's house.  She is photographed outside of her poorly built house.

loans.use: to make repairs to the family's house

loans.name: Enkeleda

texts.en:
Enkeleda, who has been photographed next to her animal stable, is 22 and married with a one-year-old child.
 
One of Enkeleda’s activities is planting wheat and fodder for the animals, like almost all others in her village. The soil is not very good for agriculture overall because it holds water, yet the two plants above it seem to be growing okay. Veggies and other grains are planted for domestic use only.  

Livestock is her preferred activity and she’s got a few dairy cows already. She wants to expand this practice and add some more cows to the herd and this loan will help her to achieve that goal 

Enkeleda’s village is very, very cold and it was traditional for women here to dress in kilts with loose pants underneath. Their heads were always covered with scarves in a red color with some white bits.

loans.use: to add one more cow to the existing herd

loans.name: Beniamin

texts.en:
Beniamin’s vision has gone very blurry lately and doctors in his city have told him that he needs eye surgery immediately. However, to help him make a better decision, he has decided to go to an eye specialist in the capital city and this is why he needs this loan.

Beniamin is 49 and married with three children. Some of his daily activities include agriculture, livestock and transportation of agricultural produce with a type of tractor that in Albania is called a “zetor”. Mostly, he plants beans, corn and wheat and has one dairy cow that produces about 20 kg milk/day.

The village where Beniamin lives has a soil rich in minerals due to the natural composting. This soil is called “torfe” here in Albania and supports very many plants, particularly grains. Sheep and cows are the common animals in his village.

loans.use: to visit an eye specialist

loans.name: Armand

texts.en:
Armand is from a village near the border between Albania and Greece. In between 1910-1930, Romanian people first settled the village, coming from a neighboring country (Romania) bordering the Black Sea. Armand is a member of this community. The village is surrounded by beautiful mountains. On top of one of them, they built an Orthodox Church as soon as they settled. There are two wells that satisfy the need for drinkable water for all these villagers whose agricultural practice is based on orchards of plums and apples, vegetables and grains such as corn, wheat, potatoes and onions. Almost every household makes in a primitive way the delicious alcoholic “raki” drink which is made of plums.

Armand has four children. In addition to their agricultural activity, Armand does construction during the summertime and his wife works in an olive oil factory during the winter and sells fresh produce at the farmer’s market of Korca city the rest of the year.
  
Armand needs this loan to plant potatoes and onions.

loans.use: to buy potato and onion seeds.

loans.name: Ardian

texts.en:
Ardian, 41, is married and the father of a two-year-old. He is a para-tetraplegic who suffered an accident about six year back. He needs this loan to make home repairs. 

In addition to his disability compensation, his elderly mother's pension and the financial assistance of his wife, who works as a caretaker, he’s got some grapevines and flocks that the family uses to provide their staple foods. 

The hilly-mountain village where Ardian lives is situated near a river in northern Albania. Throughout the year, the climate is extremely cold and windy, and villagers cannot plant anything, due to this climate. They just have flocks and they feed themselves mostly with dairy products and smoked meats. 

Here and there you can see some grapevines, but that’s it. No other fruit trees are planted. Surprisingly though, the mountains around are full of tiny little blueberries, that are not very juicy. They are called “boronica” in Albanian.

loans.use: to make home repairs; Ardian is a para-tetraplegic

loans.name: Vera

texts.en:
Vera, whose name in Albanian means “summer”, is a 46-year-old married mother of three with her oldest child being 25 and the youngest two years old. Livestock has been the practice of her choice all these past years. She has four milk cows and two pigs. Kindly note that one of her cows recently gave birth to twin baby calves that look different to one another, as you can see in the picture where Vera is petting both of them. It's believed that it is very rare for cows to give birth to twins.

Vera and her family live in a village that before was anointing. Due to the fact that it is below sea level and the water drainage system doesn’t work, it unfortunately gets flooded almost every year. Vera wants to build a stable for her animals.

loans.use: to build a stable for her two cows, twin baby calves and her pigs.

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BALIMAYA est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 42 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Fana, commune de GUEGNEKA préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce d’habits, et d’article divers. Les femmes du groupe BALIMAYA sont à leur huitième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente KONIMBA  la première personne à partir de la gauche est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de pagnes wax Elle compte acheter 10  pièces de pagne wax avec son argent chez les grossistes à Bamako. Ces pagnes seront vendus en détail et en espèce à une clientèle mixte au marché de Fana. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 25 000FCFA, qui sera en partie utilisé pour assurer les dépenses familiales, et le reste injecté dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The Balimaya Group is made up of married women who are, on average, 42 years old and have five children.  They all live in traditional families in the town of Fana, Guegneka commune, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  They know one another through family, friendship and neighbourhood connnections.

The women run restaurant businesses or sell clothing and other products.  All the women want to be able to respond to the enormous demand of their customers, so they work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, this will be their eighth group loan.  They will use their loans to buy the products already mentioned.

Konimba (standing on the far left of the photo) is illiterate.  She sells wax pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing), and will buy ten with her loan, from wholesalers in Bamako.  The pagnes are then sold to various individual customers, for cash, at the market in Fana.  She expects to earn a monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA, which she will use to meet the needs of her family and also to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sewing materials like thread, needles, buttons and fabric.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is forty-six years old, married, and has three children. 

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Elma is taking out a housing loan amounting to Php 10,000 purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. She has been an NWTF borrower since 2013. 

With your help, Elma can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 23-year-old single woman. She has one child who is four years old. She describes herself to be loyal. She operates a M-pesa business where she offers mobile phone based money transfer services. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located in a good area for business and her primary customers are the general public. 

Mercy describes her biggest business challenge to be the unreliable network. She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to add more M-pesa float, i.e., money for customers to withdraw. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her standard of living.

This is Mercy's second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of Kes 20,000 was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business, repay the loan, and also cater for her family needs.

loans.use: to add more M-pesa float, i.e., money for customers to withdraw

loans.name: Joseline Pamela

texts.es:
Joseline tiene 20 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, vive con su familia y su hijo de 3 meses, en el barrio 8 de Octubre, perteneciente al cantón Echeandía, Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Virgen de Guadalupe, la cual se encuentra ubicada a 60 minutos de la oficina operativa Guaranda, está conformada por 10 socios. 
Joseline es agricultora, siembra cacao, maíz y también se dedica a la crianza de pollos. Solicita el crédito para compra de abonos y fertilizantes necesarios para la siembra del cacao y maíz, y así incrementar la producción. La compra la realiza en Echeandía. Su meta es tener su casa propia. Su desafío son las plagas en sus cultivos. En su tiempo libre se dedica a su familia, la costumbre que más le gusta es el carnaval.
texts.en:
Joseline is 20 and unmarried. She lives with her family and three-month-old baby in the 8 de Octubre neighbourhood, belonging to the Echeandía canton, Bolivar province.
She is a member of the Virgen de Guadalupe communal bank, located 60 minutes from the Guaranda office. There are 10 members.
Joselina is a farmer. She grows cocoa and corn and also raises chickens. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of manure and fertilizers for her crops in order to increase production. She will make her purchase in Echeandía. Her goal is to have her own home. Her challenges are plagues and pests. In her free time, she is with her family. Her favourite custom is carnival.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Pranvera

texts.en: Pranvera whose name in Albanian means "Spring" is back requesting another loan to stock up on seasonal inventory items for her boutique store.

loans.use: To add more inventory items for her boutique

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: Dora is 42 years old and married to a farmer. She was gifted with three children and they live happily in a rural community. She helps her husband in cultivating their farmland to ensure high production. They aim to expand their vegetable plantation but they have inadequate capital. For this reason, Dora is asking for an additional loan of 10,000 PHP to buy the fertilizers and insecticides needed in vegetable production. She hopes that that they will increase their yields and income through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides needed in vegetable production

loans.name: Bude

texts.en:
Bude is from a region called “Malesia e Madhe” in Albanian or Great Highland. Residents of this region are known for the best homemade pickles and smoked pork and also for singing rhapsody with a plucked single musical instrument with only two strings, called “çifteli” in the local language. Even though Bude has been living in another region for quite some time now, she continues to join the folk group from her native region to sing rhapsody with ‘çifteli’. 

Bude needs this loan to make repairs to her family home. She is married and according to her, unfortunately, does not have any children. She has two cows to look after and sell the raw milk to a nearby dairy farm and also baby calves to locals; her husband does stone carving work as a profession for pay.

loans.use: to make home repairs.

loans.name: Erjon

texts.en:
Erjon is a plumber by profession and he also runs a little shop where he sells plumbing supplies; the loan he is requesting at the moment will be used to stock up on inventory of such items. He is lucky in a way because he is the only plumber in his town; hence he’s got plenty of work, but this keeps him working very long hours and on weekends too, non-stop. The earnings from his profession are the only source of income for his family.

Erjon is a 31-year-old married father of two young children, three years old and two months old.

loans.use: to stock his store with plumbing supplies

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Carmen previously accessed a 17,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would now like to apply for a 15,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help cover their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Corazon hopes that her business will last longer and dreams of having a better living.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of their Tricycle unit.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 44 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gina has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 12 years. Gina requested a 20,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

In the future, Gina would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Lulezim

texts.en:
Lulezim, who has been photographed here with one of his baby goats, has twenty goats and ten baby ones, and he wants to add some more goats to his existing herd; this loan will help him achieve his goal.

Lulezim is a married father of two teenagers, 16 and 18 years old. Lulezim’s wife works in a restaurant and together they raise livestock; they sell the raw milk to a local dairy farm.

A bit about their village: agriculture is the most favorite activity amongst the villagers. Corn, wheat, potatoes and onions are some of the most commonly grown crops and grapevines, cherries and apple orchards are grown easily here as well. When it comes to animals, all three are equally preferred; cows, sheep and goats. Lately, villagers have started planting medicinal plants since the soil supports them very well.

loans.use: to add some more goats to his existing herd.

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina is the age of 47, living with her spouse and seven children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a milkman by profession; he sells milk from a shop to the common people. His customers like the fresh and delicious milk he sells. His monthly net income is too low to meet the household needs because there are too many competitors in the market and the customers as well. Due to quality and reasonable rates, most of the customers like to buy milk from him. He wants to increase the stock on a daily basis and wants to buy milk in bulk, but he does not have enough cash in hand to buy milk in large quantities. Therefore, Sakina has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy more milk to sell and for the production of yogurt, butter, cheese, etc.. 

Sakina is very happy after receiving this loan; she thanks Kiva and their field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy milk in bulk to sell and for the production of yogurt, butter, cheese, etc.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is married, the mother of six children and a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is forty nine years old and three of her children attend school.

Jovita's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last Nov. 8, 2013. She has restarted her fish-selling business and is committed to regain what she lost in the storm. She is taking out a PHP 5,500 housing loan through NWTF to buy building materials and pay for construction labor to rebuild a house for her family.

Jovita has been with NWTF since 2012 and is working hard to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start building a new home. In the future, her goal is to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Kayira Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KAYIRA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 44 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Fana, commune de GUEGNEKA préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’habillement, et d’article divers. Les femmes du groupe KAYIRA sont à leur dix-septième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leur clientèle, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente MAMOU la première personne à partir de la gauche est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse d’articles divers (étalagiste). Elle compte acheter 25 kg de sucre, une douzaine de pile, 1 carton de pâte alimentaire, 4 cartouches de thé, 10 paquets de sachet plastiques, 2 cartons de biscuit, 3 cartouches de cigarette, 1 carton de lait en poudre, 1 petit carton de Lipton et du nescafé chez les grossistes au marché hebdomadaire. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce dans sa petite boutique à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 85 000Fcfa, qui sera en partie utilisé pour les frais de scolarité des enfants, et le reste injecté dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The group KAYIRA is composed of married women, who average 44 years of age and five children each. They all live in traditional families in Fana City, in Commune de GUEGNEKA, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in clothing and general goods. 

The women of the group KAYIRA are on their 17th solidarity loan. With the goal of meeting the enormous demand from their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. The funds will be used to purchase their merchandise as cited above.  

This client, MAMOU, who is the first person from the left, is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of general goods (stall keeper). She intends to purchase 25 kg of sugar, a dozen batteries, a box of pasta, 4 cartons of tea, 10 packets of plastic bags, 2 boxes of cookies, 3 cartons of cigarettes, a box of powdered milk, a small carton of Lipton, and some Nescafé, from wholesalers at the weekly market. 

Sales are made retail to a mixed customer base paying with cash in her little shop. She plans on making a monthly profit of 85,000 francs CFA that will be used in part to cover her children's schooling costs. The rest reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods, such as sugar, batteries, tea, coffee, milk, etc.

loans.name: Finesse Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe FINESSE est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 34 ans, et 4enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Dioïla, commune de Kaladougou préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce d’habillement, de savon, d’article divers, et la restauration. Les femmes du groupe FINESSE sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO. 
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente FANTA la première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang debout n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse de savon. Elle compte acheter 7 cartons de savon chez les grossistes à Bamako. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce, à une clientèle mixte à Dioïla. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20 000 Fcfa qui sera utilisé pour assurer les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The group FINESSE is composed of married women, who average 34 years of age and four children each. They all live in traditional families in Dioïla City, in Commune de Kaladougou, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They work in food service and do commerce in clothing, soap, and general goods. 

The women of the group FINESSE are on their first solidarity loan. With the goal of meeting the enormous demand from their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. The funds will be used to purchase their merchandise as cited above.  

This client, FANTA, who is the first person standing at the left, is uneducated. She is currently a vendor of soap. She intends to purchase 7 boxes of soap from wholesalers in Bamako.  

Sales are made retail to a mixed customer base paying with cash in Dioïla. She plans on making a monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will be used in part to cover the day-to-day expenses of her family.

loans.use: to purchase soap

loans.name: Zarifmoh

texts.en:
Zarifmoh was born in 1964; she is an industrious woman. Zarifmoh is married, and has three children. Her husband is a teacher.

Zarifmoh is a repeat client of IMON; she has a good credit story, and always makes payments on time.  

Zarifmoh has had her own business more than 10 years. She sells dishes in a local market. Zarifmoh sells a variety of kettle, plates, cups, etc.  She has her own selling place in a local market. Zarifmoh is going to increase working stock.  

She's is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy dishes for increasing working stock. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy dishes to increase her working stock.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 52 years old and married with eight children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur; Leah has a charcoal sales business in the Philippines. 

Leah requested a PHP 29,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase an additional stock of charcoal to sell.

Leah has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Leah would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Agripinah

texts.en:
Agripinah appreciates Kiva lenders for their financial support that enabled her improve her living standards.

Besides the pharmacy, Agripinah operates a photocopier machine.

She is requesting a loan of ksh.30,000 to purchase spare parts for her photocopier machine.

She joined Yehu to boast her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her photocopier machine.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be humble.  She operates a tailoring business where she makes dresses to sell. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high capital to operate. She will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of fabric, threads and other tailoring materials and also pay school fees for her children. Her business goal is to be a supplier of uniforms and suits within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will build rental houses to generate more income for her family. This is her fourth loan with SMEP DTM.  Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: buy more stock of fabric, threads and other tailoring materials

loans.name: Doke Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DOKE est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Fana, commune de GUEGNEKA préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de céréale, de savon, de gâteau, et de jus. Les femmes du groupe DOKE sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente AMINATA la première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang assise est analphabète, elle est actuellement restauratrice. Elle compte acheter 100kg de riz, et des condiments au marché hebdomadaire. La vente des plats se fait dans son mini resto au bord du goudron à Fana et à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 21 000FCFA, qui sera en partie utilisé pour les dépenses familiales, et le reste injecté dans son activité.
texts.en:
The group DOKE is composed of married women, who average 34 years of age and four children each. They all live in traditional families in Fana City, in Commune de GUEGNEKA, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They work in food service and do commerce in grains, soap, cakes, and juice drinks. 

The women of the group DOKE are on their first solidarity loan. With the goal of meeting the enormous demand from their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. 

This client, AMINATA, who is the first person sitting at the left, is illiterate. She is currently a restauranteur. She intends to purchase 100 kg of rice and some condiments at the weekly market. Sales of her dishes are made to a mixed customer base in her mini-restaurant on the roadside in Fana. She plans on making a monthly profit of 21,000 francs CFA that will be used in part to cover the family expenses. The rest is reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase food supplies for her restaurant

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en:
Sawsan is a 37-year-old, married mother of four children. She is a Palestinian refugee who is working hard to develop her family's living through developing her special career, which she has been running for the last twenty-two years.  Sawsan loves life, fun, and joy; that's why she chose a special business that spreads happiness wherever she goes. She is a DJ, and she is committed to many people who are responsible for preparing and managing special events upon occasions. She is proving to be a leader in her domain and region.

Today Sawsan is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to buy a special, newly released, and updated music mixer, which is necessary to develop her business and to provide quality. Sawsan is very anxious about this loan, since she is very sure that with this machine, she can develop and improve her business quality and attract new customers. She hopes that in the future, her name will glow and glitter in the music world, which she adores most.

loans.use: to buy a special, newly released, and updated music mixer, which is necessary to develop her business and to provide quality.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 37 years old and married with two children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Ann's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines November 8, 2013.  Mary Ann has restarted her business, and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Mary Ann has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to rebuild her family home.

She is committed to rebuild her devastated life, and in future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis tiene 25 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, tiene dos hijos de 6 y 2 años, vive con su familia en el barrio 13 de agosto perteneciente al Cantón Echeandía, Provincia de Bolívar. 
 Es integrante de la ventanilla Virgen de Guadalupe, la cual se encuentra ubicada a 60 minutos de la oficina operativa Guaranda, está conformada por 10 socios. 
Luis es agricultor, se dedica al comercio de caña guadua, gallinas y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para la compra de cerdos. La compra la realiza en Echeandía. Su meta es mejorar su negocio. Su desafío es la competencia. En su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte, la costumbre que más le gusta es el carnaval.
texts.en:
Luis is 25 years old is single and has two children aged 2 and 6 years old. He lives with his family in the 13 de Agosto neighborhood of Echeandía Canton, Bolivar Province. He is a member of the Virgen de Guadalupe communal bank which is located 60 minutes from the Guaranda office and made up of 10 members. 

Luis is a farmer who sells Gadua bamboo cane, chickens and pigs. He is requesting a loan to buy pigs which he will buy in Echeandía. His goal is to improve his business. His challenge is his competition. In his free time he enjoys playing sports and he likes carnival.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and has three children, two of whom are in school and one is underage. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Fatuma has operated a coconut selling business for the past 10 years, selling from home to her neighbours and passerby. 

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase two sacks of coconuts to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of coconuts to sell

loans.name: Rosa Esther

texts.es:
Rosa Esther es una joven estudiante d e Administración de Empresa, ella solicita un préstamos para poder cubrir todos los gastos educativo, esta es su historia:Mi nombre es Rosa Esther, tengo 18 años de edad, vivo con mis padres y solo la mayor de dos hermanas, nací y crecí en Santo Domingo. Mi Madre es enfermera, actualmente el único ingreso económica en mi hogar es el de mi madre ya que a mi Padre desde hace un tiempo está desempleado.
Estudio en la Universidad Apec, cursando el 2do cuatrimestre de la carrera Administración de Empresas, estudio esta carrera porque me encanta el ámbito de los negocios, la interacción con las personas y la relación de negocios y negociantes, algunas de las materias que he toma han sido Mercadeo, Ética en los negocios y Administración las cuales son las que más me han gustado ya que van muy de la mano con mi carrera.
La necesidad de este préstamos es que mi Familia no puede costear mis estudios y por ello me dirijo a ustedes para que hagan posible mi sueño de terminar mi carrera, si no recibiera el préstamo me afectaría en no terminar mi carrera ya que como anteriormente les dije no contamos con los recursos necesarios para esto. De este préstamo dependería absolutamente la conclusión de ella.
Mis metas son concluir mis estudios para con ello poder ayudar a mi Familia y brindarle todo el apoyo que esta necesita y poder desenvolverme en el ámbito laboral me gustaría trabajar en una empresa en el sector de la gerencia o en recursos humanos y aportar a la sociedad.
texts.en:
Rosa Esther is a young woman studying Business Administration.  She is requesting a loan to be able to cover all of her education expenses.  This is her story.

My name is Rosa Esther, and I am 18 years old.  I live with my parents.  I am the older of two sisters.  I was born and grew up in Santo Domingo.  My mother is a nurse.  Currently the only income in my household is from my mother because my father has been unemployed for some time.

I attend the Universidad Apec, and I am in the second semester of Business Administration.  I am studying this career because I love the field of business, the interaction with people, and the relationship between businesses and business people.  Some of the subjects I have taken are marketing, business ethics, and administration.  These are the ones that I have liked the most because they go along with my career.

The need for this loan is that my family is not able to pay for my studies.  Therefore, I am addressing you so that you can make my dream of finishing my studies possible.  If I do not receive the loan, I will not finish my education.  As I told you earlier, we do not have the resources needed for this.  Completing my education depends completely on the loan.

My goals are to complete my studies in order to be able to help my family and to give them all of the support they need.  Another goal is to be able to get along in the work force.  I would like to work at a company in the area of management or in human resources in order to contribute to society.

loans.use: to pay for higher education costs.

loans.name: Ranokhon

texts.en: Ranokhon is a hardworking woman. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a teacher and has a small salary. Her children are schoolboys. Ranokhon has her own business. She sells women’s clothes in a local market. Ranokhon renews her goods every season, and in this way she attracts customers. Ranokhon’s business is the main source of income for her family. Ranokhon is going to buy women’s clothes for the new spring season, but she does not have enough money. She is asking for a loan of 4,000 TJS to buy women’s clothes for the new season.  She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy women’s clothes for the new season.

loans.name: Martha Zenaida

texts.es:
Martha tiene 32 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, vive con su hermana en la avenida el Magisterio perteneciente al Cantón Echeandía, Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Virgen de Guadalupe, la cual se encuentra ubicada a 60 minutos de la oficina operativa Guaranda, está conformada por 10 socios. 
Martha es empleada privada. Solicita el crédito para continuar con sus estudios. Los cuales los realiza en ventanas. Su meta es tener su negocio propio. Su desafío es el transporte. En su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte, la costumbre que más le gusta es el carnaval.
texts.en:
Martha is 32 years old, single and lives with her sister in el Magisterio Avenue in Echeandía Canton, Bolivar Province. She is a member of the Virgen de Guadalupe communal bank which is located 60 minutes from the Guaranda office and is made up of 10 members. 

Martha is a private employee. She is requesting a loan to continue her studies which she does in Ventanas. Her goal is to have her own business. Her challenge is transportation. In her spare time she likes to play sports and she enjoys carnival.

loans.use: to continue her studies.

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en: Ramil is 22 years old, married, and has one child. Due to lack of job opportunities, he cultivates their farmland by planting vegetables and root crops for sale. Despite the hardship of farming, he aims to expand his planting in order to increase his production. Having limited capital, he is seeking financial assistance amounting to PHP 10,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides needed in vegetable production. Through patience and hard work, he believes that he will increase his production.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides needed in vegetable production.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en: Annabelle is 30 years old, and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  Annabelle has a rice retail business in the Philippines. Annabelle requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell. She has been in this business for two years. In the future, Annabelle would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 42-year-old woman. She is living with her spouse, three daughters, and four sons in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a turner by profession and he manufactures spare parts of vehicles. He has been operating a lathe machine for many years and can easily renew or manufacture the spare parts of various vehicles. 

Her husband's lathe machine has become out of order and some tools have been wearing out due to continuous use and they need to be replaced. He has spent all his savings to buy cast iron for manufacturing spare parts and he does not have money to fix the lathe machine.

Therefore, Parveen has requested a loan for her husband, so that he could fix the lathe machine. She is relaxed now because she hopes that her husband could easily operate his lathe machine again. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to fix her husband's lathe machine.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel vivió hasta siete años con energía eléctrica momento cuando se traslado a una comunidad en la zona de Jinotega donde conoció a la que hoy es su esposa y madre de sus dos hijos  un varón y una niña. Comenta que su suegro les ha cedido  unas manzanas de tierra  para que ellos  pudieran trabajarlas y de ahí sacar el pan de cada día , dice que el siembra  granos básicos, banano patriota , café , ademas al engorde  de cerdos los cuales los vende una vez que están listo para destazarlos. El quiere un crédito para comprar un sistema  solar para su hogar  para no seguir alumbrándose con candiles ya que genera mucho humo y le causa problemas de salud a sus hijos
texts.en: Manuel lives with electricity until 7 years ago when he moved to a community in the Jinotega region where he met the woman who is now his wife and mother of his two children, a boy and a girl. He comments that his father-in-law gave them a few manzanas of land for them to work and this is how they earn their daily bread. He says that they grow basic grains, bananas, coffee, plus they fatten pigs and sell them once they are ready to butcher. Manuel wants a loan to buy a solar system for his house so they don't have to continue to use lamps as they produce a lot of smoke and cause health problems for the children.

loans.use: to buy a solar system.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en: Mwanasha is a widowed woman, and has five children, four in school and one adult. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.  She has operated a fish selling business for the last ten years, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase fish, cooking oil, and firewood for her business. She decided to join, to acquire financial services for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish, cooking oil,and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Luisa Guadalupe

texts.es: Luisa, tiene 35 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene 2 hijos y reside en la comunidad de Olanchito, Yoro. Ella tiene su propio negocio para generar sus ingresos, elabora viveros de plantas ornamentales, frutales y medicinales para vender. Esta actividad la realiza en su casa y vende las plantas en la misma zona donde reside. El préstamo que solicita es por 10,000 Lempiras y los va invertir en la compra de otras plantas ornamentales, frutales y medicinales que no tiene y poder ofrecer variedad a sus clientes. Su plan es darle buena educación a sus hijos mediante el crecimiento de su negocio.
texts.en: Luisa is 35 years old. She lives in a common-law relationship with her husband with whom she has two children. They live in the community of Olanchito, Yoro. She has her own business to generate income. She has greenhouses growing  ornamental, fruit and medicinal plants to sell. She does this at her home and sells in the same area she lives in. The loan she is requesting is for 10,000 HNL and she will invest them in buying  other  ornamental, fruit and medicinal plants that she doesn't have to offer to her clients. Her plan is to provide a good education for her children through the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy ornamental, fruit and medicinal plants that she doesn't have to offer to her clients.

loans.name: Shoghakat

texts.en:
Shoghakat is married and has one child. She lives in Nairi village. The whole family is involved in farming. They own an arable land where tomatoes, cabbages, peppers, and grass are cultivated. To tackle financial hardships, Shoghakat's husband also works at the village municipality, but the income he earns is so low that agriculture is the main source for their living.

Shoghakat requested her first loan for $1,500, which she will use to purchase seeds and fertilizer and to cover cultivation costs (workforce, harvest gathering process).  The loan has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history. As new cultivation season has already started, the loan will greatly help Shoghakat to continue her farming business and sustain her farm.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer and to cover cultivation costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase barbed wire, staples, posts and  pay the laborers

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a 43-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a vibrant place and her primary customers are of all types. 

Annah describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to own a beauty parlor within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will build a permanent home for her family. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes for resale

loans.name: Shodigul

texts.en:
Shodigul was born in 1987. She is young and a hard-working woman. Shodigul is divorced and has a little child. 

Shodigul sells flatbreads in a local market. She has her own selling place and her own regular customers. She sells tasty flatbreads. She is the only breadwinner for her child and herself. Shodigul’s former husband doesn’t help her to provide their child with all necessary things. 

Shodigul must increase her working capital. She is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy flatbreads and also to buy clothes for her child. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy flatbreads to increase her working capital and clothes for her child

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion is 40 years old and married with eight children, two of whom are in school. Asuncion works very hard to provide for them.

Asuncion runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Asuncion has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, snack foods and other groceries. 

In the future, Asuncion wants to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nabeela

texts.en:
Nabeela is a 39-year-old married woman. She has been doing embroidery by hand at home for many years to support her family. In fact, her husband has a low wage job. For the sake of her children and to meet household expenses, Nabeela started doing embroidery at home. A supplier comes to her home and provides her all raw materials for doing embroidery; she completes her tasks along  with her daughter over a wooden frame. 

Annah wants to sell hand embroidery directly in the market so that she can earn more profit for her family. She has become expert in her art and wants to buy raw materials on her own so that she can sell her hand-made embroidery in her hometown.

Therefore, Annah has requested a loan to buy raw materials so she can make more embroidered dresses to sell and can generate maximum income. She is a mother of a daughter and two sons. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales. She wishes to utilize a portion of her revenue to provide quality education for her children.

loans.use: To buy raw material for embroidery.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a 59-year-old married man. He has eight children. He describes himself to be persuasive. He operates a tailoring business where he makes clothes for sale. He has been involved in this business for 13 years. His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are reliable. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low capital. 

Christopher will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy fabric, thread, and other tailoring materials. His business goal is to expand within five years.
