He hopes that in the future, he will improve his business and his standard of living. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of Kes 20,000 was repaid. successfully.

loans.use: buy fabric, thread and other tailoring materials

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is fifty-four years old, married and has three children.  

Elizabeth and her family  survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Elizabeth is taking out a housing loan amounting to Php10,000 purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. She has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. 

With your help, Elizabeth can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Ekaterine

texts.en:
Ekaterine, who is 31 years old and a married woman, lives in the village of Dirbi. She has a husband, two school-aged sons and one infant. The family's significant source of income is from agricultural activity. Ekaterine and her husband work hard on family-owned agricultural land, where they cultivate beans, garlic and tomatoes. They sell  harvested products locally and generate small monthly income. 

To cover all daily costs and satisfy her family's increased needs, Ekaterine decided to start her own activity. With the requested loan she plans to purchase clothing at wholesale prices and sell at a higher price in her community. The loan will greatly assist Ekaterine and she will be able to improve her economic situation and give her family a better style of life. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To start a sales business with clothing

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is a 44-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has owned an enterprise stitching and selling embroidery by machine in the nearby town for many years. He has been recruiting skilled persons for embroidery work on daily wages; he also brings some material home for Azra because she helps him in embroidery work. He is very expert in his profession, and he is especially famous for bridal dresses. People like his art and appreciate his efforts. 

He wants to cope with the demand for bridal dresses; that is why he wants to buy stock of thread, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors in addition.

Azra requires some capital to buy the desired inventory for her husband but she does not have a sufficient amount. For that reason, she humbly requested  BRAC Pakistan for a loan. Using this loan her husband would be able to buy stocks of thread, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors. Azra is very glad and thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy stocks of thread, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors.

loans.name: Zivaida

texts.ru: Зивайде 60 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Зивайды - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Зивайда занимается животноводством, стартовав 14 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Зивайды, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 1 теленок, а также 1,27 ГА земельного надела, на котором ежегодно выращивает овощи, такие как: морковь, лук,  арбузы, дыни. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Зивайда обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Зивайда планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение внуков.
texts.en: Zivaida is 60 years old, married and raising 2 children together with her husband. Zivaida has a secondary education. To provide the primary income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry, having started 14 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Zivaida's hard work, today her business contains 3 dairy cows, 1 calf and 1.27 hectares of land, where she annually grows vegetables, such as carrots, onions, watermelons and cantaloupe.  The monthly income amounts to 12,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Zivaida requested a loan from the bank "Bai-Tushum" to buy sheep in order to increase her livestock headcount. Zivaida plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money for her grandsons' continued education.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Gladys Amigda

texts.es: Gladys tiene 52 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y grupo familiar. Gladys se  gana la vida mediante la prestación de servicios domésticos. Desde hace más de 7 años. Ella se caracteriza por ser una mujer responsable pero sobre todo trabajadora. Ella desea mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales y las de su familia por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de paredes para ampliación de vivienda para lo cual comprará cemento y arena dado que ya cuanta  con materiales como: ladrillo y hierro. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así dar a su familia condiciones mas cómodas y seguras.
texts.en:
Gladys is 52 years old and resides in her own home along with her life companion and the rest of her family. She earns her living by providing housekeeping services. Gladys has been doing this for more than seven years. She is known for being a responsible woman, but most of all as a hard worker.

Gladys wants to improve the living conditions for herself and her family, so she is requesting this loan from FUSAI. She will invest in the construction of walls so that she can expand her house. Gladys will buy cement and sand since she already has other materials, such as bricks and iron.

She hopes to receive this loan so that she can provide her family with more comfortable and safer conditions.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand so that she can build walls to expand her house.

loans.name: Mikumi Group

texts.en:
Agness, who is in her early 40s, is married and has five children who are in school. She has three girls and two boys. For seven years now, Agness has been making her living by running two activities: a charcoal selling business and poultry. She raises up to 300 chicks per month, but she keeps on replacing them every month. Agness has been in this business for seven years. Agness's business is open from 7 am to 8 pm each working day and she is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

This is her twentieth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to restock charcoal and bought more chicks. She really improved her businesses. 

Agness has paid back all of her previous loans successfully. With the profit she earned from her business, she bought a plot of land, covered part of school fees and home food expenses and built a house. Agness will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal to resell. She dreams of being rich. 

Agness will share this loan with her loan group" MIKUMI " which totals eight members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Marhamat

texts.en:
Marhamat was born in 1953. She is a widow and has adult children. Marhamat is a hardworking woman. She has her own business. She raises cattle. 

Marhamat buys cows, feeds them for some months, and sells them in a local market. She has her regular customers, thanks to the good condition of her cattle. 

Marhamat always strives for the well-being of her family. She is going to buy furniture for her sitting room as she has no furniture. Marhamat is asking for a loan of 2000 Somoni to buy furniture. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy furniture for her sitting room as she has no furniture

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is 56 years old and blessed with nine children. She and her husband help each other in cultivating their farm land, planting vegetables for sale. They aim to improve their farming business in order to cover the necessities of their family and support the education of their children. Due to financial insufficiency, Elena is asking for a  loan of PHP 10,000.00 to buy fertilizers and insecticides needed in vegetable production. They believe that their loan will enable them to improve their farming business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and insecticides needed in vegetable production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of fish

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 48 years old and widowed with three children, one of whom is in school. Aida works very hard to provide for them.

Aida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Aida has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, snack foods, sardines and other groceries. 

In the future, Aida would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Flora

texts.en:
This is Ma. Flora, 42, a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. Her partner is Robert, a worker abroad and they have children. She manages their household while operating the business. She and her partner are working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ma. Flora operates a variety store. In the Philippines; a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Ma. Flora earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php 40,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Ma. Flora dreams of expanding her business and hopes to have their own house.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Fadia

texts.en:
Fadia is a 43-year-old widowed mother of three children. She is working hard since her beloved husband passed away to provide them with the necessities for living. 

In 2005, Fadia established her clothes and lingerie-selling business to make sure that she can provide her beloved family with their needs, and cover almost all of their requested expenses. 

Fadia is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with special newly released spring and summer collections necessary for her business development and increase in income.

Fadia is very energetic, well known in her community, and supported by almost all of her customers who are mainly relatives, friends, neighbors and passersby. She aims to increase her faithful clientele and attract new ones through diversifying her products to suit everyone's requests.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with special newly released spring and summer collections

loans.name: Sergio Enrique

texts.es:
Sergio tiene 24 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive con sus padres en la comunidad de Joyocoto perteneciente al cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla de los Emprendedores  se encuentra ubicada a 20 minutos de la oficina operativa Guaranda, está formada por 10 socios que son de la misma comunidad, y que se dedican a la agricultura.
Sergio se dedica a la construcción. Solicita el crédito para poder  concluir  sus estudios, los cuales los realiza en Guaranda. Su meta es tener un trabajo estable. Su desafío es ser una persona competente laboralmente. En su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte y la costumbre que le gusta es el carnaval y fin de año.
texts.en:
Sergio is 24 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the community of Joyocoto, which is part of the canton of Guaranda in Bolívar Province. He is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Emprendedores” (The Entrepreneurs), which is located 20 minutes away from the Cooperativa San Jose office that operates in Guaranda. The group includes 10 members who are from the same community. They engage in agriculture.

Sergio works in construction. He is requesting a loan so that he can finish his studies. Sergio attends classes in Guaranda. His goal is to have a stable job. His challenge is to become an individual who is competent in his work.

Sergio likes to play sports in his free time and he enjoys the custom known as Carnival.

loans.use: to pay for the remainder of his studies.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is thirty-two years old with six children, three of them in school, 

Virginia's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Virginia  has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Virginia has taken a PHP 9,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Virginia is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future would like to save enough so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: María Fernanda

texts.es:
María es una joven emprendedora y dinámica de 23 años de edad, que desde hace un mes comenzó su propio negocio con el apoyo familiar, abrió una sala de internet en un local ubicado en el barrio donde reside, actualmente cuenta con 4 equipos de cómputo y hasta el momento ha logrado tener buena acogida y aceptación en el sector.
Con el fin de iniciar su historial crediticio y acreditar poco a poco su negocio, solicita el crédito como capital de trabajo para comprar surtido de papelería (resmas de papel, tintas para impresora y otros), esto le permitirá prestar un mejor y más completo servicio a sus clientes, logrando incrementar las ventas y los ingresos que genera al prestar los servicios.
María, con su espíritu de superación y las ganas de progresar, manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es posicionar bien su negocio actual y más adelante abrir otra surcursal y estar en la capacidad de hacerlos perdurables en el tiempo, logrando reconocimiento y garantizando una estabilidad económica que le permita brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
María is an enterprising and dynamic young woman who is 23 years of age. One month ago, she started her own business with the support of her family. She opened an Internet café in a shop located in the neighborhood where she lives. At the moment, she has four computer stations and her business has been well-received and accepted in the area.

In order to start her credit history and gradually build up a reputation for her business, María is requesting a loan to use as operating capital for buying a stock of office supplies (reams of paper, printer ink, and other items). This would allow her to provide better and more comprehensive service to her customers. She would also be able to increase her sales and generate more revenue from the services she provides.

María has the spirit to succeed and the desire to make progress. She says that her greatest wish is for her current business to be well-positioned before opening another location. This would provide her with stability over time, help build her recognition, and guarantee a solid financial foundation that would allow her to provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy reams of paper, printer ink, and other supplies.

loans.name: Deisi Noemi

texts.es: Doña Deisi, tiene 48 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 5 hijos y reside en el municipio de Quimistán con su madre y cuatro de sus hijos. Hace 12 años que doña Deisi estableció su propia fuente de ingresos, en su casa tiene establecido un taller de confección donde hace vestidos, blusas, pantalones, uniformes, trajes, faldas y reparación de ropa y esta iniciando con  una pequeña pulpería para vender productos de la canasta básica familiar. Ha solicitado el segundo ciclo de préstamo que es por 20,000 lempiras, con el cual va comprar materia prima como telas, hilos, agujas, botones, elásticos y también productos alimenticios como granos básicos, refrescos, manteca, azúcar, huevos churros y otros para vender. Su propósito es lograr que sus hijos se gradúen y hacer crecer el negocio de pulpería.
texts.en:
Deisi is 48 years old and is a single mother. She has 5 children and lives in the town of Quimistán with her mother and four of her children. Twelve years ago Deisi set up her own source of income. She has an established sewing workshop in her home where she makes dresses, blouses, trousers, uniforms, suits and skirts and does garment repairs. She is also setting up a small grocery store to sell basic everyday groceries.

She has asked for a second loan which is for 20,000 lempiras, which she will use to buy raw materials such as fabric, thread, needles, buttons and elastic as well as food products such as basic grains, soft drinks, lard, sugar, eggs, doughnuts and other items to sell. 

Her aim is to enable her children to graduate and to grow the grocery business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as fabric, thread, needles, buttons and elastic as well as food products such as basic grains, soft drinks, lard, sugar, eggs, doughnuts and other items to sell in the grocery store.

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es:
Oscar vive sin energía eléctrica.Para los años 80 tubo que dejar la escuela ya que llegaban a buscar jóvenes  y los reclutaban para la guerra para el fueron tiempos dificles por que tenia que estarse escondiendo, pasada la guerra se dedico a trabajar una tierra que le heredo su padre.El cosecha en estas tierras  café y granos básicos
con esto el poco a poco a ido comprando sus cosas como una motocicleta, una moto sierra ademas de hacer mejoraras a su casa.
El nos comenta que hace unos años en la comunidad donde vivía puso una planta hidroeléctrica pero se daño y no la ha reparado  por que es demasiado caro el repuesto , por ello esta solicitando  un préstamo para adquirir un sistema solar el cual seria de mucho provecho para el y su familia el poder tener energía  en su hogar.
texts.en:
Oscar lives without electricity. In the '80s, he had to leave school because they were recruiting young men for the war. Those were hard times for him because he had to be in hiding. After the war, he farmed the land that he inherited from his father. He grows coffee and staple grains on this land. He has slowly been buying things, such as a motorcycle and a chainsaw, in addition to improving his house.

Oscar says that a few years ago they put a hydroelectric plant in his community, but it was damaged and hasn't been repaired because it's too costly. Because of this, he is requesting a loan to obtain a solar energy system. Being able to have solar-powered electricity in his home would greatly benefit him and his family.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 28-year-old married man. He has one child who is two years old. He describes himself to be patient. He operates a butchery where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a favorable place and his primary customers are local residents. 

Patrick will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of meat. His business goal is to expand and open another branch within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will employ people to work for him. This is his fourth loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of Kes 20,000 was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to improve his living standard.

loans.use: buy more stock of meat.

loans.name: Rosa Milagro

texts.es: Rosa tiene 45 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus padres y su hija. Ella es una mujer emprendedora quien se dedica a la venta de variedad de productos como: ropa de cama, planchas, cortinas, gabachas de cocina, etc. De esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Ella desea mejorar sus ingresos y sus condiciones de vida por lo cual ha tomado la decisión de invertir en su negocio dado que es su principal fuente de ingresos y desea ser competitiva dentro de su localidad. Rosa solicita este crédito a FUSAI para  invertir en la compra de variedad de productos para la venta como: planchas, ropa de cama, accesorios de cocina, cortinas, etc.
texts.en:
Rosa is 45 years old and lives in her own home with her parents and her daughter. She is an enterprising woman who works selling a variety of products, such as bed linens, irons, curtains, kitchen aprons, etc. That is how she earns her living and supports her family. She wants to improve her income and her living standards, which is why she has made a decision to invest in her business, since it is her main source of income and she wants to be locally competitive. 

Rosa is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in purchasing a variety of products to sell, such as irons, bed linens, kitchen accessories, curtains, etc.

loans.use: to buy irons, bed linens, kitchen accessories, curtains, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la clienta de 27 años de edad desde hace varios años se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado central que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos, la clienta esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de frutas y verduras por mayor para poder obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This borrower is 27 years old and has been working selling fruits and vegetables for several years. Her business is located in a central market near her home. The profit she makes from her sales and her husband's help allow them to cover some of their household expenses. She lives in her own home with her husband and children.

This borrower is requesting a loan to buy wholesale fruits and vegetables in order to be able to obtain better profits and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Ozoda

texts.en:
Ozoda was born in 1986. She is married and has three children. Ozoda lives with her family in the northern part of Tajikistan. 

Ozada works hard from early morning until late evening on the land. She grows potatoes. She also feeds cows and sells milk to the local market. Ozoda’s husband and mother-in-law help her with managing the business. 

Ozoda is going to make a new sowing, but she does not have money. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 USD to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and a cow. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and a cow.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more hogs and feed needed in her business. Her income is assisting their everyday household expenditures. As a widow, she works hard to provide for their everyday needs. She also has a variety store for additional income. 
 
She would like to apply for another loan, in the amount of PHP 18,000, to buy additional hogs and feed needed for her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Susana hopes to expand her business and dreams to have a better living. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for hogs and feed needed in her business.

loans.name: Irene Grace

texts.en:
Irene Grace is 27 years old, married with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Irene Grace's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regain what she lost. Irene Grace is taking out a PHP 10,000 Housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Irene Grace has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Irene Grace would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is a 33-year-old married man and a hardworking Ugandan living in Kagadi with six children aged between 13 and 7 years. Only four attend school. He has been trading in cattle together with farming and hopes to educate his children, though challenged by competition and price fluctuations. Alex intends to use the loan to buy more cattle.

loans.use: to buy more cattle.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 44 years old and married with two children; both are in school. Mary Ann works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Ann runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mary Ann has been in this business for twenty years and sells a variety of items such as bread, canned goods and soft drinks. 

In the future Mary Ann would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 30-year-old married woman. She has two children, ages 3 and 6 years. She describes herself to be ambitious and hardworking. 

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in an urban area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a shortage of stock. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. 

Her business goal is to be prosperous within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will achieve her business goals. She will use the anticipated profits to open more businesses.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Jose Alfredo

texts.es: Jose de 66 años de edad, se dedica desde hace varios años a la siembra de verduras y legumbres, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona, posee mucha clientela ya establecida porque su producto es fresco y de buena calidad con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus hijos, Jose esta solicitando un crédito para la compra fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. para poder seguir con sus siembras y así poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose is 66 years old and has been working growing vegetables and legumes for several years. He sells his products in nearby areas and has a large and stable customer base because his produce is fresh and high-quality. What he makes from his sales allows him to cover his household expenses. He lives in his own home with his wife and children.

Jose is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides, weed killers, etc. in order to continue farming and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, weed killers, etc.

loans.name: Grabiela

texts.es: Grabiela de 64 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa lo hace de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por los buenos precios y la calidad del producto, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, Grabiela esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de ropa por mayor como: faldas, blusas, pantalones, camisas, etc. y así poder seguir con sus ventas y tener junto con sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Grabiela is 64 years old and lives in her own house with her children. She makes a living selling clothing as a street vendor around the various neighbourhoods near her home. She has a lot of customers because of her good prices and the quality of her items and with the money she makes from her sales she is able to cover some of the household costs. 

Grabiela is asking for a loan to buy wholesale clothing such as skirts, blouses, trousers, shirts etc. so she can continue with her sales and have a better quality of life for herself and her children.

loans.use: to buy wholesale clothing such as skirts, blouses, trousers, shirts etc.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is 36 years old, married and the mother of two children, both of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Ailyn has a business selling bananas in the Philippines. She has been in this business for fifteen years. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock of bananas to sell in her stall.

In the future, Ailyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bananas to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Jose Ezequiel

texts.es: José, tiene 31 años de edad, esta soltero, vive en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Anteriormente el realizaba trabajos de  construcción, y hace 4 años decidió tener su propia fuente de ingresos. Se dedica a vender mercadería de ropa como ser camisas, camisetas, calcetas, jeans y bóxer para hombres. Las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante. Ha solicitado un segundo préstamo a la institución por la cantidad de 10,000 Lempiras, con el fin de comprar más ropa como jean, camisas, calcetas y bóxer para incrementar el inventario y aumentar las ventas. Su sueño es lograr poner una tiendita de ropa y lograr formar su hogar.
texts.en: José is 31 years old and single. He lives in the municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Previously, he had worked in construction. Four years ago, he decided to earn his own source of income. He sells clothing, such as shirts, T-shirts, socks, jeans, and men's boxers. He makes his sales from place to place. He has requested a second loan from the communal bank for 10,000 lempiras in order to buy more clothes, such as jeans, shirts, socks, and men's boxers to grow his inventory and increase sales. His dream is to set up a small clothing store and to start a family.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell, such as jeans, shirts, T-shirts, socks, and boxers.

loans.name: Maria Maura

texts.es: María tiene 44 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hijo. María se dedica a la venta de pupusas y ropa desde hace más de dos años. Es una mujer muy trabajadora quien se gana la vida honradamente y lucha día con día para dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. Ella desea invertir en su negocio dado que es su principal fuente de ingresos y con el objetivo de contar con mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida solicita este crédito a FUSAI para proceder a la compra de equipo como sillas y mesas para dar mejor servicio a sus clientes y poder así lograr su objetivo de mejorar sus ventas e ingresos.
texts.en:
María is 44 years old and lives in her own house with her son. For more than 2 years she has made a living selling pupusas [thick corn tortillas stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans] and clothing. She is a very hard working woman who earns an honest living and works hard every day to provide better living conditions for her family. 

She wants to invest in her business as it is her main source of income. In order to increase her income and so improve her living conditions she is asking FUSAI for this loan so she can go and buy equipment such as tables and chairs. This will enable her to give her customers better service and achieve her objective of improving her sales and her income.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her pupusa business.

loans.name: Wilson Oswaldo

texts.es:
Wilson tiene 39 años de edad, de estado civil casado, vive con su esposa y sus 6 hijos de 3, 5, 10, 14, 17,19 años en la comunidad de Joyocoto perteneciente al cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla de los Emprendedores  se encuentra ubicada a 20 minutos de la oficina operativa Guaranda, está formada por 10 socios que son de la misma comunidad, y que se dedican a la agricultura.
Wilson se dedica a la construcción a la agricultura y a la crianza de cerdos. Solicita el crédito para la compra de abono, insecticida, fertilizantes, urea, fungicida. La compra lo realiza en Guaranda. Su meta es comprarse un vehículo. Su desafío es la  influencia del clima y plagas en sus cultivos. En su tiempo libre se dedica a hacer deporte y la costumbre que más le gusta es el carnaval.
texts.en:
Wilson is 39 years old and married. He lives with his wife and six children (ages 3, 5, 10, 14, 17, and 19) in the community of Joyocoto, which is part of the canton of Guaranda in Bolívar Province. He is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Emprendedores” (The Entrepreneurs), which is located 20 minutes away from the Cooperativa San Jose office that operates in Guaranda. The group includes 10 members who are from the same community. They engage in agriculture.

Wilson works in construction, but he is also a farmer and raises pigs. He is requesting a loan in order to buy compost, insecticide, fertilizers, urea, and fungicides. His purchases will be made in Guaranda. Wilson’s goal is to buy a vehicle. His challenges include dealing with the weather changes and the pests that could attack his crops.

Wilson likes to play sports in his free time and he enjoys the custom known as Carnival.

loans.use: to buy compost, insecticide, fertilizers, urea, and fungicides.

loans.name: Joseline Gabriela

texts.es:
Joseline tiene 20 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, vive con sus padres en el barrio 13 de agosto, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandía, Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Virgen de Guadalupe, la cual se encuentra ubicada a 60 minutos de la oficina operativa Guaranda, está conformada por 10 socios. 
Joseline tiene una tienda de abastos, se dedica al comercio. Solicita el crédito para compra de abastos, incrementando así su negocio. La compra la realiza en Ventanas. Su meta es agrandar su local. Su desafío es la competencia. En su tiempo libre le gusta bailar, la costumbre que más le gusta es el carnaval.
texts.en:
Joseline, who is 20 years old, is single and lives with her parents in the 13 de agosto district which belongs to the Echeandía Canton in the Province of Bolívar. She is a member of the Virgen de Guadalupe communal bank, which is located 60 minutes from the Guaranda operations office and is made up of 10 members. Joseline has a grocery store and makes a living from retail. 

She is asking for the loan to buy groceries, so she can grow her business. She makes her purchases in Ventanas. Her goal is to extend her shop. The challenge she faces is the competition. In her free time she likes to dance, and the tradition she likes the most is the carnival.

loans.use: compra de abastos

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cinder blocks, cement, sand, iron, zinc sheets and wooden beams, and pay for labour.

loans.name: Jhona

texts.en: Jhona owns and operates a motorcycle transport service and has been in this activity for more than four years. With her generated revenue, she was able to provide for the family and her previous loan was used to buy spare parts and tires. To improve and secure the services, she took a new loan to renew the vehicle registration. In the future, she wants to sustain her transportation business and wants to save a portion of her profit to use when they get old.

loans.use: to renew the vehicle registration.

loans.name: Iram

texts.en:
Iram is 29 and she is living with her two children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

The financial condition of her family is not good. Her husband owns a small tailoring shop. Now he wants to expand his shop by hiring a new skilled person so that he could take more orders for sewing but he does not have an extra Juki machine for him.

Therefore, Iram has requested a loan for her husband so that he could buy a new machine to enhance his tailoring shop. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a Juki sewing machine for tailoring.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la clienta de 28 años de edad es madre soltera, ella se dedica a la venta de medicina natural desde hace varios años, posee mucha clientela porque sus productos son de muy buena calidad y a precios accesibles, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su hijo quien estudia actualmente, la clienta esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de medicina natural por mayor y seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así poderle dar a su hijo lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
The client, age 28, is a single mother and has worked selling natural medicine for several years now. Due to the high quality of her products and reasonable prices, she has a lot of customers, and with the earnings she is able to pay for the household expenditure. 

She lives in her own house along with her son, who is currently studying. She is requesting this loan to buy natural medicines in bulk. This will allow her to continue with her business, since it is her only source of income, and give her son what he needs without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy natural medicine in bulk.

loans.name: Annalisa

texts.en:
Annalisa previously accessed a 55,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education, and with their personal, household and business expenditures. She also has a videoke for rent for additional income.


She would like to apply for another 51,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her child’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Annalisa dreams that her business will last longer and hopes that her son will finish his studies. She meets with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups of 15 to 30 that meet weekly. The groups study the Word of God, build social capital, and encourage the repayment of micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Ikhlas

texts.en:
Ikhlas is a 41-year-old married mother of five children who started her own business six months ago to help her beloved husband and support him in covering their increasing family living needs.

Ikhlas opened a small grocery store and her business is going on just fine, but just like any newly established business, it needs additional financial support in order to make sure that she can cover almost everything her family might need.

That's why she is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to expand her working place and increase her merchandise with special spring and summer offer beverages to increase her income and develop her beloved children's living.

She hopes that through her future acquired loans, she will work hard on starting wholesale trade and will make sure that her beloved children will have the chance to finish their necessary educational studies.

loans.use: to expand her working place and increase her merchandise with special spring and summer offer beverages

loans.name: Nelly Silvania

texts.es:
Nelly tiene 47 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, vive con sus 5 hijos de 29, 28, 22, 20,9 años, en la ciudadela 5 de Octubre perteneciente al Cantón Echeandia, Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Virgen de Guadalupe, la cual se encuentra ubicada a 60 minutos de la oficina, está conformada por 10 socios. 
Nelly tiene un negocio de abastos, se dedica al comercio. Solicita el crédito para compra de abastos, incrementando así su negocio. La compra la realiza en Ventanas. Su meta es seguir adelante. Su desafío es la competencia. En su tiempo libre le gusta ver televisión, la costumbre que más le gusta es el carnaval.
texts.en:
Nelly is 47 years old, single, and lives with her five children, ages 29, 28, 22, 20, and 9, in the “5 de Octubre” neighborhood, within the Echeandia settlement, in the Bolivar province.

She is a member of the “Virgen de Guadalupe” group, located an hour from the office and made up of 10 members.

Nelly is a merchant and has a grocery business.  She is asking for this loan to buy groceries and grow her business.  She makes her purchases in Ventanas and her goal is to continue ahead.  Her challenge is the competition.  She likes to watch TV in her spare time and her favorite cultural activity is carnival.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a 45-year-old female who lives in the town of Masindi, Uganda. Alice has got a retail shop along the highway where she sells general merchandise. She has got cattle that add to her income. Her business is located along a highway where the general public can access her services. Alice started the business so as to earn a living. She has a great dream of educating her children though challenged with competition. She wants a loan to buy general merchandise.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise.

loans.name: Ceidi Antonieta

texts.es: Ceidi nació en la ciudad a los  dos de   edad se la llevaron a vivir  a la comunidad donde actualmente vive luego a la edad de 6 años regreso a la ciudad donde curso la primaria y secundaria, años mas tarde regreso  a la comunidad para trabajar  como profesora. Ahí ella conoció a quien fuera su marido por 14 años hasta que falleció procrearon cuatro hijos, desde su muerte ella reunió a sus hijos y se han dedicado  a trabajar la tierra, sembrando granos básicos , cosechando café y  bananos ,ella dice que trabaja duro para salir adelante con sus hijos y recibe el apoyo de su padre quien le ayuda en los labores del campo. Ella  desea un préstamo para adquirir un sistema solar y poder tener energia en su hogar  así mejorara la calidad de vida de su familia
texts.en: Ceidi was born in the city but at age 2 she was taken to live in the community where she currently lives.  At age 6 she went back to the city where she attended elementary and middle school.  Years later she went back to the other community to work as a teacher.  It was there where she met her husband of 14 years until he passed away.  They had four children.  Since her husband’s death, she has gotten her children together and worked the land, raising basic grains, coffee, and bananas.  She says that she works hard to get ahead with her children and gets her father’s help in the fields.  She is asking for a loan to acquire a solar power system so she can have electricity in her house, which will improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a solar power system.

loans.name: Aiyda

texts.ru: Аийда 38 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Аийды - средне-специальное образование, окончила техникум, по специальности -повар. Трудовую деятельность начала в средней школе, затем вышла замуж, но продолжила работать. По характеру Аийда очень ответственная, общительная, жизнерадостная. Вместе с мужем Аийда занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Аийды, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 2 лошади. Ежемесячный доход составляет 16,000 сом (KGS) от реализации молока, также обрабатывает 2,0 ГА земли, где в основном выращивает -фасоль и картофель. Полученный урожай реализуют оптовым поставщикам. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Аийда обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум"  за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. После закупки коров, они будут находиться в собственном хозяйстве. Летом скот будет под присмотром пастуха. Доходы от кредита Аийда планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на оплату обучения детей в высших учебных заведениях.
texts.en: Aiyda is 38 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising four children. Aiyda has a secondary-specialized education. She graduated from a technical college with a degree as a chef. She began her professional career in secondary school, then she got married, but she continued to work. Aiyda is very responsible, gregarious and cheerful by nature. Aiyda and her husband practice livestock breeding and crop farming. They started this business 20 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Aiyda's hard work, she currently has 2 milk cows and 2 horses on her farm. Her monthly income is 16,000 som (KGS) from the sale of milk, as well as cultivating a 2.0 hectare plot of land on which she mainly grows beans and potatoes. The received harvest is sold to wholesale distributors. For the purpose of further developing her business, Aiyda turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy cows to increase the size of her herd. After the purchase of the cattle, they will be located on their own farm. In the summer, they will be under the care of a shepherd. Aiyda plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money for her children's university educations.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Dave

texts.en: Dave's previous loan was used to expand the existing animal stable. She requested another loan, which she will use to pay for the home energy that has  accumulated over the past couple months.

loans.use: to pay for home energy

loans.name: Abduvafo

texts.ru:
Абдувафо позитивный и трудолюбивый человек. Он женат  и имеет 4-их детей. Со своей семьёй Абдувафо живёт в небольшом посёлке. Сразу после окончания школы Абдувафо начал помогать отцу по хозяйству. Он не смог получить высшее образование в связи с финансовыми трудностями в семье. Затем он женился. А сейчас, чтобы иметь постоянный доход в семье, занимается выращиванием и продажей крупно рогатого скота. Его жена домохозяйка, тоже занята домашним хозяйством и воспитанием детей. Она очень добрая женщина. Кроме этого у них есть небольшой участок земли, на котором они трудятся не покладая рук, чтобы обеспечить своих детей и дать им  достойное образование. 

На сегодня Абдувафо желает расширять свой бизнес, чтобы в дальнейшем получать больше прибыли и тратить на все нужды своей семьи. Ему необходимо закупить несколько голов скота и корм для скота. Но сейчас у Абдувафо не хватает достаточно денежных средств для этого. Поэтому Абдувафо обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку корма для скота. Он обратился в Арванд с надеждой, что ему помогут в этом. Он заранее благодарен за поддержку.
texts.en:
Abduvafo is a positive and hardworking person. He is married and has four children. Abduvafo lives with his family in a small village. Right after Abduvafo graduated from school, he began to help his father with his farm. He was unable to receive a higher education because of financial difficulties in his family. Then he got married. Now, in order to have a stable income for his family, he raises and sells cattle. His wife is a homemaker. She does work around the house and raises their children. She is a very kind woman. Besides this, they have a small plot of land on which they work long and hard so that they can provide for their children and give them a well-deserved education.

Abduvafo currently wants to expand his business so that, in the future, he can receive a larger profit and spend it on all of his family's needs. He needs to buy several cows and livestock feed. But Abduvafo does not have enough money for this. This is why Abduvafo is requesting a loan from Arvand to buy livestock feed. He turned to Arvand in the the hope that they would help him with this. He thanks them in advance for the support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana, a 28-year-old woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, is requesting a loan for her husband, who provides luggage-carrying services with his   donkey cart. He wants to replace his donkey with a mule, which can carry more goods than a donkey. Such a purchase will increase his income and reduce his transport times.

Rehana is requesting this loan from Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan. She will use the resulting increased income to save for future needs and her children's education. Rehana thanks Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support.

loans.use: To buy a mule.

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.ru: Гульнаре 37 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Гульнары - среднее образование. Она рано вышла замуж. Вместе с мужем Гульнара занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 18 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гульнары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 2 теленка. Ежемесячный доход составляет 16,000 сом (KGS) от реализации молока, также обрабатывает 2,0 ГА земли, где в основном выращивает -фасоль и перец. Полученный урожай реализуют оптовым поставщикам. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гульнара обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум"  за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. После закупки коров, они будут находиться в собственном хозяйстве. Летом скот будет под присмотром пастуха. Доходы от кредита Гульнара планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на оплату обучения детей в высших учебных заведениях.
texts.en: Gulnara is 37 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising five children. Gulnara has a secondary education. She got married very young. Gulnara and her husband practice livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business 18 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Gulnara's hard work, she currently has 2 milk cows and 2 calves on her farm. Her monthly income is 16,000 som (KGS) from the sale of milk as well as from cultivating a 2.0 hectare plot of land on which she mainly grows beans and peppers. The received harvest is sold to wholesale distributors. For the purpose of further developing her business, Gulnara turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy cows to increase the size of her herd. After purchasing the cattle, they will be located on her farm. In the summer, they will be under the care of a shepherd. Gulnara plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money for her children's university educations.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Nurgul

texts.ru: Нургул 23 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Нургул - среднее образование, домохозяйка. По характеру Нургул очень ответственная, общительная, жизнерадостная. Вместе с мужем Нургул занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 5 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Нургул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 4 бычка, 90 овец, 2 лошади. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS) от реализации молока, также обрабатывает 1,40 ГА земли, где в основном выращивает -фасоль. Полученный урожай реализуют оптовым поставщикам. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нургул обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум"  за кредитом - на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. После закупки овец, они будут находиться в собственном хозяйстве. Летом скот будет под присмотром пастуха. Доходы от кредита Нургул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку бытовой техники.
texts.en: Nurgul is 23 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising two children. Nurgul has a secondary education and is a homemaker. Nurgul is very responsible, gregarious and cheerful by nature. Nurgul and her husband practice livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business 5 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Nurgul's hard work, she currently has 2 milk cows, 4 bull calves, 90 sheep and 2 horses on her farm. Her monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS) from the sale of milk as well as from cultivating a 1.40 hectare plot of land on which she mainly grows beans. The received harvest is sold to wholesale distributors. For the purpose of further developing her business, Nurgul turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy sheep to increase the size of her herd. After purchasing the sheep, they will be located on her farm. In the summer, they will be under the care of a shepherd. Nurgul plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to buy household appliances.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is a 25-year-old married mother of two children. Six years ago she started working in beauty business, as a hair dresser and a makeup artist, until she found herself capable of handling her own business responsibilities in 2010, and opened her own beauty salon. Manal is well known in her region with the special talents she has and customer services she provides.

Today she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to buy a car necessary for her business development and family's needs. She will use this car to improve her home beauty services she provides to some customers and is willing to develop her skills more through training sessions on everything new she might need to know.

Her main aim is to provide her children with the best education and living, that's why she is working hard to be capable of registering her son in a private school instead of public, and hopes to see them become important people in the future.

loans.use: To buy a car necessary for her business development and family's needs

loans.name: Acqaline

texts.en:
Acqaline is a 32-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be an effective and efficient person. 

She operates a farm where she keeps poultry to sell. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of enough resources to boost her business. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more chickens to rear and then sell. 

Her business goal is to own a big poultry farm within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business and improve her living standards. 

This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more chickens to rear and then sell.

loans.name: Gulniso

texts.en:
Gulniso is a 34-year-old young and successful lady. She is not married and lives with her parents and sister. 

Gulniso is a hardworking woman. She has been busy with her sewing business for more than 10 years. She sews traditional style women’s dresses as well as European style dresses. She sews dresses in her workshop which is located near her home. Her sister helps her with managing the business. 

Gulniso needs to buy a new sewing machine since her current sewing machine has broken. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy a sewing machine. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Tony

texts.en:
Tony is 53 years old, married, and has seven children. He lives in a rural community and makes his living through farming. 

Despite the hardship of living, he aims to educate his children and to give them a better living. 

He plans to expand his vegetable plantation to increase his production. Due to inadequate capital, he is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides needed for planting vegetables. 

Through hard work and determination, he believes that he will improve his farming business as well as the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides needed for vegetable production

location.town: Brgy. Bitnong, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Izzat

texts.en: Izzat was born in 1972. She is married and has 3 children. Izzat was in need of money because she did not have a business and her husband’s income is small. Six months ago she began her own business with animal husbandry. Izzat feeds 2 cows in her house where she has a cowshed. Izzat wants to develop her new business. She took part in a course ‘To Get Ahead’ by a women's organization and got a certificate. Izzat is going to buy 2 more cows. She is asking for a loan of 4000 Somoni to buy 2 cows for increasing the working capital of her new business. She awaits your generosity.

loans.use: To buy 2 cows for increasing working capital of her new business

loans.name: Rosa Leonor

texts.es: Rosa tiene 41 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hijo de 8 años de edad quien se encuentra estudiando. El esposo de Rosa se vio obligado a emigrar al extranjero en busca de mejores condiciones de vida dado que dentro del país no encontró forma de poder ganar lo suficiente para dar lo necesario a su querida familia. Rosa es muy comprometida, responsable y trabajadora quien desea construir una acera en la parte trasera de su vivienda ya que cuando es tiempo de lluvias el terreno se lava por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento,arena y piedra para la construcción de la acera lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 41, lives in her own house with her eight year old son.  He goes to school.  Rosa’s husband felt obligated to emigrate abroad to look for better living conditions.  This is because he did not find the way to be able to earn enough in the country in order to give his beloved family the necessities.

Rosa is very committed, responsible, and hard-working.  She wishes to put down pavement in the back part of her house.  During the rainy season the ground gets washed out.  That is why she is requesting this loan from FUSAI.  She will use the loan to buy cement, sand, and rocks to put down the pavement as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and rocks to put down pavement at her house.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 20 years old and single. Due to financial hardship, he didn't pursue his studies in college. Despite this, he has the determination to achieve his goal someday. To generate income, he helps his parents cultivate their farm land by planting vegetables for sale. He planned to expand their plantation but they do not have enough capital. For this reason, he is asking for a loan of PHP10,000 to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizers and insecticides needed in planting vegetables. He is hoping that this loan will help them to improve their farming business.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizers and insecticides needed in vegetable production

location.town: Brgy. Bitnong, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en:
Fotima is 51 years old. She is married and has adult children. She is also a careful grandmother. 

Fotima has her own business. She grows vegetables, such as onions and potatoes on four hectares of land. She has great experience since she has been busy with this business more than 20 years. Fotima’s husband and sons help her with managing the business. She is a very hard-working woman. Fotima is the main breadwinner of her family. She works hard, but she has a small income and poor living conditions. 

Fotima is asking for a loan of TJS 10,000 (somoni) to buy seeds, mineral fertilizer, and fuel. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy seeds, mineral fertilizer, and fuel.

loans.name: Eddie

texts.en:
Eddie is married with three children. He operates a service-based business providing tailoring in their community to make a living. His wife helps him, and they earn well for the family. Having three children is not easy, but with their determination in improving their lives, the couple never gets tired of working. 

Eddie borrowed a loan from GDMPC Microcredit to buy fabric to make curtains and pillowcases to sell. 

He plans to improve his business by having another sewing machine unit. In the future, Eddie wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make curtains and pillowcases to sell.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a 69-year-old widowed man. He has six children with ages ranging from 32 years old to 44 years old. 

He operates a farm where he keeps dairy cows which produce milk for sale. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. His business is located in a suitable environment for dairy farming, and his primary customers are local residents. Simon describes his biggest business challenge to be animal diseases and theft. 

Simon will use the 100,000 KES loan to buy animal feeds and materials to renovate the animal structures. His business goal is to have a sustainable and profitable agri-business within five years. This is his sixth loan with SMEP - Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited. The previous loans of 100,000 KES were successfully repaid.

He hopes that in the future, he will improve his life and that of his neighbors. He will use the anticipated profits to participate in community development activities.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds and materials to renovate the animal structures.

loans.name: Universal Group

texts.en:
The four women are part of Universal Group and sell secondhand clothing, fish, cutlery sets, jugs, camphor, and doughnuts. They live in extended family households. They average 30 years old with two children. They all live in Teshie in the greater-Accra region.

They came to know each other within the neighborhood and through their income generating activities in Teshie. Hoping to have the possibility of buying their stock with cash, the members of the group decided to join ID Ghana.

Henrieta has a good reputation in the world of selling secondhand clothing and has been in this business for five years. She plans to use her loan to purchase a bale of secondhand clothing. She will sell the merchandise for cash in Accra and as a traveling saleswoman to her mainly female clients. 

With this loan, Henrieta hopes to make a good monthly profit which she will use to reinvest in her business and to provide for her children's care.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of secondhand clothing.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en: Gilbert is a 36-year-old married man. He has two children ages 6 and 10 years. He describes himself as an achiever. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in urban area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy motorcycle spare parts to service his motorcycle and also pay school fees for his children. His business goal is to expand within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be prosperous. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts to service his motorcycle

loans.name: Godofredo

texts.en: Godofredo is a father of six who operates a motorcycle transportation business while at the same time working on his own farm for a living. He has worked for ten years in the transportation business, and earns well for the family. He also sells coconut in town and he earns more. He borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro finance to buy tires for his motorcycle. His plan in the future is to hopefully improve his farm as well as the general living of the family.

loans.use: to buy tires for his motorcycle

loans.name: Joaquina Odila

texts.es: Joaquina tiene 54 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y grupo familiar. Joaquina y su compañero de vida trabajan muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia y dar mejores condiciones de vida. Ella desea pavimentar el corredor de la vivienda dado que es de tierra. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena y piedra para mejorar el piso y así brindar mejores condiciones a su familia.
texts.en:
Joaquina, age 54, lives in her own house with her life partner and her family.  Joaquina and her life partner work very hard in order to get their family ahead and to give them better living conditions.

She wishes to pave the dirt hallway in her house.  In order to do so she is requesting this loan from FUSAI.  She will use the loan to buy cement, sand, and rocks in order to improve the floor and give her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and rocks in order to pave the floor of the hallway at her house.

loans.name: Jordan

texts.en: Jordan is 37 years of age and single. He lives in a rural community with his beloved parents. Since farming is the main sources of their living, he aimed to expand his vegetable plantation in order to increase his production. Due to financial hardship, he is requesting a loan amounting to PHP10,000 to buy insecticides, fertilizers and pay the expenses incurred in planting vegetables. Through patience and strong determination, he believes that he will be able to increase his production and income.

loans.use: to buy insecticides and fertilizers for his farm

location.town: Brgy. Bitnong, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is a married woman and a mother of three children ages 5, 3 and 1. They live in Jagna, Bohol. Ana Marie is engaged in a retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Her husband is engaged in motorcycle transport business.

Ana Marie is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap, and toiletries; and spare parts for the motorcycle like wheel tire, nuts, and bolts. With this, she will be able to improve her store as well as the working condition of the motorcycle.

Ana Marie dreams of improving her store so that it will generate more income. Furthermore, she wants to save money for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stocks for her general store and spare parts for her husband's motorcycle business

loans.name: Myla

texts.en:
Myla helps her husband operate their transportation service to earn a living. She has been in this business for eleven years, offering motorcycle rental and transportation. Aside from this, she has a farm of rice; their main source of income. With her generated revenue, she was able to repay a previous loan successfully. She used that loan to buy new tires. 

She has to improve their farm to gain abundant harvest. Without hesitation, she took a new loan to buy fertilizer and organic pesticides.

Myla wants to have better living conditions for her family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and organic pesticides for her farm

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 71-year-old, married woman. She has five children. She describes herself as being determined and efficient. 

She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows, which produce milk for sale. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in a marketable environment and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough resources to expand her business. 

Mary will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more dairy cows. Her business goal is to have a big dairy farm within five years. 

She hopes that, in the future, she will expand her business and improve her living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM). Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy more dairy cows.

loans.name: Jasmine

texts.en:
Jasmine previously obtained a 55,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education and for their personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for a 51,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. 

Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her child’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jasmine dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes to give her child a good future and education.  She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en: Kennedy is a 39-year-old married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself as optimistic. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a vibrant place and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy motorcycle spare parts for resale. This will enable him increase his income. His business goal is to own a tuk tuk for transport business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will open a big garage shop. This is his fourth loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy motorcycle spare parts for resale

loans.name: Keth's Angkor Community Group

texts.en: Keth (center) is a forty-five year old widow with seven children. Her youngest is just three. Keth supports her family by growing cabbage and other leafy vegetables that she sells at the local market. The children help take care of the family's vegetable plot when not at school. Keth wants them to be educated and to complete high school. The loan will help her purchase seeds and fertilizer, as well as vegetables from other villagers that she can resell. With the profits she will be able to support her family and send her children to school. Like Keth, Sun, Sin, Neb and Samith are working mothers who will use the loan for vegetable gardening. It is hard and tiring work, but the tightly knit group know they can rely on each other in times of hardship.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer for vegetable gardening

loans.name: Arniel

texts.en: Arniel is married with one child; he provides transportation services in his village while his wife works at home. The couple plans to improve their house now since in the coming years they will spend on his child's education. He borrowed a loan from GDMPC to buy new tires. Arniel wants to improve the general living situation of his family.

loans.use: to buy new tires for his motorcycle transportation service

loans.name: Oumaima

texts.en:
Oumaima is a 27-year-old married mother of one child who started her own perfume production and sales business nine years ago. In addition, she sells accessories and prepaid mobile phone cards.
Oumaima is well-known in her region for her special business talents in the perfume sector and is working hard to keep on developing it and expanding her working sector.
Today she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her accessories and prepaid mobile phone cards capital.
She hopes that, in the future, she can expand her working sector through expanding her business and diversifying her products to cover her family's increasing needs.

loans.use: To increase her accessories and prepaid mobile phone cards capital

loans.name: Amancia

texts.en:
Amancia is from Jagna, Bohol. She is a married woman and the mother of two children. She earns a living through her sari-sari or retail store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place.

Amancia is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods. With this, she will be able to improve the variety of her stock, thus allowing her to attract and cater to more buyers in her store. 

In the future, Amancia hopes to expand her store and make it a stable source of income. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods.

loans.name: Fredy Alonso

texts.es:
Fredy es un padre y esposo dedicado, que siempre va buscando alternativas para ganarse la vida de una manera digna y honrada. A sus 33 años de edad, es un desempleado más de la sociedad, pues anteriormente trabajaba como independiente prestando el servicio de transporte de materiales de construcción, escombros y todo tipo de productos que sus clientes requerían, su medio de transporte con el que trabajaba era una carreta de tracción animal, pero lastimosamente su caballo murió de vejez y por falta de recursos para adquirir otro animal, no pudo continuar con su labor; hoy en día trabaja por días en diversas actividades como ayudante de construcción, oficios varios, haciendo domicilios o cualquier actividad que le genere un ingreso para darle sustento a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 5 y 9 años de edad.
Con el crédito que solicita actualmente, desea comprar un caballo y una carreta para reiniciar su actividad y cancelar el saldo de un crédito que tiene vigente, esto le permitirá comenzar nuevamente con su actividad generadora de ingresos, con la que podrá solventar los gastos básicos del hogar y brindar una educación digna a sus hijos.
Fredy manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es tener la estabilidad económica y la capacidad para velar por el bienestar de su familia, por ello quiere seguir trabajando arduamente y prestar un buen servicio que le genere mayor nivel de ingresos, así podrá disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida con sus seres amados.
texts.en:
Fredy is a dedicated father and husband, who is always looking for dignified and honourable ways to make a living. At the age of 33, he is just another unemployed person in society. Formerly, he used to work for himself, offering a transport service for construction material, rubble and other items that his clients needed. He used an animal-powered wagon, but unfortunately his horse died of old age. He did not have enough money to buy another animal, so was not able to carry on that work. Now he works by day on different jobs such as a construction labourer doing various tasks, building houses or whatever activity will afford an income to maintain his wife and their two children, aged 5 and 9.

He is now asking for a loan to buy a horse and cart to re-start his old job and pay off the balance of an outstanding loan. This will allow him to re-start his income-generating job, which he will be able to use to cover basic household costs and provide his children with a proper education.

Fredy says that his greatest wish is to have economic stability and the ability to look after his family's wellbeing. This is why he wants to carry on working really hard and provide a good service that will assure a better income. This way, he will be able to enjoy a better quality of life with his loved ones.

loans.use: to buy a horse and cart to re-start his job and pay off an outstanding loan.

loans.name: Aleksan

texts.en:
Aleksan lives in Dilijan City. He is married and he lives with his wife, daughter, and sister. 

Aleksan works for a private company as a sales manager. He also drives a taxi with his own car after his main work is done. His wife works as a secretary and his sister is a musical teacher at the college. 

Lately, Aleksan’s sister discovered that she has some problems connected with her health and she needs to be immediately operated on. The operation is very urgent, but very expensive and, despite the fact that all the family members are employed, they have a lack of money.

Aleksan asks for a loan which will greatly help him to pay for his sister's operation and post-surgery course of treatment.

loans.use: to pay for his sister's operation and post-surgery course of treatment.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a single woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 14 years to 25 years. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are both wholesale and retail. She says her biggest business challenge is price changes. She will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. She hopes that in the future, she will live a wonderful life. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Beatrice's previous loan of KES 30,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, fish and other spices for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal by the bag

loans.name: Anonymous
