This is why she is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in building walls for her home with more durable materials such as: cement, bricks, sand, and steel.  The walls she has now are made with corrugated metal, and they are in bad condition.

loans.use: to buy building materials to build new walls for her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system

loans.name: Tojiniso

texts.ru:
Тожинисо трудящаяся сельская женщина из района Яван. Ей 49 лет. Она выросла в семье дехканина и уже с детства была знакома земледельческой деятельностью. Окончив школу Тожинисо вышла замуж, родила шестерых детей. У нее с мужем четверо сыновей и двое дочерей в возрасте от 15 до 28 лет. 
Последние 12 лет Тожинисо и ее семья активно занимаются растениеводством. Они в основном выращивают огородные культуры. Так как сейчас начался сезон посева, Тожинисо подготовила землю для нового посева. Она берет кредит, чтобы купить семена овощей и топливо для трактора. Благодаря кредиту она сможет вовремя провести посевные работы и получить хороший урожай. За счет прибыли Тожинисо планирует женить сына. Этот кредит ей очень важен.
texts.en:
Tojiniso is a hardworking country woman from the Yavan District. She is 49 years old. She grew up in the family of a communal farmer and has been familiar with agricultural farming since childhood. After graduating from school, Tojiniso got married and gave birth to six children. She and her husband have four sons and two daughters who range from 15 to 28 years old.

For the past 12 years, Tojiniso and her family have actively taken up crop farming. They mainly grow garden crops. As the sowing season has begun now, Tojiniso has prepared the land for the new round of sowing. She is taking out a loan to buy vegetable seeds and tractor fuel. Thanks to the loan, she will be able to carry out sowing on time and receive a good harvest. With the profits, she plans to marry off her son. This loan is very important to her.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds and tractor fuel to carry out the Spring sowing.

loans.name: Oscar Misael

texts.es:
Oscar de 21 años de edad,  ha estudiado bachillerato  contador,es casado; su esposa trabaja en una pastelería y son padres de una hija de dos años, viven en casa de la suegra.

Él trabaja en una gasolinera desde hace unos tres  años aproximadamente,  desde que salio de estudiar esta trabajando y ahora tiene mas responsabilidad, ya que tiene su hija. El trabajo no le queda muy lejos y su horario es de 7:00 AM a 7:00 PM


 El préstamo lo utilizara para instalar una cometida de agua que le urge, debido a que actualmente están acarreando el agua desde la casa de un vecino, ya teniendo agua potable propia les beneficiara en gran manera y la necesidad quedara satisfecha.

El sueño del cliente  es seguir arreglando poco a poco su casa,ya que tiene mucho que hacer y seguir trabajando con nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Oscar is 21 years old and studied accounting in secondary school.  He is married and his wife works in a bakery.  They are the parents of a two-year-old girl and they live with his mother-in-law. For about the past three years he has been working at a gas station.  He has been working since he left school, and now he has more responsibility since he has a daughter.  His work is not very far and he works from 7 in the morning until 7 at night.

He is asking for a loan so that he can install a connection to the water supply which he needs urgently because they are currently carrying water from a neighbor's house. Having their own potable water will benefit them greatly.

Oscar's dream is to continue working with the lenders to fix up his house little by little as there is a lot to do.

loans.use: to install a connection to the water supply which is urgently needed.

loans.name: Shamsa

texts.en: Shamsa is a businesswoman who is very hardworking. She is married and the mother of three school-aged children. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped-in water. For the last seven years, she has earned a living by selling charcoal. Her customers are neighbors and passersby, and she sites seasonality as her major challenge. Shamsa is requesting a loan for Kshs 35,000, which she will use to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell. She joined Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to resell

loans.name: Khatai

texts.en:
Khatai is a 58-year- old single woman. She is a refugee and lives in an IDP settlement with her brother, who helps her to cover life's demands. She earns money raising crops and selling them at the local bazaar. She has been working in this area for 30 years and gets for this 150 AZN monthly.

Azerbaijan people use grains to make different delicious dishes and cakes. For example, they prepare dushbere, qutab, arishda, khingal and etc. These dishes are very famous in Azerbaijan and their recipes have come from ancient times. People prepare these dishes not only for holidays, but for every day dinner or supper too.

Khatai’s monthly income isn't enough to cover her daily and monthly demands. She lives in hard conditions and wants to increase her monthly income. She applied for 1500 AZN loan in order to buy new crops and expand her business. She wants to open her own bakery and cook different delicious cookies, rolls and cakes.

loans.use: to buy new crops and expand business

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: This is Asha. She thanks Kiva lenders for their financial support. She is requesting for a loan of ksh.35,000 to purchase cashew nuts for resale .Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase cashew nuts for resale

loans.name: Mwalima

texts.en:
Mwalima is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to buy more sacks of cashew nuts for her business. She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of cashew nuts for her business

loans.name: Ndricim

texts.en:
Ndricim is a cameraman and DJ by profession, and with this loan, he wants to buy some equipment for his little activity. He’s been photographed inside the studio of his practice. 

Ndricim is 33 and married with two children, 4 years old and 16 months old. He and his wife did seasonal work in Greece for many years. Now they are settled, and he wants to invest more time and money in his own activity. They also have some land that they have never used before; hence, they will start planting crops on the land, or even orchards. 

Their village is known for the quantity production of persimmons, figs and grapevines. Some homemade jams from figs, apples and plums are prepared by villagers, and that makes them proud. Housewives also prepare homemade spaghetti that looks so much like tagliatelle. To eat this spaghetti, they melt butter and sauté a bit of raw garlic and, “voila”.

loans.use: to buy some equipment for his camera and DJ activity.

loans.name: Hafeez

texts.en: Hafeez, age 51, is a married woman.  She deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 35,000 to purchase two more calves. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Nasira

texts.en: Nasira, age 45, is a married woman and the mother of four children. She had a difficult time due to her husband’s business failure. She decided to work with her husband and to support her family for a better future. Five years ago she began stitching work in her house. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers.  She is currently in her 3rd loan cycle and has borrowed Rs 40,000 from Kashf. She intends to use this loan to buy spools of thread in different colors along with the packs of needles, zippers and buttons. It will help her to stitch up more dresses on time to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread in different colors along with the packs of needles, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Asima

texts.en: Asima is 27 years old and a dedicated mother of three children. The man shown in the photo is Asima 's husband. Her husband runs a donkey cart as a transportation service.  He started this business with a single donkey cart. The donkeys help customers carry material from one place to another. He makes enough to meet the family's needs. In order to purchase a larger wooden cart for the donkey, Asima contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. In this way her husband will be able to transport more items on his cart at one time, e.g., fruits and vegetables. This ultimately saves his time and hopefully will increase his net income. Asima plans to spend the additional revenue on improving their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a larger wooden cart for the donkey.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 28-year-old married woman who we see here with her husband. They have been farming together for many years and grow many different types of vegetables and fruits which they sell in a local market. They work hard to ensure a high-quality crop, and have gradually improved their business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. In order to buy different types of seeds with insecticides and pesticides, Razia has applied for a loan of PKR 50,000. This will help her and her husband grow more crops and earn more cash.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy screws, sheets of corrugated metal, cement, sand, quarry stones, and cement blocks

loans.name: Saima

texts.en: Saima is 29 years old, married and has for the last four years contributed to the family's income by working at home as a seamstress. Her husband is a rickshaw driver and earns insufficient income to pay all household expenditures alone. Salma's clients are people who live nearby, and she uses her income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet current customer demand. She has applied for a loan for PKR 40,000 from Kashf to buy raw materials, including cloth, threads of different colors, laces and zippers. Her goal is to increase her income so that her family can enjoy a better life.  She is currently in her third loan cycle and has a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy raw materials including cloth, threads, laces and zippers.

loans.name: Laal  Khatoon

texts.en:
Laal Khatoon is a 41-year-old married lady. She is running a small general store with her husband (also shown in the photo). Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over time, they have become popular in their community for providing good-quality products, and they make enough to meet their household expenses. 

Currently, she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. She is expecting a boost in their earnings and dreams of expanding their business in the future.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Mehvish

texts.en: Mehvish, age 26, is a married woman.  She deals in the business of selling animals with the support of her husband (also shown in the photo). She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then her husband sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase more cattle. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her 4th loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: Rukhsana is a 27-year-old married woman and is the mother of 2 children. She has had a business of tailoring for the past 3 years. She is zealous about her work and client demand is strong.  But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is employed in a garment shop, but he does not earn enough to support his family well alone. Rukhsana’s stitching is very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 40000 to buy spools of thread, cloth and packs of needles. It will allow her to meet the demands of her customers on time. She is in her 5th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread, cloth and packs of needles.

loans.name: Arfa

texts.en: Arfa, age 24, is a married woman.  She deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. At present she has three goats and one cow.  She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more baby goats. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats.

loans.name: Ruqia

texts.en: Ruqia, age 36, is a married woman.  She is running a business selling milk with her husband for many years. She has two buffaloes in milk production, which she uses to provide milk for selling to the people of her locality. She also sells animals on a seasonal basis to generate an extra amount of profit.  Ruqia has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her seventh loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 60,000. This will allow her to purchase one more buffalo. Ruqia is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides, and other supplies

loans.name: Amanda De Jesús

texts.es:
Amanda de 54 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado de educación, está casada, su pareja de ella trabaja en la agricultura desde hace muchos años.

Ellos tienen en común 5 hijos los cuales trabajan independientes cada uno con su hogar a aparte, en casa de la cliente viven cuatro personas, el esposo de la cliente y dos nietos los cuales ellos cuidan, ya que los padres de ellos están lejos 


Amanda se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos desde hace 30 años, el trabajo se lo enseño su madre ya que desde muy joven la llevaba a  vender  junto a ella y ella ha continuado con el negocio desde entonces la cliente también se dedica a ayudarle a su esposo a cultivar la agricultura. Decide dedicarse a esta labor la cliente, ya que le gusta  hacerlo y es una forma de ayudar a su familia y a su esposo con los gastos de la casa;  la cliente se desplaza a vender la mercadería hasta el municipio más cercano de su comunidad este queda a 10 kilómetros los cuales recorre en bus hasta llegar y luego lo vende casa por casa hasta terminar  el horario aproximado de la cliente es de 6 horas al día.

Con el préstamo comprara una vaquilla lechera, la cual vendrá a mejorar el negocio porque tendrá la oportunidad de vender más cuando la vaquilla le produzca leche y pueda sacar  queso esto mejorara los ingresos y cubrirá de mejor manera las necesidades puntuales de su familia.

Los sueños del cliente dice ser los mismos que tenía hace 30 años,  la de seguir trabajando para su familia y que ellos logren sus objetivos y ella ayudarlos en lo más que pueda para su negocio sueña con poner su propio puesto de venta, donde no tenga que desplazarse para vender sus productos ya que debido a la edad le cuesta mucho trabajo.
El préstamo le ayudara a mejorar su negocio a través de la venta y dice que ampliara su negocio en el futuro comprando más vaquillas para le produzcan más.
texts.en:
Amanda, age 54, studied through the second grade.  She is married; her husband has worked in agriculture for many years.

They have five children together, all of whom work independently.  The children live in their own homes.  Four people live in Amanda’s house: her husband and the two grandchildren they care for because the grandchildren’s parents live far away.

For thirty years, Amanda has worked selling dairy products.  Her mother taught her this work, because when Amanda was young her mother took her to make sales with her, and she has continued this business since then.  The client also works helping her husband in agriculture.  She decided to work in this area because she likes to do it and it is a way to help her family and her husband with the household expenses.  To sell her products, she travels to the closest town, which is ten kilometers from her community.  She travels by bus to get there and then makes sales door-to-door until she is finished.  Her schedule consists of about six hours per day. 

With this loan, she will buy a dairy heifer, which will come to improve her business, because she will have the chance to sell more and make cheese once the heifer produces milk.  This will improve her income and will better cover any one-time expenses of her family.

The client’s dreams are the same ones she has had for thirty years: to keep working for her family, that her family would achieve their goals, and that she can help them as much as she can.  As for her business, she dreams of having her own sales stand where she would no longer have to travel to sell her products, because due to her age, traveling is difficult.

This loan will help her to improve her business through sales.  She says that she will expand her business, buying more heifers in the future so that they produce even more.

loans.use: to buy a dairy heifer

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She is a married mother of four children who are adults. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Sauda prepares half-cakes using sugar, cooking oil, and wheat flour and sells to neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil for her business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her bakery business

loans.name: Reina

texts.en: Reina earns a living through her food vending business which she operates in her place in Bohol, Philippines. She is a married woman and a mother of three grown up children. Aside from selling home cooked foods, Reina is also engaged in a hog raising business. Reina is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients for her food vending business like meat and seasonings, and animal feed for her hog raising business. With this, she will be able to cook more foods to sell to her customers. In addition, Reina will be able to improve her hog raising business. Reina hopes the loan will help make her successful.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Nurana

texts.en:
Nurana is 35 years old, married, with a daughter and a son. Her husband earns money for family working as a laborer. The members of family are refugees and have lived in an IDP settlement for a long time. Nurana has been working as a farmer for 15 years and has good skills in this area. She grows figs trees then sells them at local bazaar, and earns 150AZN monthly.

Fig is a very useful and tasty fruit. Azerbaijan people prepare jams for dessert with tea. They use it as liquor to alleviate colds. Dried figs are also very useful for health. 

Nurana needs money to make her garden better. She wants to build a green house for the fig trees and protect them from severe weather. Besides that, she wants to expand her business and increase income. She needs to cover her family’s living costs and children’s education. She applied for 1500AZN in order to buy more fruit trees and raise them.

loans.use: to buy fruit trees and fertilizers

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is a farmer from Jagna, Bohol. She is a 53-year-old married woman and a mother of three grown up children. Justina grows vegetables in her field; this is the source of her income. 

Justina is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and sprayer. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm thus augmenting her harvest and yield. Justina dreams of expanding her vegetable farm in the future.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and sprayer

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
This is Mariam. She appreciates Kiva lenders for their financial support that has enabled her to improve her living standards.

Besides the food vending business, Mariam operates a lessos (women wrap) clothes business.
She is requesting a loan of ksh.20,000 to purchase more lessos (women wrap) clothes. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more lessos (women wrap) clothes

loans.name: Bisha

texts.en:
Bisha is married and has four school going children. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a fish selling business for the last four years, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase fish, cooking oil, and firewood for her business. She decided to join to acquire financial services for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish, cooking oil, and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Doña Blanca es casada,  madre de 3 hijos, todos menores de edad y estudiantes. Tiene su propia microempresa de alquiler de sillas, mesas, bancos y manteles,  también trabaja por las noches en el cuido de adultos mayores, área en la que se especializó hace varios años. En está ocasión nos solicita su tercer crédito, la conducta de pago en los financiamientos anteriores ha sido "Muy Buena". Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, que busca contribuir con los gastos del núcleo familiar, además de lograr independencia económica, esto es lo que la motiva a seguir adelante y con más fuerza en su microempresa. Además de alcanzar lo que se propone para mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y su familia. 
Inicio su negocio hace 4 años con un aporte que le brindó su esposo de 500,000 colones, y el crédito anterior le permitió fortalecer y consolidar su negocio. Actualmente la demanda ha crecido y necesita más sillas para poder cumplir con la compromisos, es en esto que va a invertir el préstamo,  ya que sus clientes han aumentado. Además entre sus metas a corto plazo tiene formar un fondo de ahorro mensual,  que ya inició para obtener más mesas. 
Realiza la actividad con el apoyo de su esposo, quién le hace el traslado de las sillas, mesas, bancos, manteles y otros, también le fabrica las mesas en madera ya que es constructor.  Su mercado es donde ella vive y lugares aledaños.
texts.en:
Doña Blanca is married.  She is the mother of three children, all minors and students.  She has her own small business renting chairs, tables, benches, and tablecloths.  She also works nights caring for the elderly, something she has been doing for a number of years.  At this point in time, she is asking us for her third loan.  Her conduct in repaying her previous loans has been “Very Good.”  She is a very hardworking woman who is seeking to do her part with the family expenses.  Besides achieving financial independence, this is what motivates her to get ahead and strengthen her small business.  She also wants to manage to improve the living conditions for her and her family.

She began her business four years ago with the help of her husband, who gave her 500,000 Colons.  Her previous loan allowed her to firmly establish and strengthen her business.  Currently, demand has grown and she needs more chairs to be able to meet her commitments.  This is what she will invest the loan in, because her customer base has grown.  Additionally, creating a monthly savings account is among her short-term goals.  She already began this, to get more tables.

She does this work with the help of her husband, who transports the chairs, tables, benches, tablecloths, and other items.  He also makes the wooden tables, because he is a carpenter.  Her sales market is where she lives, as well as neighboring areas.

loans.use: to buy chairs to rent out.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta octavo grado de educación, está acompañado su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos del hogar, también realiza el trabajo de comerciante por temporadas o eventuales,   tienen  en común dos hijos los cuales aún viven con ellos,  una estudia parvularia y la otra niña no. En casa del cliente viven solamente su señora de él y sus dos hijas. 


Wilfredo se dedica a la agricultura y la pesca, aunque su fuente de ingreso más fuerte o a lo que más se dedica es a la agricultura. Se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde que era muy pequeño,  su padre de él le enseño a trabajar en el campo. Desde que este era muy joven, Wilfredo decide dedicarse a esta actividad porque no encontró otra forma de ayudar a su familia y sacarlos adelante, el trabajo del cliente está a dos cuadras de su casa, las cuales tiene que recorrer para llegar a ella.  La dificultad más grande que tiene es llevar los insumos que necesita para trabajar la agricultura, ya que recorre 23 kilómetros en carro que paga,  para que le lleven los insumos hasta su casa. Su compañera de vida también le colabora en el trabajo cuando él lo requiere; el horario de trabajo es de 7 horas al día aproximadamente.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para alquilar el terreno donde trabajara esta temporada  y para comprar  dos redes para pescar,  ya que esta actividad le permite tener un ingreso adicional y ayuda a mejorar  las condiciones de su familia  a través de la comercialización de este producto. La necesidad a satisfacer será la de asegurar el lugar de trabajo y la alimentación de su familia para esta temporada.

El cliente sueña con ver a sus hijos estudiar y sacar una carrera universitaria y que  tengan un trabajo estable que les permita tener una vida digna, Wilfredo desea  seguir cosechando  para un día poner su propio negocio de venta de granos básicos. Con la ganancia y un poco de ahorro ampliara su negocio comprando su propio terreno para cultivar.
texts.en:
Wilfredo, age 26, studied through the eighth grade. He has a partner, who works doing the household chores.  From time to time, she also works in retail seasonally.  They have two children together, who live with them.  One studies in preschool and the other does not.  Only his partner and their two children live in his house.

Wilfredo works in agriculture and fishing, although his stronger source of income (or that which he works in more) is agriculture.  He has done this type of work since he was very little; his father taught him to work in the fields.  From the time he was very young, Wilfredo decided to do this work because he couldn’t find another way to help his family and get them ahead.  He works two blocks from his home, which he has to travel to get to work.  The biggest difficulty he faces is carrying the supplies that he needs to do his work, because he travels 23 kilometers in a car that he pays for so that he can get the supplies to his home.  His partner also helps him in his work when he needs.  He works about seven hours daily.

The loan that he is requesting from Credicampo is to rent the land where he will work this season, and to buy two fishing nets, because fishing allows him to have extra income and helps to improve the living conditions of his family by selling the fish.  The need that he has to take care of is securing a place to work and feeding his family this season.

The client dreams of seeing his children study and complete a university degree.  He dreams of them having a stable job that allows them to have a decent life.  Wilfredo wants to keep harvesting so that some day he can set up his own business selling pantry staples.  With the earnings and a little bit of savings he will expand his business by buying his own piece of land to cultivate.

loans.use: to rent the land where he will work this season, and to buy two fishing nets.

loans.name: Mutabarbonu

texts.ru:
Мутабарбону  замужем имеет троих детей. Она активная трудолюбивая женщина. Ей  40 лет.    У нее среднее образование.  Как и у многих жителей села  её жизнь сложилась так, что получить образование не получилось, но она всю жизнь мечтала чтобы её дети получили достойное образование и в будущем стали хорошими  специалистами способными сделать свою жизнь более самодостаточной и счастливой.   Вместе с мужем они стараются делать все для  достижения своей  цели. 
     У Мутабарбону с мужем  свое семейное дело. Они занимаются разведением крупного рогатого скота и переработкой  молока.  Доход от дела конечно обеспечивает жизнь семьи, но для того чтобы откладывать на обучение детей этот доход недостаточен.   Мутабарбону решила взять кредит для приобретения качественных кормов для того чтобы повысить доходность от бизнеса и накопить на свою цель –образование детей. Мутабарбону рада,что может взять кредит в  « Арванд»  и сделает ещё один шаг на встречу к своей мечте.
texts.en:
Mutabarbonu is married and has three children. She is an active and hardworking woman. She is 40 years old. She has a secondary education. Like many of her fellow villagers, her life worked out such that she was unable to get a higher education. However, she has dreamed her whole life that her children would get a good education and, in the future, become great specialists who are capable of making their lives happier and more self-sufficient. She and her husband do all that they can to achieve this goal.

Mutabarbonu and her husband have a family business. They raise cattle and process their milk. The income from this business provides for the lives of their family, of course, but it is not enough to put aside for their children's education. Mutabarbonu decided to take out a loan to buy quality feed to increase the profitability of their business and save money for their goal - their children's education. Mutabarbonu is happy that she is able to take out a loan from Arvand and become one step closer to realizing her dream.

loans.use: to buy quality livestock feed.

loans.name: Pathano

texts.en:
Pathano is a 51-year-old married woman.

She works in the animal sales' business. Specifically, she buys animals (e.g., baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them, and then sells them at the market for higher prices. At present she has four cows and three calves. She makes enough money through her business to contribute to her family's income.

She needs to improve her business to cover her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan in the amount of 30,000 PKR to purchase two more calves. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With the loan proceeds, she is very confident that she will be able to expand her business and to increase her income.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing two additional calves.

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en:
Khursheed is a 43 year old married woman. She has been in the business of selling milk for many years. She has one buffalo for milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. She also sells animals on a seasonal basis to generate an extra amount of income. Khursheed's business is good enough to let her lead a decent life. 
She is the mother of four children and is very motivated to provide them with good education, food and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet day to day expenses.  It’s her 5th year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through the support of it. Now she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo. She is positive about her investment and wishes to improve her standard of living through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is married with children, and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (old parents). She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for utility bills.

Grace has a business of a beauty salon, and has been in this business for six years.  She works in a shop seven days out of every week, and sells on retail basis only. Her major business challenges includes transportation and on and off electricity.

She generates additional income from rental rooms.  

She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, a stand-alone dryer, and braids. 

Grace aspires to own a bridal salon, and also to have a fully stocked beauty salon.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers, a stand-alone dryer, and braids.

loans.name: Katherine Lisbeth

texts.es:
Katherine tiene 22 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, vive con su familia y su hijo de un año, en el barrio 13 de agosto perteneciente del Cantón Echeandía, Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Virgen de Guadalupe, la cual se encuentra ubicada a 60 minutos de la oficina operativa Guaranda, está conformada por 10 socios. 
Katherine es empleada privada, se dedica al cultivo de cacao. Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos necesarios para utilizar en la siembra de cacao, aumentando así su producción. La compra la realiza en Ventanas. Su meta es tener su propio negocio. Su desafío es la competencia. En su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte, la costumbre que más le gusta es el desfile del 5 de enero.
texts.en:
Katherine is 22 years old, single, and lives with her family and one year old son in the “13 de Agosto” neighborhood of the Echeandia settlement within the Bolivar province.

She is a member of the “Virgen de Guadalupe” group, located one hour from the Guaranda office, and made up of 10 members.

Katherine works as an employee raising cacao.  She is asking for this loan to buy fertilizer for the cacao to increase its production.  She makes her purchases in Ventanas.  Her goal is to have her own business.  Her challenges are the competition.  She likes to play sports in her spare time and her favorite tradition is the January 5th parade.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Kelvin Joaquin

texts.es:
Kelvin tiene 25 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, tiene un hijo de 1 año, vive solo en el barrio 5 de Octubre perteneciente al Cantón Echeandía, Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Virgen de Guadalupe, la cual se encuentra ubicada a 60 minutos de la oficina operativa Guaranda, está conformada por 10 socios. 
Kelvin se dedica al comercio de madera. Solicita el crédito para la compra de madera y así aumentar la producción. La compra la realiza en Echeandia. Su meta es mejorar su negocio. Su desafío es la competencia. En su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte, la costumbre que más le gusta es el carnaval.
texts.en:
Kelvin is 25 years old, single, and has a one year old son.  He lives alone in the “5 de Octubre” neighborhood, part of the Echeandia settlement, within the Bolivar province.

He is a member of the “Virgen de Guadalupe” group, located one hour from the Guaranda office, and made up of 10 members.

Kevin sells lumber and is asking for this loan to buy lumber and increase production.  He makes his purchases in Echeandia.  His goal is to improve his business and his challenge is the competition.  He likes to play sports in his spare time and his favorite tradition is carnival.

loans.use: to buy lumber.

loans.name: Farhat

texts.en:
Farhat is a 33-year-old married woman. She and her husband have four children.

For about nine years, she has been working in the machine embroidery business. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are in high demand and she has managed to cultivate a client base that allows her to contribute to her family's income.

To help her continue her business operations, she has requested a loan in the amount of 45,000 PKR. With the loan proceeds, she would like to buy spools of threads in different colors, along with packs of beads, sequins, and stones for her designs. By doing so, she would be able to more consistently satisfy her customers' demands. Importantly, this would be her fourth loan cycle, and she explains that she has good credit history. She is confident that she can increase her income by targeting more customers.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing additional colored spools of threads, packs of beads, sequins, and stones.

loans.name: Kotognontala Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KOTOGNONTALA est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 34 ans, et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Dioïla, commune de Kaladougou préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de savon, et de fruits et légume. Les femmes du groupe KOTOGNONTALA sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO. 
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente FATOUMATA  debout au milieu est actuellement vendeuse de fruits et légume. Elle compte acheter 1 gros panier de banane, et 1 panier de papaye chez les jardiniers à Oula. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce, à Dioïla à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20 000 Fcfa qui sera utilisé pour assurer les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Kotognontala group is composed of married women averaging 34 years of age, with four children. They all live in traditional families in the town of Diola, Kaladougou municipality, Diola prefecture, Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of Mali). They know each other as relatives, neighbors, and friends. They cook food for sale and also sell soap, fruits, and vegetables. The members of the Kotognontala group are on their first solidarity loan. In order to satisfy the huge customer demand, they have turned to Soro Yiriwaso.

The loan will be used to buy merchandise as mentioned above. Our client Fatoumata, the one standing in the center of the photo, currently works as a vendor of fruits and vegetables. She plans to buy one big basket of bananas and one basket of papayas from farmers in Oula. She  retails in Diola, for cash, to a mixed clientele. She plans to achieve a monthly revenue of 20,000 West African francs, which will be used to provide for everyday household expenses.

loans.use: to buy fruits.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is 47 years old and he lives in Vanadzor city in the Lori region. He received a higher education and has a specialty in engineering as a mechanic. Artur is married and he has three children. His son is a student and in the near future he will become a pilot; his daughter is also a student at the paid division of the State Pedagogical Institute; and his smallest daughter is still school-aged. So the care of this not-small family is Artur and his wife’s duty. 

Artur was a senior lieutenant and he served in the army for many years and with great patriotic spirit he even took part in several huge defensive battles of our republic. Now he works at the school and he gives military knowledge to his pupils. His wife also works and she is a baker. Although both of them work, all their family's many needs prevent them from paying for their daughter’s education also. 

Artur seeks a loan which he greatly needs in order to pay for his daughter’s tuition fee for the second semester and he also wants surprise his children and buy a computer for them.

loans.use: to pay his daughter’s tuition fee for the second semester and he also wants to surprise his children and buy a computer for them

loans.name: Arcadia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Arcadia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  

Arcadia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell for her buy and sell charcoal business.

Arcadia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her obtain her dream to save money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Darwinda

texts.en:
Darwinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell to her customers for her business.

Darwinda has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from raising pigs.

Darwinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell to her customers

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 33-year-old married woman. She and her husband have children.

She has been successfully operating a small general store with her husband (also shown in the photo). Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over time they have become popular in their community because they provide high-quality products. She explains that they earn enough money to pay for their family's living expenses.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 PKR to buy packs of grains, biscuits, and beverages to satisfy her customers' increasing demands. She expects a boost in their earnings as a result of this loan and dreams of expanding their business in the future.

loans.use: to satisfy customer demand by purchasing additional grains, biscuits, and beverages.

loans.name: Mehmooda

texts.en:
Mehmooda, age 48, is a married woman and the mother of two children. She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals, such as baby goats and calves, at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them at the market at higher prices. Mehmooda makes enough through her business to contribute to her family's income, but she needs to improve her business to meet her household expenses. 

For this reason, Mehmooda contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase two more calves. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and raise her income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Manzooran

texts.en:
Manzooran is a 39-year-old vigorous, married woman and the mother of six children. She has had a business doing hand embroidery for the past ten years. One of her daughters also assists her in making beautiful patterns. Manzooran is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong.  But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Manzooran’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household.  

Manzooran wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins, and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. She shared her dream of running a training center for girls in her village and she is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins, and pearls in large quantities.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 46-year-old married woman; she has been running a business selling milk with her husband for many years. She has three buffaloes, which she uses for milk selling to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. 

Rehana has become famous for providing good quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. 

Currently she is in her eighth loan cycle, and has applied for a loan of PKR 50,000. This will allow her to purchase one more buffalo. 

She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 45-year-old married woman. She has been doing embroidery through a machine at home for the past five years to support her family. She helps her husband by doing embroidery; she sells embroidered dresses in her town. She has attained a regular list of customers, and makes enough to contribute to the family income. 

She has become an expert in embroidery through a machine, and wants more raw materials for embroidery so that she can easily cope with the increasing demand. 

She is a mother of two children; she hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her increased sales. She wishes to utilize a portion of the revenue to provide a quality education for her children.

Shamim thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy raw material for embroidery.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a 40-year-old married lady, and has been running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. 

To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR which she will use to buy a stock of rice, sugar and biscuits from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. 

She wishes to use part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice, sugar and biscuits.

loans.name: Nieta Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe NIETA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Fana, commune de GUEGNEKA préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de céréale, de savon, et de produit cosmétique. Les femmes du groupe NIETA sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente FANTA  la première personne à partir de la gauche est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de savon moderne. Elle compte acheter 2 gros cartons et 2 moyens de savon avec son argent chez les grossistes à Bamako .La vente se fait en détail et en espèce à une clientèle mixte chez elle, et parfois ambulante. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000 FCFA qui sera réinjecté dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The  Nieta group is composed of married women averaging 37 years of age, with five children. They all live in traditional families in the town of  Fana,  Guegneka municipality, Diola prefecture, Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of Mali). They know each other as relatives, neighbors, and friends. They cook food for sale and also  sell cereals, soap and cosmetic products. The members of the  Nieta group are on their fiftg solidarity loan. In order to satisfy the huge customer demand, they have turned to Soro Yiriwaso.

The loan will be used to buy merchandise as mentioned above. Our client Fanta, the first one standing  from the left in the photo is illiterate. She currently works as a vendor of commercially produced soap. She plans to buy  to buy two big boxes with two different varieties of soap from wholesalers in Bamako. She  retails  for cash, to a mixed clientele, out of her home and sometimes as a street vendor. She plans to achieve a monthly revenue of 75,000 West African francs, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy soap [for resale].

loans.name: Lucia Del Carmen

texts.es: Lucia tiene 39 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 13 y 12 años y su hija de 21 años de edad. Lucia se gana la vida por medio de la venta de ropa usada la cual comercializa en su hogar de habitación. Con el fin de brindar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la mejoras de las paredes y el piso de la vivienda. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena y grava para proceder lo antes posible a la mejora de la vivienda.
texts.en: Lucia is 39 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and her two sons aged 12 and 13 and her daughter who is 21. Lucia earns her living selling used clothes that she sells from her house. With the goal of providing better living conditions for her family she is requesting a loan from FUSAI  to invest in improving the walls and floors of her house. With the money from the loan she will buy cement, sand and gravel and do the work to the house as soon as she can.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and gravel to cement in the floors and plaster the walls of her house.

loans.name: Adeline

texts.en:
Adeline is a farmer from Bohol, Philippines. She is a married mother of two children. Adeline has been engaged in vegetable farming with her husband for more than seven years now. This is the source of her income.

Adeline is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve the growth and yield of her vegetable farm. In the future, she hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for the farm

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en:
Bernardo is a farmer from Bohol, Philippines. He has been farming vegetables for more than 15 years now. This is the source of his income.

Bernardo is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. With this, he will be able to grow more vegetables in his farm, thus, allowing him to increase his yield and profit. In the future, Bernardo hopes to make his farming business a success.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Delia works hard to support her family.

She has a banana vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. 

Delia is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell for her banana vending business.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her obtain her dream to save money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years, and she earns additional income from raising pigs.

Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, rice, etc. for her business. She has been sustaining her business through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. Jocelyn dreams of saving money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, rice, etc. for her business

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es: Nidia, está Viuda, tiene la edad de 49 años y vive con su hijo que es su mayor prioridad. Ella con el crédito va comprar terneros para crianza y poder sacarle el máximo de ganancias a su terreno apto para esta explotación de este proyecto. Ella tiene como plan sacar los terneros rápido para la venta y así poder generar ganancias rápido para ofrecerle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida en el  futuro y tener una estabilidad económica algo más estable. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Nidia is a 49 year old widow who lives with her son who is her first priority. With the loan she will buy young calves to raise and use her land to the maximum as it very suitable for this type of project. Her plan is to sell them quickly so as to make a rapid profit to provide her son with a higher quality of living and have a more stable financial situation. This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR. She has not had a loan with the State banks and  FUDECOSUR is providing the loan with better conditions and a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to buy young calves to raise.

loans.name: Attia

texts.en:
Attia is a 30-year-old married woman. She has been in the beauty parlor business for many years. She offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling, and facials. Through her best services, she has become very famous in her street. 

In order to meet the increasing demands of her customers, Attia is interested in buying more variety of cosmetic products for the parlor. But because she lacks cash on hand, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 45,000. This way, she will be able to buy hair care products, skin products, and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities. Attia hopes to cater to more customers time after time. She expects a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products, and  bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida, age 43, is a married woman. She has been running a business selling milk with her husband for the past five years. She has two buffaloes and two cows. She sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk.  She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them on a daily basis.  Zubaida has two children and she needs to earn much more to meet their everyday needs, including food, clothing, and healthcare.

Zubaida is in her third loan cycle and she has a good credit history. In order to make huge profits, she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers. She hopes to increase her income through more sales.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: Nigora

texts.ru:
Нигора общительная позитивная девушка. Проживает она в Спитаменском районе. Ей 24 года. Нигора молодая мама двоих детишек. Нигора заботливая мама, она очень любит своих детей. Нигора не смогла получить высшее образование, так как сразу же после окончания средней школы ее выдали замуж. Потихоньку Нигора начала привыкать к семейной жизни, но связи с обстоятельствами ее семейная жизнь не сложилась. Но Нигора не смотря на жизненные трудности позитивно смотрит на жизнь, ведь у нее есть двое сладеньких детишек ради кого она живет и стремится вперед. Нигора работает  в страховой компании. Дополнительно после работы она дома шьет шторы на заказ,в связи с чем Нигора уже имеет своих  клиентов.Особенно спрос на шторы начинается в летние периоды. К тому же у Нигоры очень сильный характер.

Из-за внезапной болезни  ребенка она не растерялась и всеми усилиями стала искать хорошие медицинские центры. Найдя клинику Нигора узнала о стоимости обследований и она поняла ,что рассчитанной суммы ей не хватит. Не теряя времени она обратилась в МДО "Арванд" за кредитом для обследование своего ребенка. Нигора очень надеется на  поддержку со стороны  организации и конечно же заранее выражает благодарность за оперативную работу сотрудников МДО.
texts.en:
Nigora is a gregarious, positive woman. She lives in the Spitamen District. She is 24 years old. Nigora is a young mother to two children. Nigora is an attentive mother who really loves her children. Nigora was unable to receive a higher education because she got married as soon as she graduated from secondary school. Little by little, Nigora got used to the domestic life, but in connection with certain developments, her family life did not work out. But despite difficulties in life, Nigora has a positive outlook. After all, she has two sweet little kids who she lives for and who push her forward. Nigora works at an insurance company. After work, she additionally sews drapes by order at home. She already has customers for this service. The demand for drapes begins especially in the summer. In addition to everything else, she also has a great character.

As a result of her child's sudden illness, she did not lose her had but began to search with all her power for good medical clinics. After finding a clinic, Nigora learned the cost of the medical testing and realized that she did not have the required amount of money for it. Not wasting any time, she requested a loan from MDO Arvand to pay for her child's medical testing. Nigora really relies on the organization's support and, of course, thanks the workers at Arvand in advance for their fieldwork.

loans.use: to pay for her child's medical testing.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a married woman and the mother of three children. The man shown in the photo is Parveen’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his van. He has been driving to transport goods for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Parveen has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires, along with some tools for his vehicle. 

This will help him drive more smoothly, and provide better transport service to his passengers. 

Parveen is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband, and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires along with some tools.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is married and has four children, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (old parents). Monica has a retail shop and has been in this business for nine years.

Monica has applied for a loan of 900,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and maize flour. She doesn’t have any other income generating activities. She works in the shop seven days out of every week and sells on retail basis. Her major business challenges include a lack of enough capital and defaulters. Monica aspires to own a wholesale shop. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding her family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and maize flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of bread, drinks and other items

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a 27-year-old single man. He describes himself as independent. Juma operates a M-pesa business where he offers mobile phone-based money transfer services. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are of all types. 

Juma will use the KES 50,000 loan to add M-pesa float (i.e money for customers to withdraw). He will use the anticipated profits to open another M-pesa business.

loans.use: to add M-pesa float (i.e money for customers to withdraw)

loans.name: Niza

texts.en:
Niza is 41 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like snack foods, beer, softdrinks, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Niza has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Niza aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like snack foods, beers, soft drinks, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Haide

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Haide works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. 

Haide is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Haide has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema appreciates Kiva lenders for their financial support that greatly improved her green grocery business. Beside the green grocery business, Rehema prepares juice using fruits. She is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase fruits and juice flavors for her business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and juice flavors for her business

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 65 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Lilia has been farming vegetables for 10 years and also earns additional income from selling bananas.

Lilia is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Mzevinari

texts.en: Mzevinari is a 46-year-old single woman from the city of Kutaisi. She has only a 3-year-old daughter and she makes a big effort to ensure a good living for her life. Mzevinari works at a furniture store as a sales lady and has a small income. The joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables people like Mzevinari to start or re-start their own businesses. She was approved for a loan of 3,000 USD to purchase shares of a furniture store.  After that, she can generate more income as Mzevinari will be one of the shareholders.  She will get a significant income and increase her productivity. She relies on the goodwill of lenders and will be grateful for the help maintaining her business to create better living conditions and to give a good education to her daughter.

loans.use: To purchase shares of a furniture store

loans.name: Doniyor

texts.ru: Дониер добрый, общительный молодой человек. Он живет в сельской местности, которая находиться не далеко от района. Дониер женат и имеет двоих прекрасных детей. Дониер очень любит свою семью. Жена Дониера Дилафруз во всем поддерживает мужа. Все семейные проблемы стараются решать вместе. Дилафруз портниха. Она шьет национальные платья для местности. Кроме шитья Дилафруз еще дома занимается переработкой молока. Готовые молочные продукты продает соседям. Как и все другие жители села сам Дониер и его семья разводят скот, они имеют несколько поголовье крупно рогатых скот и пару барашек. Скотоводство лишь дополнительный доход Дониера. В основном Дониер занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственной  культуры. Ему нравиться работать на поле,на фото  он находится  на месте деятельности,на поле где он собирается выращивать кукурузу. Он очень любит наблюдать как молодые ростки кукурузы и ячменя вырастают день за днем. Но Дониер не ради удовольствия работает, он старается чтоб его семья жили в достатке, чтобы его дети получали образование и росли здоровыми. С наступлением теплых времен Дониер начинает свою работу. Дониер с зимы копил деньги для подготовки земли к посадки, но кроме этого Дониеру еще нужны денежные средства для покупки семян и удобрении. С финансовыми проблемами  Дониер обратился в Арванд за кредитом. Дониер заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку, в следствии которой улучшится качество жизни его семьи.
texts.en:
Doniyor is a kind, sociable young man. He lives in the countryside located not far from town. Doniyor is married and has two wonderful children. Doniyor loves his family very much. 

Doniyor's wife, Dilafruz, supports her husband in every way. They always try to solve problems together as a family. Dilafruz is a dressmaker. She sews national dresses for the community. Besides the sewing, Dilafruz also works by processing milk at home. She sells dairy products to her neighbors. 

Like the other villagers, Doniyor and his family raise cattle. They have a several cattle and a couple of lambs. For Doniyor, herding is his additional income. His primary income is in growing crops. He likes working in the field. The photo is of him in the field where he plans to grow corn. He loves to watch as young shoots of corn and barley grow day by day.  But Doniyor doesn't do his work just for fun, he works so his family can live comfortably and so that his children are educated and grow up healthy. With the onset of warmer weather, Doniyor begins his field work. 

Doniyor saved money during the winter to prepare the land for planting, but Donieyor needs additional money to buy seeds and fertilizer. To solve this financial problem, Doniyor applied to Arvand for a loan. Doniyor thanks Arvand in advance for the support, with which he will be able to improve quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as humble. She operates a retail business where she sells sandals, ornaments and other items. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals and tourists. She describes her biggest business challenge to be season changes. 

She will use the 60,000 KES loan to buy more sandals, ornamentals and other items for resale. Her business goal is to be able to run a tour guide company for tourists within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will open up other businesses. This is her fourth loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were paid successfully.

loans.use: buy more sandals, ornamentals, and other items for resale.

loans.name: Rashel

texts.en:
Rashel is 43-years-old and married with two children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Rashel is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rashel has been in the pig fattening business for eight years and also earns an additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is a widowed woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour, sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking  oil.

loans.name: Hilux

texts.en: Hilux is a 32-year-old married man. He has two children, ages 3 and 7. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a barber shop where he shaves men's hair. He has been involved in this business for one year. His primary customers are male customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be power outages. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more hair shaving machines. His business goal is to have a chain of shops within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more hair shaving machines

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business raising pigs in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pig business.

Rosemarie has been in this business for one year. Rosemarie earns more income from a general store.

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Sindiya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SINDIYA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 36 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Fana, commune de GUEGNEKA, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiment, de charbon, d’ustensile, d’habillement, et de jus. Les femmes du groupe SINDIYA sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà cités.
La cliente NAYINI la première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang assis est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de charbon de bois. Elle compte acheter 93 sacs de charbons de bois avec les paysans de Yola. La vente se fait en espèce, uniquement à ses clients venus de Bamako pour l’occasion. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 85 000Fcfa qui sera réinjecté dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The SINDIYA group is made up of married women who are, on average, 36 years old and also have an average of four children each.  They all live in traditional families in the town of Fana, commune of Guegneka, Cercle of Dioïla, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  They know one another through family, neighborhood and friendship ties.  They sell condiments, charcoal, utensils, clothes and juices, and are on their fifth solidarity loan.  In order to be able to meet the high demand from their customers, they have turned to Soro Yiriwaso, and will use their loans to buy the goods mentioned above.

Nayini, the featured borrower, is an illiterate woman who currently sells charcoal.  In the photo, she is in the front row, on the left.  She is planning to buy 93 bags of charcoal from farmers in Yola.  Nayini resells her merchandise to her customers, who come from Bamako exclusively for this reason. Her customers pay her in cash. She is expecting to make a monthly profit of 85,000 CFA francs which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy some charcoal.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe TIESSIRI est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 43 ans, et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Bouya, commune de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de haricot,  de condiment, de céréale, de couscous sec, de dah, et de cola. Les femmes du groupe TIESSIRI sont à leur quatorzième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO. 
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente SALI la première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang assis n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse de grains de haricot. Elle compte acheter 150 kg de haricot, sur place avec les paysans du village. La vente se fait en détail à Banco à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 21 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour assurer les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The group TIESSIRI is composed of married women, who average 34 years of age and four children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of Bouya, in Commune de Banco, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in beans, condiments, grains, couscous, 'dah' [dried hibiscus flowers], and 'cola'. 

The women of the group TIESSIRI are on their fourteenth solidarity loan. To meet the enormous demand from their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. These funds will be used to purchase their merchandise as cited above.

This client, SALI, who is the first person sitting at the left, is uneducated. She is currently a vendor of beans. She intends to purchase 150 kg of beans locally from village's peasant farmers. Sales are made retail to a mixed customer base in Banco. She plans on making a monthly profit of 21,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover the family's day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase beans

loans.name: Benkola Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKOLA est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 45 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Kalake Bamana, commune de Kalake préfecture de Baroueli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréale, de condiment, de ’habillement, et de charbon. Les femmes du groupe BENKOLA sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente ATOUMATA  la deuxième personne à partir de la droite est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de charbon de bois Elle compte acheter  50 sacs de charbon de bois sur place avec les paysans du village. La vente se fait en gros uniquement à ses clients venus de Bamako. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 35 000FCFA, qui sera réinjecté dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The group BENKOLA is composed of married women, who average 45 years of age and four children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of Kalake Bamana, in Commune de Kalake, Préfecture de Baroueli, Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in grains, condiments, clothing, and charcoal. 

The women of the group BENKOLA are on their fifth solidarity loan. To meet the enormous demand from their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. These funds will be used to purchase their merchandise as cited above.

This client, ATOUMATA, who is the second person at the left, is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of charcoal. She intends to purchase 50 sacks of charcoal locally from the village's peasant farmers. Sales are made in bulk to her customers from Bamako. She plans on making a monthly profit of 35,000 francs CFA that will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal

loans.name: Guldasta

texts.en:
Guldasta is a 26 year old refugee. She is married and has a daughter. Her husband is a laborer. The family lives in an IDP settlement. Guldasta is a good farmer. She grows seasonal fruits and then sells them at local bazaar. Her monthly income is 200AZN. She has been working in this field for 4 years and has a lot of experience. 

People like eating fresh fruits. They use them to prepare juice or jam. They also cook fruit cakes and other kinds of sweet things.  People prefer to buy fresh fruits from Guldasta, because her products are cheaper and don’t contain pesticides.

Guldasta is a good mother. She does everything for her only daughter. She wants her child to be well-educated. She plans to increase her income and provide her daughter with as excellent an education as possible. She applied for 1500AZN in order to buy new fertilizers. She wants to raise and sell not only fruits, but also vegetables in order to expand her business and income.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizers.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DANAYA est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Kalake Bamana, commune de Kalake préfecture de Barouéli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de savon, et de jarre. Les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente SEBA  la personne assise est analphabète, elle fait actuellement la fabrication de jarres. Elle compte acheter du bois de chauffe et de l’argile sur place avec les paysans du village, et le transforme en jarre de très bonne qualité. La vente se fait en gros chez elle, uniquement à ses clients venus de Barouéli. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20 000FCFA, qui sera réinjecté dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The group DANAYA is composed of married women, who average 37 years of age and four children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of Kalake Bamana, in Commune de Kalake, Préfecture de Baroueli, Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in soap and earthenware containers. 

The women of the group DANAYA are on their first solidarity loan. To meet the enormous demand from their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso.
