This client, SEBA, who is sitting in the photo, is illiterate. She intends to purchase firewood and some clay locally from the village's peasant farmers and then make earthenware. Sales are made in bulk at her home solely to her customers from Barouéli. She plans on making a monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for making earthenware

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is married with five children, and three of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (her mother and brother). She has a business selling groundnuts. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of groundnuts (cereals). She has been in this business for 20 years. She works in a shop seven days out of every week and sells on both a retail and wholesale basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She aspires to own a delivery van to ease transportation, and also to sell on a wholesale basis only. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of groundnuts.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Sonia works hard to support her family. She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Sonia is borrowing 19,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase an additional box of fish to sell for her fish-vending business.

Sonia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional box of fish to sell.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en: Esterlita is  a married woman and a mother of three children from Bohol, Philippines. She is engaged in vegetable farming at her home, growing various kinds of vegetables like string onions, squash, string beans and others. Esterlita has been in the farming business for more than 22 years now, and she is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. Through this loan, she will be able to grow and improve the productivity of her farm. In the future, Esterlita wants to expand her farming business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a widowed woman with five children, all of whom attend school. They live in their own house which has electricity but no piped water. Florence's greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over twelve years, Florence has been operating a beauty salon. Her potential customers are neighbors and townspeople. She dreams of making her business into a beauty training school. 

With the loan that she is requesting, Florence wants to purchase hair extensions, hair treatment and shampoos, and to pay school fees for her children. She joined Yehu because of its favorable loan requirements.

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions, hair treatment, and shampoos, and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business, which she has been in for six years. Violeta also earns more income from pig fattening.

Violeta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a married woman, and she has three children, ages four to six years. She describes herself to be determined. Mercy operates a farm where she grows carrots, and she has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in an area good for farming and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be weather changes. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs. Her business goal is to own a large piece of farmland within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will economically sustain her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
Gladis de 53 años de edad, no estudio, está acompañada desde hace 35 años, su compañero de vida  se dedica a la agricultura,  procrearon  cinco hijos de los cuales solamente uno está en casa, ya no estudia se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura. Los demás hijos son hogares aparte.

Ella se dedica al comercio informal de venta de pan, en la misma comunidad donde vive. Se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde hace 15 años es un trabajo que le permite tener un ingreso adicional a la economía familiar. La cliente vende  su producto en su misma comunidad sale a vender 2 veces al día por la mañana y por la tarde. El producto se lo llevan hasta la comunidad para que ella lo distribuya en porciones. 


El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar más pan de otra variedad  para mejorar  la venta de su negocio. Esto vendrá a mejorar los ingresos de su familia.

Los sueños de Gladis son poner su propio negocio en su casa, ya que por  la edad se le dificulta, mas y para su familia desea seguirlos ayudándolos para que ellos cumplan sus objetivos. El préstamo le ayudara a mejorar sus ingresos y cubrir las necesidades que presentan como familia,  la cliente desea ampliar el negocio poniendo su propio puesto de venta en su casa.
texts.en:
Gladis is 53 years old and never went to school. She has had a life partner for 35 years who makes a living in farming. They have had five children, of which only one is still living at home and no longer goes to school, but makes a living farming. The rest of children now live in their own homes.

She makes a living with an informal business selling bread in the community where she lives. She has done this for 15 years and it is a job that allows her to have an additional income for the family finances. The client sells her product in her community, going out to sell twice a day, in the morning and in the afternoon. She takes her product to the community to sell in portions.

She will use the loan she is requesting from CREDICAMPO to buy more varieties of bread to improve her business' sales. She will sell this to improve her family's income.

Galdis' dreams are to have her own business in her home, because at her age it is hard, and for her family she wants to continue helping them so that they achieve their goals. The loan will help her to improve her income and cover the necessities for her family. She wants to expand her business by setting up her own sales stand at her house.

loans.use: to buy more varieties of bread to improve her business' sales.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en: Mwanamisi is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family thanks to her hard work. She is asking for a loan to buy food ingredients such as wheat flour, milk, cooking oil, maize flour and sugar for her business. She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients such as wheat flour, milk, cooking oil, maize flour and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia is an experienced farmer from Sormoni village. She lives with her husband and daughter. Her husband works as a driver and transports cargo. He generates approximately 125 GEL monthly.

To be able to take care of the family's needs, Natalia is engaged in cattle, milk-cows and pig breeding and in the cultivation of a vineyard. With the help of her husband she sells the agricultural products in the local market. As the family's needs are growing with time, Natalia wants to start another activity in order to more effectively meet the family's needs.

She needs a loan of 3000 GEL to purchase a stock of clothing at wholesale prices. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. Natalia will purchase needed products and will start a trading business with her daughter. She will sell among her neighbors and villagers. Natalia and her family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain and develop their business.

loans.use: to start a clothing trading business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, iron, and sand to begin building the walls of her home.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJEKAFO est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 48 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Fana, commune de GUEGNEKA, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiment, de chaussure, de bois, et de fruits et légumes. Les femmes du groupe DJEKAFO sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente DOUSSOU  la première personne à partir de la droite est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de fruits et légumes. Elle compte acheter 5 caisses de bananes, et 2 paniers de concombres avec son argent chez les grossistes au marché hebdomadaire. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce à Fana à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 76 000Fcfa, qui sera en partie utilisé pour assurer les dépenses quotidiennes, et le reste injecté dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The Djekafo group consists of married women who on average are 48 years old with four children. They all live in traditional families in the city of Fana in the Guegneka district, part of the Dioila prefecture in the region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They became acquainted through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship. They trade condiments, shoes, wood, and fruit and vegetables. The Djekafo group of women are on their third group loan. In order to meet the huge demand of their customers, they call upon Soro Yiriwaso.

Group member Doussou (the first person from the right) is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of fruit and vegetables. She intends to use her loan to buy five crates of bananas and two baskets of cucumbers from wholesalers at the weekly market. Retail sales are made for cash in Fana, to a mixed clientele.

She expects monthly profits of 76,000 CFA francs, which will be partly used to meet daily expenses, and the remainder re-injected into the business activity.

loans.use: buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Yuldosh

texts.ru:
Юлдош добродушный  мужчина в возрасте 51 года. Он женат  и имеет пятерых детей. Все его дети уже взрослые и имеют свои семьи. Юлдош живёт со своей женой в небольшом доме в сельском посёлке. Несмотря на свой возраст, он полон сил и желания работать на благо своей семьи. Юлдош  занимается деканством и животноводством. У него имеется  земельная площадь. Из общей площади земли  8 га составляет богарные земли, а остальная площадь это поливные земли.  На этой земле Юлдош занимается выращиванием моркови, картошки и зерновых культур. А его жена помогает ему ухаживать и растить скот. Она также работает поваром в местной больнице.

Юлдош старается много работать, чтобы иметь достаточно средств для достойного проживания. От своего бизнеса он получает небольшой доход. Также помогает ему сын, который находится на заработках в России и присылает каждый месяц денежные средства. Бизнес животноводства может приносить хороший доход, поэтому Юлдош хочет расширить этот бизнес, увеличив поголовье своего скота. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд, чтобы получить кредит на покупку скота. Юлдош заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Yuldosh is a kind 51 year-old man.  He is married and has five children.  All of his children are already grown and have their own families.  Yuldosh lives with his wife in a small house in a village.  Despite his age, he is full of strength and desire to work for the welfare of his family.  Yuldosh is involved in farming and animal husbandry.  He has a land plot.  Out of all his land, 8 hectares are rainfed land and the rest of the area is irrigated land.  Yuldosh grows carrots, potatoes and cereal crops on this land.  And his wife helps him to take care of and raise livestock.  She also works as a cook at a local hospital.

Yuldosh tries to work a lot in order to have enough means for a decent living.  He earns a small income from his business.  His son, who works in Russia and sends money every month, also helps him.  The animal husbandry business yields a good income, and this is why Yuldosh wants to expand this business by increasing livestock headcount.  Therefore, he came to Arvand to obtain a loan to buy livestock.  Yuldosh thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Sulaika

texts.ru: Сулайке 46 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Сулайки - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Сулайка занимается животноводством, стартовав 19 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Сулайки, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 нетель, 20 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Сулайка обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Сулайка планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Sulaika is 46 years old, married and raising 4 children together with her husband. Sulaika has a secondary education. To provide the primary income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry, having started 19 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Sulaika's hard work, today her business contains 1 dairy cow, 1 heifer and 20 sheep. The monthly income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Sulaika requested a loan from the bank "Bai-Tushum" to buy cattle in order to increase her livestock headcount. Sulaika plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money for her children's continued education.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Raya

texts.ru: Рае 54 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Раи - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Рая занимается животноводством, стартовав 10 лет назад, с покупки скота на 36,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Раи, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 6 дойных коров, 3 теленка. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Рая обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Рая планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Raya is 56 years old, married and raising 2 children together with her husband. Raya has a secondary education. To provide the primary income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry, having started 10 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 36,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Raya's hard work, today her business contains 6 dairy cows and 3 calves. The monthly income amounts to 12,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Raya requested a loan from the bank "Bai-Tushum" to buy cattle in order to increase her livestock headcount. Raya plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is a 30-year-old single woman with 2 children. She describes herself as honest and polite. 

She operates a retail busines where she sells tomatoes, carrots, oranges and other items. She has been involved in this business for 1 year, and her primary customers are local residents. She says her biggest business challenge is lack of funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes, carrots, oranges and other items. Her business goal is to open other branches in the next 5 years. 

She hopes that in the future she will be able to improve her family's living standards. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tomatoes, carrots, oranges and other items

loans.name: Amicolé's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 6 femmes a comme activité principale la culture des bananes, avec des périmètres de bananerais situé au bord d'un bras de fleuve.  

Aby qui se trouve à l'extrême droite de la photo et levant le bras, est la représentante, elle  est mariée et  mère de 04 enfants. elle s'active aussi dans l'exploitation des bananes. 

Avec se crédit elle compte élargir ses activités avec le développement de ses champs de plantation et la diversification de ses fruits. Elle compte investir 150000f dans ses plantation 100000f dans le rachat des fruits des autres pour les revendre à dans sa capitale régionale et les 50000f qui reste vont servir de transport et de fonds de roulement.

Avec les Bénéfices issus des ventes de bananes notre promotrice compte appuyer son mari sur les dépenses familiales, la scolarité de ses enfants...
texts.en:
Thye main activity of this group of six women is to grow bananas, with banana groves bordering on an arm of the river.

Aby, who is at the far right of the picture and raising her arm, is the group representative. She is married and the mother of four children. She is also active in the farming of bananas. 

She plans to use her loan to extend her activities by developing her plantation and diversifying her fruit crops. She plans to invest 150,000 francs in her plantation, 100,000 francs to acquire fruit from other members for resale in the regional capital, and the remaining 50,000 francs will be used for transportation costs and serve as working capital. 

With the profits from banana sales our representative intends to help her husband with household expenditures, and ensure her children's education.

loans.use: expand and further improve her plantation

loans.name: Mbene's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis le début des activités du banc villageois .
Il regroupe 3 femmes issues du même quartier unies par de bonnes relations sociales économiques et professionnelles. La responsable madame Mbène est une femme mariée âgée de 60 ans et mère de d'un garçon.
Elle est debout à gauche de la photo la main levée. Elle s'active dans le commerce par la vente de produits alimentaires.
Le nouveau crédit de  cinq cent mille francs cfa  (500000) lui permettra de se procurer de la marchandise qu'elle va revendre au niveau de son quartier. 
Les bénéfices générés par son activité lui permettront de payer les factures d'électricité de payer de la nourriture pour sa famille.
texts.en:
This group has been created from the inception of the "banc villageois" loan association. It brings together three women from the same neighborhood, united by good social, economic and professional relations.

Mrs. Mbène is the group representative. She is a 60-year-old married woman and the mother of one boy. She is standing to the left of the picture raising her hand. She is active in the retail trade of food products. 

The new credit loan of five hundred thousand CFA francs (500,000) will enable her to buy merchandise she will resell in her neighborhood. Profits generated by her business activity will enable her to pay electric bills and buy food for her family.

loans.use: buy food products for retail sales

loans.name: Analin

texts.en:
Analin is a married woman with four children, two of whom are currently in school. She is 38 years old, and is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Analin has a buy and sell firewood business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of firewood to sell to her customers.

Analin has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of firewood to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is a 35-year-old married woman with 2 children. She describes herself as committed. 

She operates a retail business where she sells basins, hot pots, jiko stoves and other items. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her primary customers are the general public. She says her biggest business challenge is insufficient funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of basins, hot pots and other items for resale. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business in the next 5 years. 

She hopes that in the future she will have a successful business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more stock of basins, hot pots and other items

loans.name: Uguljon

texts.en: Uguljon was born in 1964. She is married and has three children. Uguljon decided to organize her own animal husbandry business six months ago. She feeds cattle at her house where she has a cowshed. Uguljon is going to develop her new business. She took part in the course ‘To get Ahead’ from a women's organization and got a certificate. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 Somoni to buy cattle to increase the working capital of her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy more cattle

loans.name: Martha Ines

texts.es: Martha Ines, mayor de edad, soltera con tres hijos mayores de edad, originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega, ubicado en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable y con muchos deseos de superación personal, es una microempresaria que se dedica a la comercialización de los derivados de la res como: carne, hueso, molida, menudos, los que comercializa en su puesto de venta ubicado en una zona muy comercial y productiva, sus compras las realiza en distribuidoras de la misma localidad las cuales son al por mayor y al contado, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, inicia su propio negocio con fondos propios como un medio digno de vivir, inicia su jornada diaria desde muy temprano para lograr brindarle un mejor servicio a sus clientes, el objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de carnes, menudos, hueso entre otros, para lograr cubrir la demanda que tiene hoy en día por los clientes.
texts.en:
Martha Ines, is a single mother with three adult children.  She is from one of the towns in Chinandega in the western part of the country.  She is known for being a hard-working, responsible woman with much determination to get ahead.  She is a small business owner who sells beef products such as meat, bones, ground beef and giblets which she sells at a stall set up in a very commercial and productive area.  She buys from distributors in the area on a wholesale, cash basis, and she has fixed and eventual customers.

The purpose of this loan is to have enough work capital to buy meats, giblets, bones, etc. to cover the current customer demand.

loans.use: To buy meat, giblets, bones, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Bonifacia

texts.es: Rosa Bonifacia mayor de edad soltera con seis hijos todos mayores e independientes, originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega, ubicado en el occidente del país, donde predomina el ron, la azúcar y el comercio, Rosa se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, honrada, responsable y con muchos deseos de superación personal. Rosa es una microempresaria que presta el servicio de alquiler de Sillas, mesas plásticas y manteles, venta de frijoles cosidos, venta de recargas telefónicas( Moviestar y Claro), entre otros mas, negocio el cual lo tiene ubicado en sus propia casa de habitación, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, uno de sus sueños es poder agrandar mas su negocio. el objetivo de este financiamiento es para compra de activo fijo e invertir en su negocio en la compra de Sillas, mesas plásticas, para brindarle una mejor atención a sus clientes y poder cubrir con la demanda que hoy en día tiene. Rosa agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.-
texts.en:
Rosa Bonifacia is a single mother with six adult, independent children.  She is from one of the towns in Chinandega in the western part of the country where rum, sugar and commerce are the predominant activities.  Rosa is known as a hard-working, honest, responsible woman with much determination to get ahead.  She is a small business owner who rents chairs, plastic tables and tablecloths and sells cooked beans, and cell phone recharges (Movistar and Claro), as well as other activities.  She works out of her own home and has fixed and eventual customers.

One of her goals is to expand her business in order to buy fixed assets by investing in chairs and plastic tables to provide better customer service by meeting the current demand.  Rosa is very grateful for the support Kiva lenders give to people with low incomes.

loans.use: To buy fixed assets (plastic tables and chairs), firewood, salt, beans, tablecloths, etc.

loans.name: Victorina

texts.es:
Victoria de 54 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, el esposo es vigilante en una empresa privada, tiene 9 hijos, de los cuales 5 viven con ella, los cuatro que no viven con ella, tienen  sus propios hogares, de los que están con ella 2 trabajan y 3 van a la escuela, esa es toda la familia del cliente.

Piensa que no tiene un empleo, porque no estudio o tal vez por su situación económica no se lo permitió también por la falta de oportunidades de trabajo en la zona se dedica a  los oficios domésticos. 
El crédito es de $800.0 una parte lo utilizara para la elaboración y venta de tamales y otra parte para el estudio de sus hijos en compra de vestimenta, gastos de pasaje y alimentación  y tener una parte para cualquier necesidad o emergencia de su familia.

Ella planea incrementar su negocio también que sus hijos sigan estudiando, ella si esta deacuerdo que el financiamiento que le hace CREDICAMPO, le ayuda mucho en cumplir sus sueños, la agilidad del otorgamiento del crédito es muy buena, porque lo tiene cuando lo necesita, los ingresos que ella tiene los está invirtiendo en sus alimentación y estudio de sus hijos.
Ella tiene mucho sueños a futuro que sus hijos sigan estudiando y que en un futuro sean profesionales de bien y desarrollo para la sociedad, y se siente bien tener una mano amiga como lo es CREDICAMPO.
texts.en:
Victorina, 54, studied up to the second grade. Her husband works as a security guard for a private company. Victorina has nine children. Five of them live with her: two of them work with her and three go to school. The remaining four have their own families.

She thinks that the reason for being unemployed is that she did not complete her studies. This was due to her financial situation and the lack of job opportunities in the region. She works as a housekeeper.

Victorina is requesting a loan of $800. She will use a part of it for her tamales business, another one to pay for her children’s studies, clothes, transportation and food, and the remaining for any emergency that could arise.

She is planning to expand her business and help her children to continue with their studies. She thinks that this loan that CREDICAMPO is offering her will help her to reach her goals. She thinks that the process has been easy and she will receive the loan when she needs it. She uses her income to pay for her children’s food and education.

She has many dreams for the future. She wants her children to continue studying and become useful professionals for their community. She appreciates the support given by CREDICAMPO.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her tamales business, to pay for her children's education and maintenance, and to have a buffer for an eventual emergency.

loans.name: Marieme's Group

texts.fr:
Ces deux femmes sont issues du même village et forment un groupe au sein de leur banc villageois. Elles sont unies par de bonnes relations sociales économiques et professionnelles.

La représentante, madame Ndèye Touti est âgée de 35 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d'un garçon scolarisé âgé de huit ans .

Elle est debout à gauche de la photo la main levée. Son nouveau crédit de cinq cent mille lui permettra de se 

payer des balles de tissu Wax qu'elle va revendre au détail au niveau du marché centrale de la ville.

les bénéfices réalisés par son activité lui permettent de payer la scolarité de son enfant et  de renforcer ses 

épargnes au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
These two women come from the same village, and make up a group within their Banc Villageois. They are bound by good social, economic, and business relationships.

Mrs. Ndèye Touti, age 35, is the group's representative. She's the woman raising her hand on the left in the photograph. She's married and the mother of an eight-year-old child who goes to school.

Her new loan of XOF 500'000 will enable her to buy bales of Wax fabric, that she will retail at the central market in her city. The generated profits enable her to pay for her child's education and to strengthen her savings at the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to buy bales of Wax fabric

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es: Amalia de 39 años de edad vive en casa que sus padres le dejaron como herencia. Ella vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 18 y 13 años de edad. Amalia tiene una pequeña granja de pollos de engorde los que vende a buen precio, además se dedica a vender bebidas gaseosas. Su esposo es un obrero de la construcción. Amalia desea mejorar la casa que sus padres le dejaron, por lo que ha decidido adquirir un crédito con FUSAI para comprar las ventanas tipo Solaire y el piso cerámico para toda la vivienda, la mano de obra será realizada por su propio esposo.
texts.en:
Amalia, 39, lives in the house she inherited from her parents, with her husband and two children, ages 18 and 13.  She has a small farm and raises and sells chicken at a good price.  She also sells sodas.  Her husband is a construction worker.

Amalia wants to renovate the house she inherited from her parents and has decided to request a loan through FUSAI to buy Solaire windows and ceramic floor tile for the whole house.  Her husband will do all the work.

loans.use: To buy Solaire windows and ceramic tiles for her house.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe TIESSIRI est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 32 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Fana, commune de GUEGNEKA, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de savon, et d’habillement. Les femmes du groupe TIESSIRI sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente KADIATOU la deuxième personne à partir de la droite est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de pagnes. Elle compte acheter 10 puces de pagnes wax avec son argent chez les grossistes à Bamako. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce à Fana, et parfois ambulante à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000Fcfa, qui sera réinjecté dans l’activité.
texts.en:
Tiessiri Group is made up of married women who average 32 years of age and three children. They all live in traditional families in Fana, a city in the municipality of Guegneka, Dioïla Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They got to know each other through bonds of kinship, community and friendship. They run food serving businesses, and sell soaps and clothing. In order to meet a very high customer demand they are seeking support from Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso. They are seeking their third solidarity loan (group loan).

Kadiatou is the second person from the left in the photograph. She's illiterate and, at this time, she resells "pagnes" (colorful African cloth). She intends to use her money to buy 10 lengths of pagnes Wax from wholesalers in Bamako.

She sells retail and for cash in Fana, sometimes also as a traveling saleswoman, to a mixed-gender clientele. She intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 75'000, to be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy 20 lengths of Wax pagnes (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Rubidia Elizabeth

texts.es: Rubidia de 30 años de edad es madre de una niña de 7 años de edad. María es casada y su esposo es empleado de una fabrica reconocida de su localidad. Rubidia tiene una pequeña pupusería(venta de pupusas; plato típico elaborado de arroz o maíz relleno de queso, chicharron y otros ingredientes), también hace pasteles y refrescos. Rubidia necesita cambiar urgentemente la lámina de fibrocemento de su vivienda ya que un arbol de coco quebró parte del techo al caer sobre él. Por no tener a la mano todo el dinero que este trabajo implica, está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para comprar la lámina de fibrocemento, pines galvanizados y pagar la mano de obra. Rubidia se compromete a pagar la totalidad de las cuotas que este crédito implica.
texts.en:
Rubidia, 30, is the mother of a nine-year-old daughter.  She is married and her husband works at a well-known factory in their town.  Rubidia has a small pupusa business.  Pupusas are a typical dish made of corn or rice tortilla stuffed with cheese, pork cracklings and other ingredients.  She also sells pastries and soft drinks.

Rubidia urgently needs to change the corrugated roofing of her house because a coconut tree damaged part of the roof by falling on it.  Since she does not have all the money she needs for the job she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy corrugated roofing and nails and to hire workers.  Rubidia is committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy corrugated roofing to repair the damaged roof.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane lives in Armavir town. She lives there with her mother and brother. Gayane works at a local flower salon as a designer. Besides her work in that salon, Gayane also receives orders for designing and organizing wedding ceremonies. She is a very talented young lady who does her best to provide better quality service to the clients. 

Now, she has applied for this loan to be able to purchase supplies needed for providing wedding design services. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit.

loans.use: to pay for supplies for providing wedding design services.

loans.name: Emilou

texts.en:
Emilou works hard to support her family. She is married and has an abaca-weaving business in the Philippines.

Emilou requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional raw materials for her business. She has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Emilou would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Santos Milagro

texts.es:
Santos de 30 años de edad,  estudio hasta tercer grado de educación, está casada desde hace 13 años, su esposo quien es agricultor en pequeño, pescador y jornalero.  Tienen 3 hijos los cuales estudian y aún viven con ellos en casa.  

Ella se dedica al comercio individual e informal dentro de su mismo cantón donde vive ella y se dedica la  venta de productos como perfumes, cosméticos, entre otros productos. El cliente es consultora de venta por catálogo, esto le ayuda a tener un ingreso adicional en su casa y es una forma de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
El trabajo del cliente es en la misma comunidad y su horario de trabajo es de 4 horas al día.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar material para el mejoramiento de su vivienda, como Adobe, teja y madera. El préstamo le ayudara a mejorar parte de su casa, que está en malas condiciones  y así asegurar un mejor lugar para vivir para sus hijos.

Sus  sueños son tener la oportunidad de seguir trabajando hasta que Dios quiera y para su familia seguir luchando  porque estén bien aún que sus hijos están pequeños, sueña con  verlos grandes y que estudien para que se superen en la vida.
texts.en:
Santos is 30 years old, and studied up to the third grade. She has been married for 13 years, and her husband is a small-scale farmer, fisherman and laborer. They have three children, who study and still live at home with them. 

She makes a living as a self-employed informal trader in the same canton in which she lives. She sells products such as perfumes, cosmetics, and other items. She sells these via a catalogue, and this represents an additional source of income for her household and is a way of helping her husband with the household expenses. She works doing this for four hours a day in her own community.

The loan she is requesting is to buy materials to improve her home, such as adobe, tiles and wood. The loan will help her to improve part of her house, which is in a bad state of repair, which will, in turn, provide better living conditions for her children.

Her dreams are to have the chance to keep working for as long as possible and to keep fighting for her family, which is well, although her children are still young, and she dreams of seeing them grow up and study to succeed in life.

loans.use: to buy materials to improve her home, such as adobe, tiles and wood.

loans.name: Genna

texts.en:
Genna is 46 years old and married with two children. She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Genna requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Genna has been in the pig-fattening business for two years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: María de 51 años de edad vive junto a su esposo y sus 5 hijos en condiciones muy humilde. Su vivienda es de adobe, techo de lámina galvanizada y estructura de madera. Aunque tres de sus hijos son mayores de edad y aportan para los gastos del hogar, María y su esposo siguen esforzándose para salir adelante con la educación de sus otros 2 hijos. María se dedica a la venta de quesadillas de harina de arroz o maíz con queso; actividad que ha realizado durante 27 años de su vida. Su esposo es seguridad de un almacén privado. En vista del deterioro de la lámina y madera del techo, María ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para reparar todo el techo de su vivienda. Con el dinero comprará la lámina galvanizada, la madera para la estructura y otros accesorios necesarios para la reparación.
texts.en: María is 51 years old and lives with her husband and five children in very modest living conditions. Her home is made of adobe, with a galvanized sheet roof and a wooden structure. Although three of her children are grown-up and contribute towards household expenses, María and her husband keep working hard to support the education of their other two children. María makes a living selling wheat or rice-flour quesadillas with cheese. She has done this for 27 years of her life. Her husband is a security guard in a private store. In view of the deteriorating state of the sheeting and wood on the roof, María has requested a loan from FUSAI to repair all of the roof on her house. She will use the money to buy galvanized sheeting, structural wood and other items needed for the repair work.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheeting, wood and other items to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Ivannia

texts.es: Ivannia, está casada, tiene la edad de 26 años y vive con sus hijos y su esposo que son su mayor prioridad. Ella con el crédito va comprar unos animales para aprovechar un terreno apto que poseen. Ella va comprar los terneros con los planes de poder tenerlos listos para la venta lo más rápido posible y a su vez asi generarle el máximo de ganancias. Ella piensa en el futuro de sus hijos y quiere ofrecerles a ellos cada día una mejor calidad de vida. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Ivannia, 26, is married and lives with her husband and children.  Her family is the most important thing to her.  With this loan she is going to buy some animals so she can make the most of the suitable land that they have.  She is going to buy cattle with a view to having them ready for sale as soon as possible.  This will help her to get maximum profit out of them.  She is thinking about the future of her children and wants to give her children a good standard of living every day.  

This is the first loan she has had through FUDECOSUR.  She has not had any previous loans with any state banks.  FUDECOSUR has made it easier for her to get a loan and the interest rate is much lower.

loans.use: to buy animals to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand and iron to build a wall of his house.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma tiene dos hijos, uno de 7 años y un bebé de 7 meses de edad. Norma tiene 31 años de edad y está acompañada. La vivienda de Norma es muy humilde pero ella y su compañero están dispuestos a trabajar duro para sacar adelante a sus dos pequeños hijos. Norma ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para comprar lámina galvanizada y clavos así sustituir la existente que ya esta bastante deteriorada. Con la ganancia de la venta de dulces artesanales que Norma hace, cancelará mes a mes todas las cuotas de este crédito.
texts.en:
Norma, 31, lives with her partner and her two children, one aged 7 and another, a baby of 7 months.  Norma’s house is very humble but she and her partner are prepared to work hard to raise their two children.  

She has asked for a loan from FUSAI to buy corrugated sheets and nails so that she can replace the existing roof which is in a state of deterioration.  With the income she generates from selling homemade sweets, she will pay off the loan month by month.

loans.use: to buy corrugated sheets and nails so that she can replace the broken sheets which cover her home.

loans.name: Evelyn Esmeralda

texts.es: Evelyn de 22 años de edad tiene su vivienda que su padre le ha dado como herencia. Ella tiene un hijo de 4 años de edad, su compañero de vida se dedica a la carpintería. Evelyn vende frutas y verduras, los fines de semana hecha pupusas y sus vecinos son los principales clientes. Evelyn ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para reparar el techo de la vivienda ya que la lámina está muy deteriorada. Con el dinero comprará la lámina galvanizada, clavos y la madera para la estructura del techo.
texts.en:
Evelyn, 22, inherited her house from her father.  She has a four-year-old son and her partner is a carpenter.  Evelyn sells fruit and vegetables and at the weekends she makes stuffed tortillas, selling them to her neighbors.  

She has asked for a loan from FUSAI to repair the roof of her home which is in a state of deterioration.  With the money, she will buy corrugated sheets, nails and wood for building the roof.

loans.use: to buy corrugated sheets, nails and wood to repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Martha Jeaneth

texts.es: Martha es una humilde comerciante de tortillas, frijoles y su esposo realiza a diario trabajos de agricultura, ella le asigna roles de trabajos a sus hijos en cuanto a la venta de tortillas y apoyo a su padre con la agricultura en tiempos libres de estudios, de esta manera les enseña a trabajar. Solicita este crédito para invertir en su negocio comprando materia prima como quintales de maíz, frijoles, para continuar con su actividad económica para la manutención de su hogar.
texts.en: Martha is a humble seller of tortillas and beans, and her husband works every day as a farmer. She gives her children jobs to help out with selling tortillas and supporting their father with farming when they are not studying. In this way, she is teaching them how to work. She is requesting this loan to invest in her business by buying ingredients such as bags of corn and beans, to continue her economic activity to support the home.

loans.use: to buy firewood, beans, and corn, and pay for their transportation.

loans.name: Rajhab

texts.en:
Rajhab is thirty years old. He is married and has two sons. All members of the family live in an IDP (internally displaced persons) settlement. His wife is a housekeeper and raises the children. He is a farmer and raises seasonal fruits (apples, pears, cherries etc) and vegetables (cucumbers, greens, potatoes, tomatoes and so on). He sells all these products at the local bazaar to earn 180 AZN each month. He has been working in this field for five years and has good experience in gardening.

People like eating fresh fruit and vegetables because this is very good for their health. Besides that, people prepare different national dishes from vegetables and delicious sweet pies, cakes and jams from fruits. People prefer buying fruits and vegetables from Rajhab’s grocery. They visit every morning in order to buy all the products they need because his produce is always fresh and tasty.

Rajhab wants to expand his business and increase his monthly income. His current income isn’t enough to cover the children’s education and meet family’s demands. He applied for 1,100 AZN loan in order to buy high-quality fertilizers and garden tools. This is his second loan and he has a positive history as a client.

loans.use: to buy high-quality fertilizers and garden tools

loans.name: Albino

texts.es: Albino de 47 años de edad y su esposa viven en casa propia junto a sus 7 hijos. Albino trabaja la tierra, él alquila una manzana de extensión para el cultivo de maíz y frijol. También Albino da sus servicios como vigilante independiente. La esposa de Albino se dedica a la venta de hojas de guineo, frutas y verduras. Ambos se están esforzando mucho para sacar adelante a sus hijos; los tres hijos mayores estudian y trabajan en la ciudad principal del país, los otros 3 hijos de 15, 9 y 7 años de edad están en una escuela pública y el más pequeño de 2 años de edad. Albino quiere mejorar las condiciones de su humilde vivienda que es de adobe. Él ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para reparar el techo de su vivienda ya que se encuentra muy deteriorada, con el dinero comprará la lámina galvanizada, clavos y madera.
texts.en:
Albino, 47, lives with his wife and seven children in their own home.  He works in agriculture.  He rents a plot of land and grows corn and frijoles beans.  He also works as a security guard.  His wife sells fruit, vegetables and banana leaves.  Both of them work hard to raise their children.  The three eldest study and work in the main city of the country.  Another three, of 15, 9 and 7 are studying at school and the other child is only 2.

Albino wants to improve the living conditions of his humble adobe house.  He has asked FUSAI for a loan to repair the roof of the house which is in a bad state.  With the money, he will buy corrugated sheets, nails and wood.

loans.use: to buy corrugated sheets, nails and wood to repair the roof of his home.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is a 24-year-old man. He has two children, ages 1 and 4 years old. He describes himself to be hard-working. 

He operates a retail business where he sells soft drinks, drinking water, etc. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the changes in prices. 

He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy a fridge for storing the drinks he sells. He hopes that in the future, he will be a leading service provider. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM (SMEP - Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited).

loans.use: to buy a fridge for storing the drinks he sells.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a twenty-five-year-old single man. He describes himself to be hardworking. He operates a retail business where he sells maize, beans and millet. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a relatively good place and his primary customers are schools, churches and individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be weather changes. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more bags of maize. His business goal is to have a large building for a cereal store within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will own a store. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more bags of maize

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a twenty-year-old married man. He describes himself to be hardworking and committed. He operates a retail business where he sells maize, beans and millet. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a relatively good place and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be weather changes. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more cereals for resale. His business goal is to have a big store for cereals within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more cereals for resale

loans.name: Lucilita

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Lucilita works hard to support her family.

She has a gasoline retailing business in the Philippines and also earns an additional income through fattening pigs. Lucilita is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional container of gasoline to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Lucilita has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional container of gasoline to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is forty-nine years old and married. She works in the agricultural sector, raising pigs in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a loan of PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Jocelyn has been raising pigs for one year now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business activities. Jocelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a merchant from the town of Jagna, Bohol, Philippines.  She is a married woman and a mother of two  children.  Jessica runs a sari-sari or variety store in her place.  She sells various goods to the people in her place like canned goods and snack foods.

Jessica is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell like biscuits and snack foods, canned goods, noodles, candies, soap and toiletries.  Through this, she will be able to improve her stocks thus allowing her to cater to more buyers in her store.  Jessica dreams of expanding her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like biscuits and snack foods, canned goods, noodles, candies, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Moureen

texts.en:
Moureen is a married woman.  She has 2 children.  She describes herself to be optimistic.  She operates a retail business where she sells washing soap, maize flour, sugar and other items.  She has been involved in this business for 3 years.  Her business is located in  a vibrant location and her primary customers are of all types. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of capital.  She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of washing soap, sugar, flour and other items.  Her business goal is to open a wholesale shop within 5 years.  She hopes that in the future, she can buy a piece of land.  This is her first loan with SMEP DTM

loans.use: buy more stocks of washing soap, sugar, flour and other items

loans.name: Hripsime

texts.en:
Hripsime lives with her brother and mother in Armavir town.  She is a designer in one of the wedding salons in Armavir town.  She is a hard working young lady and works with great enthusiasm to provide better quality service to her clients.

Hripsime also receives orders from individuals to design their wedding ceremonies.  The income that she gathers is highly important for sustaining her family's living and Hripsime feels very responsible for covering her family's needs.  She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International.  The start-up loan program provides start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

The loan will help Hripsime to purchase tools and materials for providing wedding ceremonies.  This is very important for her and she hopes for lenders' goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials for providing wedding ceremonies

loans.name: Ma. Glenda

texts.en:
Ma. Glenda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vehicle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her vehicle for her vehicle transport business.  Ma. Glenda has been in this business for 5 years.  Ma. Glenda earns additional income from pig fattening.

Ma. Glenda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her vehicle

loans.name: Madel

texts.en:
Madel is 29 years old and married with two children.  With one child currently in school, Madel works very hard to provide for them.

Madel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries like canned goods, soft-drinks, biscuits, noodles, etc. to sell.  Madel has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft-drinks, biscuits, noodles, etc. 

Madel would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like canned goods, soft-drinks, biscuits, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Mwana

texts.en:
Mwana is a 58-year-old married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 12 years to 27 years. She describes herself as persistent. She operates a retail business where she sells garlic, pawpaw, passion fruits. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area with available market and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough operating capital. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits. She hopes that in the future, she will be independent. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits.

loans.name: Fermina

texts.en:
Fermina is a farmer from Bohol, Philippines. She is a married woman and a mother of ten children. Fermina has been engaged in a vegetable farming business for more than ten years now. This is the source of her income. 

Fermina is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm thus increasing her harvest and yield. In the future, Fermina wants to expand her farm so that it will generate more revenue. Furthermore, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rufas

texts.en:
Rufas is a 37-year-old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 5 years to 10 years. He describes himself as trustworthy. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient capital. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. His business goal is to be very prosperous within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees and improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a farmer from Jagna, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of six children.

Regina has been engaged in vegetable farming for more than 30 years now. This is the source of her income.

Regina is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm thus increasing her yield and profit.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for the farm.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana works hard to support her family. Susana is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Susana requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Susana has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Susana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Maxim

texts.en:
Maxim is 30 years old and is married with a son. He is a refugee as is all his family. They live in an IDP (internally displaced person) settlement. He earns money for his family bringing up livestock and selling their meat and wool at a local bazaar. He has been working in this area for 5 years and his monthly income is 220 AZN. 

Azerbaijani people have been bringing up sheep and selling their wool from ancient times. They use their wool for sewing warm jackets, blankets, gloves and other things. These thing made from sheep wool are very warm and soft. Sheep meat is used to cook such delicious dishes as kebab. People like eating kebab on holidays and parties. 

Maxim wants to expand his business. Though husbandry is a good source of income, unfortunately, Maxim’s income is too low to cover life demands of his family. He applied for a 1,100 AZN loan in order to buy additional cows. He plans produce and to sell milk and dairy products. 

Let’s help Maxim to reach his aim.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock.

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.en:
Valeriana is a married woman and a mother of ten children from Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in a vegetable farming business with her husband for more than 20 years now. 

Valeriana is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm thus increasing her harvest and yield. In the future, Valeriana hopes to make her farming business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money to pay for the educational expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Kshirod

texts.en:
Kshirod is a 32-year-old differently able man who lives in a small village of the Angul district of Odisha state, India, with his father, wife and one son, age 4 years. 

He has been engaged in tailoring activity for 15 years. He sews new clothes. Currently he is earning 5,000 INR from this tailoring activity. The ten villagers depend upon Kshirod 's tailoring service. He does his work very honestly. He is expert in suit-making, pants, shirt and ladies' clothes.

Now Kshirod wants to open a tailoring training center, and for that he needs another sewing machine, cloth and threads. For this he has applied for a loan amount of 20,000 INR to purchase a sewing machine, cloth and threads. He is very happy and thankful to Kiva for this support.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine, cloth and threads for a tailoring training center.

loans.name: Lhingneikim

texts.en:
Bright, smart and beautiful, Lhingneikim had to face hard times with the loss of both her parents when she was young. She says, “Empty pockets never held anyone back. Only empty heads and empty hearts can do that.” She is pictured with her grandfather.
 
Determined to become successful since school days, she has shown great interest in whatever she does, which usually caught the eye of the school heads and the principles. They played a good role in grooming her by giving her what she needs for her studies and also supporting her morally and financially. After the post school, she started tutoring children at home and generated an income to pay for her college fees.  

Her dream is to hold the Indian Administrative Service (most desirable job in India) after her completion of graduation, but family members usually discouraged her with lack of financial security because one needs to get vigorous coaching to crack the Indian Administrative Examination. 
 
Her dream was crushed because there was no one to support her financially, but then Lhingneikim got selected in the aviation industry as a cabin crew member. Her selection as a cabin crew in the aviation industry was a life saver for her maternal uncle because he is supporting her and her younger brother in pursuing their education. She had mixed feelings of both worry and elation because the job is at hand while she has to make a refundable deposit against the job towards the company. Her colleague who also got selected for the cabin crew and also is a member of Kiva introduced her to WSDS and now she can pay the deposit and be a successful cabin crew member. 

With the Kiva loan, she will pay her deposit and will join the aviation industry. Her aspiration for life is brought back by Kiva and WSDS. Life is again meaningful and worthy after she learned about Kiva. She is willing and requesting Kiva to continue this relationship and also aspires to become one of the lenders in future. She says, "Thank you so much, Kiva."

loans.use: To pay for a refundable deposit and earn her livelihood as a cabin crew member in aviation.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is a 37-year-old married man. He has two children. He describes himself as determined. He operates a retail business where he sells stationery. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are small scale. He describes his biggest business challenge to be that the business is operated from rented premises. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of books and other stationery. His business goal is to excel within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to build business premises.

loans.use: to buy more stock of books and other stationery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes and footwear from South Africa.

loans.name: Bairagi

texts.en:
Bhairagi is a 41-year-old differently able man who lives with his wife and two children in a small village of the Dhenkanal district in Odisha, India. His children go to school near his village. 

He owns a variety store in which he sells basic household items, stationery items and personnel care products. He earns 4,000 INR per month from this activity. His wife helps him in this activity.

Bairagi wants to expand his business so that he can make more profit, and for this he needs financial support. He has applied for a loan amount of 30,000 INR to purchase a fridge and for repairing a rack. After this investment he would be able to sell some perishable items from his shop.

He hopes to build a house for his family.

loans.use: To purchase a fridge and to repair a rack.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for his business, including: twelve bags of dairy products, a large pack of toilet roll, sanitary towels, soaps, basic grains, instant coffee, bath soaps, soaps for washing clothes, cold meat, chicken, mince, fizzy drinks, juices and purified water.

loans.name: Manoj

texts.en:
Manoj is a 26-year-old differently able man who lives in a small village of the Dhenkanal district of Odisha state, India, with his father, one younger brother, his wife and a 1-year-old child. His father is a farmer engaged in paddy cultivation. His brother goes to university for study. 

He owns a bicycle repairing store in a market near to his house. His brother and father help him in this activity. Manoj earns 3,000 INR per month from this shop.

Manoj is unable to keep costly bicycle parts as he does not have enough money to invest in this shop, so he needs financial support. Manoj has requested a loan amount of 30,000 INR per to purchase spare parts for bicycles. In the future, he wants to open a shop where he could sell new bicycles.

He is very grateful to Kiva for this kind help.

loans.use: To purchase spare bicycle parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy footwear and adult clothes to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: para la compra de insumos agrícolas, mantenimiento y limpia de sus cultivos de granos basicos

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies and to look after her coffee crops.

loans.name: Nirupama

texts.en:
Nirupama is a 22-year-old differently able woman who lives with her husband and parents-in-law in a small village of the Dhenkanal district of Odisha state, India. She is engaged in mushroom and vegetable cultivation. Her husband is a farmer and he produces rice. Her husband helps her in this activity. Currently, Nirupama earns 4,000 INR per month from her livelihood, which is used in monthly household expenses.

Nirupama has a three-acre farming area where she produces mushrooms and vegetables and sells them in the market. Nirupama wants to take farming land on rent so she could produce more mushrooms and vegetables. For this she has applied for a loan amount of 20,000 INR.

She is very happy and grateful to Kiva for this kind help.

loans.use: To pay rent for farming land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies and sow more corn.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is a 32-year-old married man who has one child. He describes himself to be trustworthy. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a very busy area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of enough capital. 

Anthony will use the 15,000 KES loan to buy more stock of clothes. His business goal is to be prosperous within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Lien, 57, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a driver for hire.

Lien has been running a food stall in front of her house for twenty years. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more variety of food products to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and to set aside savings for facing difficulties in the future.

loans.use: to buy more variety of food products to sell from her stall

loans.name: Trang

texts.en: Trang is requesting a new loan to buy sewing tools, sewing equipment and canvas materials to make hammocks. Trang's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sewing tools, sewing equipment and canvas materials to make hammocks

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a farmer from Bohol, Philippines. She is a married woman and a mother of three children. Jocelyn has been in the vegetable farming business with her husband for more than five years now. This is the source of her income.

Jocelyn is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and a sprayer. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm thus augmenting her harvest and yield. Jocelyn's dream is to expand her business so that it will generate more income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and a sprayer

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe TIESSIRI est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Kalake Bamana, commune de Kalake préfecture de Barouéli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréale, de jarre d’habillement, de galette et de gâteau. Les femmes du groupe TIESSIRI sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente FANTA la personne au milieu dans le rang assis est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de gâteau. Elle compte acheter 1 sac de farine boulangère, 20 litres d’huile et du bicarbonate chez les grossistes à Barouéli, puis le transforme en gâteau de bonne qualité. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et parfois ambulante a une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 10 000FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour assurer les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Tiessiri Group is made up of married women who average 39 years of age and four children. They all live in traditional families in Kalake Bamana, in the municipality of Kalake, Barouéli Prefecture, Ségou Region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They got to know each other through bonds of kinship, community, and friendship. They sell cereals, jars, clothes, pancakes, and cakes. In order to meet a very high customer demand, they are seeking help from Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso.

They are seeking their fifth solidarity loan (group loan). The money will be used to buy the supplies previously mentioned.

Fanta is the woman in the middle of the sitting row in the photograph. She's illiterate and, at this time, she sells cake. She intends to buy 1 sack of bakery flour, 20 liters of cooking oil, and bicarbonate from wholesalers in Barouéli. She will then transform these ingredients into good-quality cakes.

She sells retail and for cash, at her home and, sometimes, as a traveling saleswoman, to a mixed-gender clientele. She intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 10'000 (ca US$ 20), to be used to cover the daily expenses of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make cakes

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 25-year-old married woman who has one child. She describes herself to be sincere and focused. She operates a farm where she grows potatoes and carrots. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a productive place and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. 

Virginia will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs. Her business goal is to expand greatly within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to invest further in the business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Duc

texts.en:
Duc is 57 years old and married with one son. He lives with his family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. He and his wife earn income through running a drink stand. 

Duc started his business fifteen years ago. He intends to take a loan to gradually expand his business by buying new furniture and a quantity of soft drinks to better satisfy his customers. 

Duc hopes his business runs smoothly and will help him to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new furniture and a quantity of soft drinks

loans.name: Duoc

texts.en:
Duoc, 59, is widowed and has two children:  a son and a daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She earns an income running a food stall in front of her house. 

She started this business 28 years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of food products, in particular beverages, to stock her stall and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and generates a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of food products, in particular beverages, to stock her stall

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is a Guatemalan artisan who specializes in hand-carved wooden serveware. He would like to invest in the purchase of cedar and cypress woods for production.

Victor has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is his story:

"I work in wood. Like many people who work in this craft, I had a difficult childhood that helped me become a man who strives to get ahead. We don't use complicated or modern tools, just a lathe, a band saw, a drill and a polisher. Right after the terrible earthquake of 1976, there was just no money in Guatemala and I had to go to Honduras to sell my designs. Thank God, we were able to keep the workshop and get through those tough times.

"To the friends who support me, thank you very much for this microcredit. I'll be able to stock up on the wood I need since it's my prime material, which will keep me working for a long time and on more products."

Use the link below to view Victor's hand-carved wooden serveware on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8558

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of cedar and cypress woods for production

loans.name: Le

texts.en:
Le is a 27-year-old single woman. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She runs a business selling cosmetic products for people in her community.

Le would like a loan to purchase better quality cosmetic products. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase better quality cosmetic products to better satisfy her customers

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a 63-year-old married woman who has six children. She describes herself to be honest and focused. She operates a green grocery where she sells tomatoes, bananas and oranges. She has been involved in this business for 30 years. Her business is located in a busy and productive place and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. 

Julia will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs to grow the products she sells. This will enable her to increase production. Her business goal is to expand greatly within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to cater to her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs to grow the products she sells

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 48-year-old married woman. She has three children ranging in age from 14 to 18 years. She describes herself to be persistent. She operates a retail business where she sells potatoes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in an area with an available market and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of adequate running capital. 

Amina will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of potatoes. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be independent. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to build a shed for the business stall.

loans.use: to buy more stock of potatoes

loans.name: Karanke's Group

texts.fr:
Ces deux femmes sont issues du même quartier. Elles sont unies par de bonnes relations sociales économiques et professionnelles. Madame Karanké la représentante est âgée de 61 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de huit enfants  dont quatre garçons. Elle est assise à gauche de la photo . 

Elle s'active dans le domaine du commerce. Son nouveau crédit de trois cent soixante quinze mille franc cfa lui permettra de se procurer de la marchandises pour sa boutique . Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettront de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires et sanitaires de ses enfants mais également de renforcer ses épargnes au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
These two women come from the same neighborhood. They are bound by good social, economic, and business relationships. Mrs. Karanké, age 61, is the group's representative. She's sitting on the left in the photograph. She's married and the mother of eight children, four of them boys.

She's a merchant. Her new loan of XOF 375'000 will enable her to get supplies for her store. The generated profits will enable her to cover her children's food and health needs, but also to strengthen her savings at the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, oil, and sugar to resell

loans.name: Linh

texts.en:
Linh is a 44-year-old married woman. She lives with three children and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a laborer for hire. For 14 years, she has run a business selling beverages for people in her community.

Linh would like a loan to purchase beverages and furniture for her shop. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase beverages and furniture for her shop

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor is a Peruvian artisan who creates beautiful apparel and throws in Andean alpaca wool. He wants to buy yarn in the colors of this season's fashion trends for production.

Nestor has been selling through NOVICA since 2002. This is his story:

"I hail from Peru's Puno region, renowned for quality alpaca and sheep wool. When I first began to weave, I worked on the rustic looms I built along with other family members. We sold our wares at local markets until we were able to acquire modern machinery, which in turn allowed us to develop newer designs.
