"My thanks to all of you who are collaborating in this wonderful gesture. With your help, I'll be able to buy materials for this entire year, specially dyed in the colors of my new designs. Muchas gracias!"

Use the link below to view Nestor's alpaca apparel and throws on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/3463

loans.use: to buy yarn in the colors of this season's fashion trends for production

loans.name: Tam

texts.en:
Tam is 55 years old and married with three children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a deliveryman. Tam earns income through running a seafood selling business.

Tam started her business twenty years ago. She intends to take a loan to expand her business by buying a greater quantity and variety of food and seafood to sell to her customers. 

Tam hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of food and seafood to sell

loans.name: Hua

texts.en:
Hua, 59, is married and lives with one son and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn an income running a food and beverage stall. Hua started this business ten years ago. 

Hua is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying many kinds of soft drinks to stock her stall. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover in her business. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest to her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy many kinds of soft drinks to stock her stall

loans.name: Chuong

texts.en:
Chuong is a 59-year-old single woman. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. For 10 years, she has run a general store in her community.

Chuong would like a loan to purchase a variety of different products and household items to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of different basic products and household items to stock her general store

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria from Peru is an artisan who specializes in the traditional art of arpilleria (appliqué). She would like to invest in the purchase of larger amounts of fabrics to keep in stock throughout the year for continuous production.

Maria has been selling through NOVICA since 2007. This is her story:

"I joined a women's group to learn textile arts. At first, we'd create our patchwork wall hangings from old clothes. One day, with the little bit of money we each could contribute, we bought bolts of fabric and spools of yarn and thread. With these materials, we created our first pieces to sell."

"I would like to send you a big thanks from the bottom of my heart -- it's comforting to know there are people like you out there on whom one can count on. Your microcredit fills us with happiness and it also encourages us to keep on doing what we enjoy doing."

Use the link below to view Maria's arpilleria (appliqué) art on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/6118

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of larger amounts of fabrics to keep in stock throughout the year for continuous production

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is 71 years old and married with one son. She supports her family by selling soft drinks and tobacco in the local community. She would like to borrow a loan to increase the working capital for her business, which will enable her to buy a larger quantity of beverages to sell from her stall.

She hopes that through the loan, she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of beverages to sell from her stall

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra vive en casa propia con su esposo e hijos en la ciudad de La Paz. Ella trabaja como abogada en una institucion donde percibe un sueldo minimo, el esposo tambien trabaja, ambos con su sueldo mantienen su hogar.

El credito que solicita es para la refacciion de su vivienda, ya que su padre le cedio un departamento pero ella debe correr con los gastos de reparacion, colocado de puertas, ventanas y otros.

El sueño de Sandra es poder terminar su casa y darles comodidad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sandra lives in her own home with her husband and children in the city of La Paz. She works as a lawyer in an institution where she receives a minimum salary. Her husband also works. Together with his income they maintain their household.

The loan that she is requesting is to repair her housing, as her father gave her an apartment but she has to pay for the expenses for repairing the doors, windows, etc.

Her dream is to be able to finish her home and give comfort to her children.

loans.use: to do housing repairs to doors and windows.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a 53-year-old married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be focused and sincere. She operates a farm where she grows potatoes, carrots and peas for selling. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in a busy and productive area, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough inputs to improve production. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs to enable her to increase production. Her business goal is to expand within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to invest further in the business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs to enable her to increase production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing food for selling

loans.name: Duong

texts.en:
Duong, 28, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including two sons and her husband. Duong and her husband earn money through their business of processing metal parts. 

She would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of metal to make metal parts to the specifications of her customers. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her children, will have a better education and a better future

loans.use: to buy metals to produce metal parts to sell

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is a 31-year-old married woman. She has two children with ages 4 years and 12 years. She describes herself to be persistent. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a highly populated place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of adequate capital to expand. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more stock of clothes for sale. Her business goal is to have a bigger shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be independent. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to start another business of selling shoes.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes for selling

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 43 ans, et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Baba, commune de Baba, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de céréale, et de beurre de karité. Les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur septième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO. 
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente SOKOURA la personne au milieu dans le rang debout n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse de grain de maïs. Elle compte acheter 2 sac de maïs sur place avec chez les paysans du village. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce au marché hebdomadaire à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 12 000 Fcfa qui sera utilisé pour assurer les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Benkadi Group is made up of married women who average 43 years of age and five children. They all live in traditional families in Baba, a village in the municipality of Baba, Dioïla Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They got to know each other through bonds of kinship, community, and friendship. They run food serving businesses, and sell cereals and shea butter. 

In order to meet a very high customer demand, they are seeking help from Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso. They are seeking their seventh solidarity loan (group loan). The money will be used to buy the supplies previously mentioned.

Sokoura is the woman in the middle of the standing row in the photograph. She never received an education and she currently sells corn. She intends to buy two sacks of corn from local farmers in the village.

She sells retail and for cash at the weekly market, to a mixed-gender clientele. She intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 12'000 (ca US$ 25), to be used to cover her family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of corn

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DANAYA est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 38 ans, et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Fala Sounkoro, commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de céréale, et de condiment. Les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO. 
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente SOKONE  la première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang debout n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse de riz. Elle compte acheter 50 kg riz chez les grossistes à Massigui. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce, chez elle, à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 9.000 Fcfa qui sera qui sera utilisé pour assurer les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Danaya Group is made up of married women who average 38 years of age and four children. They all live in traditional families in Fala Sounkoro, in the municipality of Massigui, Dioïla Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They got to know each other through bonds of kinship, community, and friendship. They run food serving businesses, and sell cereals and condiments. In order to meet a very high customer demand, they are seeking help from Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso. They are seeking their third solidarity loan (group loan). The money will be used to buy the supplies previously mentioned.

Sokone is the first woman from the right in the standing row in the photograph. She never received an education and is currently a rice seller. She intends to buy 50 kg or rice from wholesalers in Massigui.

She sells retail and for cash, at her home, to a mixed-gender clientele. She intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 9'000 (ca US$ 18) to be used to cover the daily expenses of her family.

loans.use: to buy 50 kg of rice

loans.name: Roselyne

texts.en:
Roselyne is a 25-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 1 year to 8 years. She describes herself to be humble. She operates a retail business where she sells drinks and other snacks. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in an urban area. 

She will use the 30,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy a cooler for keeping drinks for sale. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be happy. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to build a business stall.

loans.use: to buy a cooler for keeping drinks for sale

loans.name: Xiomara Francisca

texts.es: Xiomara tiene cuatro hijos, dos de sus hijos  estudian en la escuela comunitaria, dice que ella  quiere que sus hijos estudien para que se defiendan en la vida . su esposo y ella se dedican a la agricultura siembran granos básicos y café de lo que recogen de la cosecha lo venden y otra parte la dejan para consumo de la casa .  en la comunidad de nombre el venado que es donde habitan luz eléctrica no hay pues están bien retirados entonces por las noches lo que usan es candelas pero desean ya tener luz en en su hogar ya que el uso de candelas es peligroso por algún incendio o que los niños se quemen es por eso que desea un préstamo para mejorar la condición de vida de todos los integrantes de su familia en especial la de sus pequeños hijos
texts.en: Xiomara has four children. Two of her children go to the community school. She says that she wants her children to go to school so that they can define themselves in life. She and her husband work in agriculture. They plant basic grains and coffee. They sell part of what they harvest and keep the rest for household consumption. The community where they live, called El Venado, doesn't have electricity because it is very remote. At night, they use candles, but they want electricity in their home, because using candles is dangerous because if there were a fire, they children could get burned. That is why she wants the loan to improve the whole family's quality of life, especially that of her young children.

loans.use: to by a solar panel system.

loans.name: Zymratkan

texts.ru: Зымраткан 29 лет. Совместно с супругом воспитывают двоих детей (1 дочь, 1 сын). В 2008 году, супруги начали бизнес в торговле обувью, используя в качестве стартового капитала сумму в 10,000 сом (KGS). Сумев развить свой бизнес и обретя постоянных клиентов, Зымраткан имеет среднемесячный доход в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего увеличения и расширения своего бизнеса, Зымраткан обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом - на увеличение товарооборота. Доходы от кредита Зымраткан планирует вложить в обучение своих детей.
texts.en: Zymratkan is 29 years. Together with her husband they are raising two children (one daughter, one son). In 2008, the couple started the business in footwear trading, using as start-up capital an amount of 10,000 som (KGS).  They managed to develop their business and establish regular customers, and now Zymratkan has an average income of 20,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to further improve and expand their businesses, Zymratkan reached out to "Bai-Tushum" for a loan to increase in the inventory of her goods.  Zymratkan plans to invest the income proceeds from the loan in the education of their children.

loans.use: to buy shoes wholesale for retail
